(Software will control and monitor up to 64 cameras on one screen).UPDATE: The apk it comes with for android is okay, but there are also free ipcam apps on the market that are compatible with these cams and work great, (audio too). Also, the night vision is surprisingly good. Just make sure you peel the white protective sticker off to reveal the chrome ring so the IR LED's get good light reflection.

Reviews.Title: Decent 802.11b/g PTZ webcam with nightvision (IR)
Reviews.Author: Naim Malik
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item and the Loftek CXS 2200 IP Camera  LOFTEK Newest CXS 2200 Wireless/Wired Pan:270°&Tilt;:120° Dual Audio Alarm Ip camera,15 Meter Night vision,3.6mm Lens ,67° Viewing Angle,easy installation.Blacktogether - after reading Amazon reviews - and they appear to be identical (user guide, CD, etc.) save for this camera having a shiny exterior, and the Loftek model having a dull non-reflective finish. If this matters to you and you want to shell out an additional $14-15, go ahead and get the Loftek, otherwise read on. My background is in PCs and networking with around (!) 25+ years of experience, so quite familiar with WIFI Access point and routers in addition to PC, MAC, and Linux. For this review, I just used my Windows XP laptop.Get an NTP servers DNS name (the Wansview has a default for US customers, but the NIST recommendation is to change it to a regional entry). This ensures the all timestamps are accurate.IF you intend to send email messages when the camera alarms, then you will need the Yahoo, Gmail, other SMPT servers outgoing SMTP address (Yahoo example: Outgoing Mail Server (SMTP) - smtp.mail.yahoo.com (port 25). Different ports and settings for Yahoo Plus and Gmail!!Save the settings and then use the Test button (nice!) to test if you can send outbound email. Note that the camera sends the MAC address with the SMTP (email) messages, this can be changed during configuration.IF you want to send images to an FTP server or Alarm server, you will need the information to connect to those as well, including username, password and the right syntax to connect to the FTP server. In my setup I will send images off-site to an FTP server to save them in case the bad guys break into my place. At least I will have nice mug shots for the cops.Decide if you want to use a DHCP provided address from your WIFI AP or you want to assign a fixed IP address to the unit. I chose a fixed address outside the DHCP pool addresses in my DD-WRT firmware router. DHCP is OK, but much less convenient if you want to get access to your camera from outside the firewall, i.e., over the Internet. This requires changes to your WIFI AP/Router (most of use have on unit with these functions). Also, get and save (write down) the default gateway and DNS server addresses.I disabled the WIFI, enabled the Ethernet port then I just plugged in the Wansview into my laptops Ethernet port with the CAT5 Ethernet cable that came in the box - after setting the TCP/IP Alternate Configuration to use the 192.168.0.X address to match the cameras default 192.168.0.178 address; rebooting the laptop (as Windows XP recommended; WIN7 & Vista experience may be different) wait for Windows to default to the Alternate configuration (after no DHCP server is found) in TCP/IP General tab. This takes a few minutes. Then enter the cameras default IP (192.168.0.178) and log in using the default admin/123456 password (noted on the bottom of the camera).Set a new admin username and password with some strong password features - one that you can remember/write it down someplace!  Log out and log back in with the new admin account you set (NOT a Visitor account!). This tests if your privileges work. Lastly, change the default admin user's password!! Save these settings.Select DHCP or Assign a new IP address, Gateway, and subnet mask (typically, but not always 255.255.255.0; yes, you need this info up front!). If you plan on using WIFI, instead of wired Ethernet, you will also need your WIFI AP's setup, like SSID, WEP/WPA/WPA2, and whether your AP is setup to use AES, or something else. And, yes, you will need the password!When you make certain changes to the IP address/DHCP and WIFI setup the Wansview may reboot to save the new settings. Keep in mind once you SAVE the new IP address/WIF AP settings the unit will reboot and you wont be able to connect to it using the default 192.168.0.178 (Or other IP address prior to the change)!If you make a mistake - like I did in assigning an inappropriate address (in the DHCP pool) or turning on DHCP in the DHCP pool address range, the unit may be hard to talk to again! I tried two restore to factory defaults, i.e., resets (with a paper clip inserted into recessed hole on the bottom of the unit - do NOT use a lead pencil, the graphite filings may cause a short), but not all the settings seemed to clear.. had to look up the DHCP address from the router's DHCP list in DD-WRT; your router's DHCP list may be harder or easier to find/use.The camera image flip (when you mount the camera upside down, like in a window sill) is a nice option in the functionality of the camera as are the PTZ controls. The bottom of the camera get quite warm during operation.I purchased a Mr Beams 3D battery powered light with motion sensor (from Amazon) to shed light for the camera to take a nice mug shots of would be burglars outside my windows.The bright LED light casts a light on the subjects, and counteracts the IR bouncing off the window pane and leaving no usable images otherwise (normal for IR). Other forms of IR illumination mounted outside are expensive, and were not options for me- but may be options for you.Set your Alarms and then test it all, to make sure it functions as intended.Enjoy the fruits of your labor! Amazon shipped fast!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Live4God4Ever
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price.  It's wired or wireless, it tilts and swivels, it comes with a mounting bracket, it can mount upside down, you can access it from your iPhone/iPod, and it is inexpensive.  The night vision works great.  So far I've had no problems at all with it and a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Wireless IP Night Vision camera
Reviews.Author: John P. Duda
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price. Excellent pan function and audio. will purchase more. Installation was a snap. Plug and play.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and use
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a way to watch my CNC machine progress from upstairs.  The picture quality is good (not the best, but after all it very inexpensive).  It quickly and easily connected to my wireless network (can't use a non-broadcasting network).  The night vision is way better then I expected.

Reviews.Title: works great on mac
Reviews.Author: F. Parro
Reviews.Content: (mac people, read on this has a good ending for you) After reading reviews that spoke of how tricky it was to install on a mac and how a "mini" cd that came with it wouldn't work in a mac, I started researching everything I could about methods to set up the camera for wireless.  I have better than average computer skills and took it as a challenge.  Shipping was quick, packaging was easy to open.  I hunted around the house for an unused ethernet cable to use for set up.  When I found one, I opened the box and viola, they provided one with the camera!  I should have taken this as a sign that wansview has stepped up their game a little.  I didn't. I sat the disk aside without noticing it is a full size disk now.  I opened up my router set up, dug around for the ip of the new camera and really worked like crazy for two hours, following every bit of advice I had read from reviews and websites about this camera with a mac. No luck, it was there on my network, but all I got was a response from the camera in my browser window that "it works".  I gave up for a few hours and did a funny thing. I looked at the disk, that I assumed was windows only.  It didn't read in my mac so I popped it in a windows laptop.  Surprise, there was a mac install folder on the disk! I copied that folder onto a thumb drive and ran on the mac.  Ta-da!the set up was done in a minute, all I had to do was double click on the set-up and double click again. Done. Would the disk have worked in my mac if I tried it again? I don't know. But if I had not set my self up for this being hard and just looked at the disk, I would have been done with set up, wireless set up and port forwarding for remote access in about 20 minutes. Access from a web works fine on safari and firefox, IE has a few more features.  I couldn't make head or tails of the wansview iphone app, but between the free ip cam app and the one for a couple bucks, the paid one allowed me to use the pan,tilt feature from my phone.  very cool. The picture is very clear, even with the camera pointed out the window to outside. Some colors of distant objects in bright sun were not totally accurate, but hey; I'll take two of these over one of the others.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera with a a few gotchas
Reviews.Author: Jonathon E. Smith
Reviews.Content: User justchill has some excellent advice in his review - please read it. That said I had my own set of gotchas.  I am an experienced electronics and IT guy and this thing gave me a couple of moments.  First off the vertical axis was assembled incorrectly on the "wrong" side of the motion stops.  It would only travel one way.  Knowing the only option was to return and swap I went ahead and rotated it by hand past the stops which is usually a big no-no as the stops can be damaged.  I got lucky and the unit worked fine after that.Getting the unit online was a hassle.  For whatever reason the PC search program would not find the unit on my network in spite of ensuring it was on the same router - never did and STILL doesn't after getting it setup properly.  Turns out my MacBook found it easily using the Macintosh find app on the CD - except the provided CD is not in a format the Mac will read!  I had to copy it to a thumbdrive on my PC and run it that way.  Luckily it worked and I discovered that the unit has a default IP of 192.168.0.1 which you should be able to type into the browser as [...]and it will bring up the unit's web server.  This IP *should* be on the bottom of the unit but it was not, nor was it mentioned in the docs - although it is alluded to in the screen captures that show it as 192.168.0.178.After the hassle of just getting it to work and then finding it on the network it was a piece of cake to set up.  It works well, good quality video.  It works well with port forwarding to view across the internet.  There is an app on Android that works very well to control all features from your smart phone or tablet.The alarms could use some work.  When set up to send emails it attaches 5 pictures.  I would love for this to be adjustable but I understand it is to minimize bandwidth and processing.  It would also be nice if it would save video clips to a local drive but in fact I see no way to save video at all which is a disappointment.  I'm guessing there is some PC or Mac software out there that can do this but there are no links or hints in the manual or CD.Overall I'm pleased but only because it's so dang cheap.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Dewayne A. Robey
Reviews.Content: This item works just as it was described. I was able to set it up on my AT&T; U-Verse network. I had to search for instructions on allowing access from outside of my network, but that was easy to find via the web. The package for installing it on my Android phone is quirky, but I can still access it via the web via my phone.

Reviews.Title: Way better than I imagined
Reviews.Author: Jim P. Mutdosch
Reviews.Content: I hooked it up to my router with cable and installed software provided. I then clicked on the icon on my desktop and it logged me into the cameras IP address through internet explorer. I then setup the wireless settings in the interface to connect to my wireless network and applied. As it rebooted I unplugged the cable. It then connected wireless. You can connect to the camera from any computer in the house using that IP address and a username "admin". I changed the password. I also use the App called Camviewer on my iPhone to view and control my camera. This is the best $60 I ever spent in my life...or at least the best value for the money...Plus there is no monthly fees or other cost. Whats not to love. Its great to watch your kids or animals when your away. Also another great software program to get that gives it a lot more features is called ISpy.Update..I have bought two of these...They work great but the first one like to reboot once in awhile for no reason and when it does that it movies in all directions as it resets and never back to the regional location. That's how I can tell it rebooted if not noticing it actually doing it. But for $60 I will put up with it.

Reviews.Title: Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera...
Reviews.Author: Jimmerz48
Reviews.Content: Ideal for someone who want's to keep track of things at anytime you wish to. However they're a bit more technical than what I was ready for. The instructions are vague at best...they tell you what to do but not HOW, but I've already found a use for them. The pan/tilt/night vision system works well, but the motor that does all of that really makes a lotta noise, I mean I'm deaf in one ear and can't hear out of the other and I can detect them from 50' or more. Would I recommend them? Only if they fixed the noise and clairified the instructions better.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Works with Linux (enough)
Reviews.Author: G. Brockett "SJ"
Reviews.Content: I received my camera today and set it up within minutes.I run a WPA secured network and use Linux for my main computer.I connected the device to the network, (wired) and ran the BSearch_en.exe via wine. It found the device easily and I was able to set it to the preferred address, then logged in with Chromium and was able to set the Wireless up. unplugged the network cable and was up and running.I also easily set it up to save regular images to my FTP server, and it saves images when there is a motion trip.All in all, very good value for the money. I would not put it outside, but it works very well indoors.Update 10 months later: Still working well. No problems. During vacation, I move the camera inside to make dure someone is dropping by to check on the cats. The camera maintains it's settings during power outages without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: Great ip Camera, easy set-up, best price
Reviews.Author: Milocyw
Reviews.Content: Great ip camera, easy to set up  if you have a static ip address.But even if you have a dynamic ip, follow the instruction on this youtube video, you will be fine.Search: TRENDnet DIY: Viewing IP Camera over Internet on YouTubeThe quality of the image is acceptable, not great but clear enough.The night vision is better than I thought.I use it to make sure my noisy roommate won't go into my room when I am out.I could now view the camera on laptop and my smart phone(android).I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: fantastic product for this price
Reviews.Author: Lujiang Xue
Reviews.Content: This is a great IP cam for the price. works even better with android/iphone app.I bought this cam mainly for look at my daughter (9 month) during the night. the IR works great(with a faint red), tilt/pan motor is almost silent.

Reviews.Title: Cannot be beat for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Adams
Reviews.Content: First off, yes, this camera will require a good understanding of basic networking to set up and to access it remotely.  The configuration options in the camera allow all these changes to be made rather easily.That being said here are the benefits:- smaller than i thought it would be- configuration method through web browser interface without proprietary software or plugins- motion trigger sensitivity adjustments- scheduling capability for motion trigger events- emails images quickly when motion triggered- very agile in pan / tilt- great quality for simple surveillance (640x480)- refresh rate is fast- full functionality with Android IP camera appsAbout my setup:One camera is on my wireless for remote placement in a room, the other on hardwire and battery backup (along with the router and cable modem) aimed into my backyard through a window.  If the hardwire is unplugged the camera will default to wireless.  As i have two cameras i needed to change the port numbers so that i could access them.  port 80 is blocked with a different service but you can assign virtually any number you want then access it from a public network using your modem's IPaddress:port I.E. [...]I have the cameras configured to send me an email via gmail using smtp.gmail.com on port 587 using STARTTLS that way i never have to worry about a hard drive in a DVR crashing and i will have the emailed images to forward to authorities should anything happen.For remote viewing i use my computer's web browser when i can or view it on my phone using IP Cam Viewer Lite available for free in the Android Marketplace.  the camera allows full pan and tilt control via the app which is good as the web interface doesn't work on my phone's browser.

Reviews.Title: wireless surveillance camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Harshman
Reviews.Content: Setup much easier than expected. for the price it can't be beat. in bright sunlight the colors are somewhat washed out. other than that the camera gets four stars !

Reviews.Title: Great Transaction...Good experience
Reviews.Author: Anh Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Great product and good price.  I have been enjoying watching my kids after school while my wife and I are working from the office.  The seller is great, I will surely buy from this seller again in future.

Reviews.Title: Works okay, just costs too much for what it actually is
Reviews.Author: B. Johnson
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to keep an eye on our kids downstairs in their toy room when we were upstairs.  The little munchkins got ahold of the camera a couple of times before we got it mounted and now we can't pan up or down at all.  The gears stripped really easily which is disappointing.  I will get a less expensive camera when we get one for outside, especially since the install was a nightmare (my husband is a savvy IT man) and it took him quite awhile to get it set-up. It also has a lot of problems staying connected to the internet and it's the only product in our home that has this problem.  So while it's okay, I won't purchase another one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, no problems
Reviews.Author: B. A Wobbe "TreoLover"
Reviews.Content: I just received the camera yesterday, It's the Wansview model. I've had no problems, it even came with mac software. It had the microphone and a speaker hook up. I had it set up in 10 minutes. So far so good. I didn't experience any of the problems described in the other posts. This was a very easy setup and usage. I give it only 4 stars due to the really poor documentation.

Reviews.Title: bad product
Reviews.Author: Bandit
Reviews.Content: pretty bad video quality, colors look a little dull in color and the video you record is always jumpy & not steady and i know my router can handle it cause everything else in my house works just fine, this is the only thing that jumps around like this. one more thing if you think you are going to record night shots out of a window don't all you see is the lights on the front of it making night recording imposable

Reviews.Title: great IP Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Chris Swiontek
Reviews.Content: Pros--pretty basic to setup to a network {if you know what portforwarding is=)-well packaged-REALLY GOOD WIFI RANGE! {I WAS ACTUALLY IMPRESSED} i got 13-15fps over wifi at 175' away {not to shabby=)-quiet/smooth movement of pan and tilt .-clean image on video-pretty decent night vision {clean and bright to about 30'}and the best feature of all......  YOU CAN EASILY ADD THIS CAMERA TO AN EXISTING FOSCAM SETUP, AND IT JUST WORKS!THE mapping and config of this is compatable with foscams ptz{ if the first camera you dial into is a foscam,you can go under "add devices" and it will pick up these cameras,and the fos interface will control them just fine=)i use these alot when i just need to add an extra cam or 2 to an actual foscam setup.Cons--feels a little cheap {its actually really good,its just that the plastic feel cheap}overall, a really great buy! i will definately be ordering some more of these=)

Reviews.Title: Great value - poor sound -  Some basic networking skill req'd for setup/troubleshooting
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: If you know how to configure a home network then this camera works great. Great value for money, I feel, so 4 stars. Really need one with better audio though.Some things that I was able to work around for this low cost unit:- My brand was "Agasio"- You must connect via wired first to setup security for wireless (obviously)- Its first 10 reboots (while I was playing with its settings) were very slow. But towards the end somewhere they sped up. My theory is that this thing was reaching out to home base for firmware or something (little scary), but I have no evidence to prove this.- I also needed to let it do whatever it was doing before iOS Safari or ios apps would attach. Even over LAN. After whichever reboot it was, they just started working, and before that reboot they didn't work at all.- Best Ios app is the FREE "camviewer" - set this camera up as foSCAM. Maybe they just realized that their name had SCAM in it and started re-branding.Things that I haven't resolved:- WEIRDEST THING: every time this thing reboots my router registered this via DHCP with a different MAC address (over wireless at least). I went with a static IP address.- WORST FEATURE: Sound from camera to the PC / ipad / iphone is pretty bad hissing on it. I haven't tried via Wired connection, but this is through 1 floor with some insulation, but only ~7 feet total distance from Dlink N Xtreme router.- 2nd WORST FEATURE: Firmware download not available on Agasio web site (or anywhere). Site says coming soon.- Their DDNS didn't work - I used my own setup via dlink's ddns.- You must provide your own external speaker for 2 way sound

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: drpower
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a few days and really like it. I use it on Macs, IPad and IPhone. Some of the features are lost on the Mac but it still works great. I wanted to also say that when setting up on a Mac you don't need access to a Windows machine. I was able to connect to it directly with a crossover cable and change the settings from there.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but..
Reviews.Author: D. Holley
Reviews.Content: It does come with a manual that tells how to set the camera up wirelessly, but the print is so small, that I had to actually use a magnifying glass to read it. I'm not a beginner when it comes to all things electronic, but the camera is not for the novice to set up quickly. It will take some time and patience, which I don't have much of.

Reviews.Title: Very good value - happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: C. Walsh
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried based on a couple of the reviews, but this was surprisingly easy to set up and use.  I had it up and running and was viewing on my iPad in less than 20 minutes, and that included the time to open the amazon box.  The manual that came with it is tiny and impossible to read, but I found their website and a downloadable Word document with ease.  It works like a charm and now I can confirm that my dog really does sleep all day!!  I will note that I'm having some trouble with the Android phone app.  I haven't taken the time to trouble shoot, so that functionality might not be what I had hoped.  However, the other units in the ~$60 price range didn't offer it anyway, so I'm not going to detract much for that.  If the phone app had worked, it would have been 5 stars for sure.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Travtail
Reviews.Content: We received the camera and had a little bit of a hard time connecting it to our network at first. The software that came with it was the wrong version. We downloaded the the next higher version and it connected right away. Just follow the instructions.  Then the wireless worked.  It was easy after that, we looked up port forwarding and enabled an outside IP. Now I can view it from my Iphone from safari and IPcam lite. I also enabled the email notify, and created an account just for the pictures it sends when it senses movement. I can see any movement that happens in my driveway/carport throughout the night. For the price, it is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Very good, simple and practical
Reviews.Author: Motassem
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, simple and practical camera that tilts and turns... yet still trying to set it up to broadcast whereby I can view from outside the house... Catalogue and guide are very discriptive but it's my fault not having it yet in place.Light in weight and generates a great picture in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Wow, I'm impressed.
Reviews.Author: Warren T. Trollinger "KingDork"
Reviews.Content: I've read the bad reviews on this camera but I also read the good reviews and took a chance. I received the Wansview product shown.I got the camera working, over cat 5, setup port forwarding in the router, updated the camera's firmware. I had allot of trouble with setting up the camera over wi-fi, but the software included showed me that I simply had the ip address off by one digit. I am not sure why that is at all, but I am thankful I noticed the software included found the camera over the network when nothing else would. It didn't seem to be able to connect, but that was my mistake. Now I am able to plug the camera in anywhere within wireless range and use it.I need to test it further with e-mail and motion sensing, but the e-mail test worked with gmail.Software CD was great, even had phone apps for the software including java. Nice.Instructions are hard to understand, I e-mailed support, and they replied promptly though they didn't seem to understand my question. Language barrier.Don't expect an awesome picture, you won't get it. If you want a better camera, order the foscams, I just bought this camera to practice setting up a small security network. I was a bit impressed by the night vision, it does indeed work.I could not be happier with the camera, it works as advertised so far, and I will update this review as needed with further testing.The great thing about these cameras is they don't need a running pc to work once you set them up, they work on their own in conjunction with the router, exactly what they are supposed to do, and for the price, it deserves five stars for now.Package also includes wall mounting hardware.

Reviews.Title: Setup a pain
Reviews.Author: T. Bruce Murkerson
Reviews.Content: I finally got my IP Camera setup.  Something to note, if you use a range other than 192.168.0.x for your IP address, you will have to change the IP address of your PC to that range before the BSearch_EN.exe or Dev_Find.exe would be able to find your device.  I use 192.168.1.X, so on Windows 7, I had to go to Control Panel; Network and Sharing Center; Click on the network connection you are using (Wireless Network Connection for me); Details will show you the IPv4 address that you are using, click close if you are not in the 192.168.0.x range; click Properties; click Internet Protocol Version 4(TCP/IPv4; click Properties;***Take note of your setting here, you will have to change your pc back, after you get the device setup***click use the following IP address; for IP address type 192.168.0.20, for subnet mask type 255.255.255.0; Click OK, OK, Close.  You will be in the 192.168.0.x range.  Use the BSearch_EN.exe or Dev_Find.exe to find your camera.  Set the camera to the range you were in before the change.  If your address was 192.168.1.100, then change your camera to 192.168.1.x.  The x must be different than other devices on your network and between 0 and 255.  Once you update the settings on you device, you will lose your connection to it, until you go back and set your setting to the original settings.  After you are back with the original settings, go to an internet browser and type the IP address that you assigned to your device, then a colon, and then the port number you assigned ([....]) if you set the x in the IP to 80 and set your port to 1026.  Hope this helps with setup problems.I got the alarm and e-mail setup and seems to work pretty good.  Picture quality could be better though!

Reviews.Title: Very good device, with a few software flaws
Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: The hardware is first rate.  The image quality is good, the motors are smooth and quiet, and the night vision works much better than I expected.  (It also survived an 8-foot drop during a mounting mishap, with no damage.)The integrated web interface is adequate, but there are some missing and broken features.  For example, I never did figure out a way to set a static IP in wireless mode and had to use DHCP (wired works fine with either static or dynamic).  There doesn't seem to be any way to turn off the infrared illuminators -- which means if you point the cam out a window all you'll see is reflected glare!  The viewing modes for mobile-phone browsers are missing any way to change the image size, which can be an important feature if you're on a slow cell-data connection and you last left the camera at full resolution.  Also, when the camera is configured with a flipped image (for mounting it upside-down on a ceiling), the pan-tilt controls are backwards in the mobile-browser modes, even though they're correct in the IE and Firefox/Chrome modes.The camera plays nicely with non-Windows OSes, but do be aware that some features (like recording and sound) use ActiveX, so they're IE-only.  But all the basics are fine on a Linux machine, and my Android phone can use either its web browser or one of the IP cam viewer apps out there.  None of the software on the CD is actually necessary to set up the camera if you're comfortable with basic IP addressing.All nitpicks aside, this is a solid device that does what I need, at a pretty fantastic price.  It loses one star for its severe lack of polish on the software side of things, but overall I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Recycled Reject
Reviews.Author: Richard Boyd
Reviews.Content: Having read most of the reviews here, and then ordering one of these cameras anyway, here is my experience with it, and why I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA! Unless you have some extra bucks to throw away and enjoy a challenge. IMHO, I believe that these cameras are rejects that the various vendors are just buying on the cheap, and then sending them back out as new. Said vendors are counting on the buyer settling for being suckered, or finding a way to make it work. I also think most of the positive reviews for this camera are planted by the vendors.The camera arrived without any written documentation at all. It did have all the parts and hardware. It also had a little mini-cd with some helpful discovery, and display software, some configuration software that "sort of" works, and some comically written docs. It was labeled with an Agasio brand name, and not the Wansview I thought I was ordering. That right there, tells me it's a resold reject ... Never the less, I soldiered on.Be warned (again), I don't care what these "positive" reviews says. Installing this camera is not for the feint of heart, nor for the networking illiterate.I'm another one of these genius, professional networking guys, who earns his living managing and administering corporate wired and wireless LANs and WANs. I install and configure networking hardware of all classes, from the little home routers, access points, and switches, to the big enterprise firewalls, routers, bridges, AP's, etc. I do it 40 to 60 hours a week. Been doing it for a couple decades now. I only mention this to support the premise that I know my way around wireless (and wired) setups. I certainly know my own home network. It took me three days of "playing" with this thing to finally accept that this camera is not just tricky, but truly defective. The transceiver in the camera I have does, in fact, NOT work! So, if you have one that just works when directly connected, but does not work wirelessly, it isn't you or your router, or whatever. It's the camera!!I did get it working on my my wireless network, but had to connect it, via the ethernet port, to a radio device that is designed to be used in wireless networks to connect individual computers that have no wireless capability. It is now out in the garage monitoring the comings and goings of the cats that live out there, and watching for any two legged intruders too.I use Firefox, and/or the display program that came with the camera for viewing. It would never worked with Internet Explorer (even in compatibility mode). The email notification "tested" ok, but I have yet to receive a regular intruder email alert from the camera. I can also web into the camera from work without a problem.CONs: All the above ... and ... the audio dosn't work (don't think there is even a mic, or speaker in it). Picture is very bad quality (tried adjusting the lens, but only makes it worse). You can see movement and determine whether it's human or animal, but that's about it. It has a stupid, big, bright, blinking, green light that tells anyone "Hey, I'm a camera over her. Come vandalize, or steal me!" (I painted over it with black model paint, and then a small piece of duct tape).PROs: Not many ... BUT .. after a lot of kluging together other devices to make this camera work on my wireless lan, PAN AND TILT WORK GREAT (it's the only reason I gave it two stars, instead of one), and the infrared is both bright in a dark room, and unobtrusive (just make sure to paint over that idiotic, blinking, green spotlight).

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Becker
Reviews.Content: The camera works just as advertised.  As another reviewer noted you need to have some understanding of home networking to set it up.  But this is true of much of the consumer level camera/security equipment.+I am very happy with the clarity of the image.  The pan and tilt work great.The user interface is usable and I had no trouble setting it up locally.  One must be patient while waiting for it to find the local SSID for wireless.The setup process does guide you through the install.-The manual is tiny and I used my wifes 3.0 reading glasses to read it.  I do not normally use glasses.The manual has just enough info to setup, but not enough to use all the features.I could not find a pdf manual at the website easynp.com.  The html help file on the cd does not work either.The setup process asks for info that the average user will not know.Setting up remote access with the provided ddns did not work for me and the I ended up using dynddns.HintsUse a static ip for the camera not dns.  Do read the manual.Search you tube for helpful clipsWatch the videos on the cd (some sound would be nice).How do you get the camera to remain stationary in motion detect setting? It looks around and then points at the ceiling.I would buy again but need to figure out the stationary setting.

Reviews.Title: Do not recommend.  See updated review. (OLD TITLE:  No frills IP camera, could be better, but not bad for the price)
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: ****UPDATED REVIEW****Reduced to 1 star.Multiple attempts to get this working with the program "motion" on Ubuntu have failed.  I was able to extract the jpg URL from the web interface and have "motion" connect to the camera, but I could not get it to capture a complete image.  The pictures captured were corrupt jpgs (a portion of the picture appeared grey).My work on capturing images ended when this product began to fail completely.  First, the web interface would lock up (normally right after there something in the field of view moved).  Then it would fail to connect entirely.  Now, I cannot access the web interface at all and "motion" does not capture any images.  It took approximately 4 months for the camera to fail completely.Another negative on this camera.  Each camera has a dynamic DNS address associated with it - xxxXXXX.nwsvr.com (where xxx represents a 3 digit number and XXX 4 letters).  From what I remember, you cannot turn this off.  This could make it very easy for someone to identify IP addresses with cameras (just change one of the 3 digit numbers and there you go).  Given the relative simplicity of their web interface and security, it would not take long to write a little script that guesses the password on a given DDNS.  Meaning, there's a good chance someone could be watching you if you have one of these in your house (assuming your router is not blocking the port).  I didn't get a proof of concept working on this before the camera puked, but it was enough for me to go into my router and ensure ports were blocked to prevent this from communicating outside of my local network.I have not given up on the idea of using we cameras as a DYI security system.  But this camera (and the multiple re-branded versions of the same equipment) are off of my list.****ORIGINAL REVIEW****Originally 3 stars.Pros:- It is a $50 IP camera with pan, tilt, and night vision.- The IR "night vision" is fantastic for such a cheap camera.- The web "view" page gives you the functionality you need in a minimal interface.  Makes it quick and easy to manipulate the- The built in tools give you the basic functions you need to be aware of what is going on in your home.  Email alerts, ftp upload (of pictures only, no video uploads though), motion triggers, scheduled alarm times.Cons:-No security (https) for the web interface!  If you set up port forwarding, the entire world can see what ever your camera is pointed as, if they know your password (which is limited to 12 characters).  The problem here is, that your password is sent via plain text.  If someone manages to sniff the wifi packets (or picks up your traffic between the outside world and your router), then they will have your password and will be watching you.- No audio.  I haven't tried viewing using Internet Explorer (or Windows, for that matter) yet, but I have no audio on the web interface.  I'm leaving it at 3 starts because I really don't care about the audio, but since it is listed as a feature and isn't available on most browsers, I'm docking it a star.- Resolution limited to 640x480.- A user interface designed by engineers.  The user interface is the most basic possible while still providing the advertised functionality.  There is no polish here.  There are no help files.  If you don't understand what it is asking for, you're out of luck.  Do you know what what SSL for SMTP is?  If not, you're going to have trouble.- The focus ring is near impossible to adjust without completely blocking the lens.  Which means you give it a little turn, move your hand, wait for the picture, check it out, try again and hope to notice a difference.- No zoom (but it is a $50 camera).- The IR lights on the camera are very visible in the dark, so don't expect this camera to hide very well with the lights out.Overall:For what I paid, I'm happy with this camera.  It will serve the purpose for which it was purchased (security camera  for the house).  It gives a decent picture in the daylight and produces a night time picture which exceeded my expectations.  You can clearly make out faces (from approx 30ft away) in either lighting condition.I am fairly disappointed with lack of security on the web interface, and that the ftp function only captures pictures.  To fix both of these, I plan to discontinue using the built in functions and instead use a spare computer running Ubuntu and the program "motion" to handle the duties uploading motion captured video to my ftp site.  (The temptation to have a live view of the house may overcome my concerns over password security though, so the web interface may stay active.)Setup of the camera does require a slightly above average set of network skills, so be warned if you don't know what things like subnet mask and DDNS mean.I plan to purchase a few more of these to cover additional rooms of the house, and would recommend it to someone looking for a no-frills IP camera.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase if you want this camera to be viewable outside of your home network.
Reviews.Author: J. Barry "Sleeper"
Reviews.Content: This camera does work as described. Setup was not easy but not hard. You will have to have some knowledge of IP in order to set it up. If you are a novice computer user this device will be a challenge for you to set up.This camera has very poor internet or cyber security. It is very, very easy to crack. For instance, you can view the user interface without a password by simply pushing escape when the password prompt comes up. I checked to see if I would be able to change the password from a non-local network and it worked. Unfortunately this broke the item and reset will not reset the password.It is a typical Chinese product. They steal a good idea and then do half the job of implementation. Leaving a product that isn't necessarily bad, but definitely misses the mark.Cheers.

Reviews.Title: Arrived DOA
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a dead power adapter.  Unfortunately this unit does NOT support POE, so I was unable to use this.

Reviews.Title: back to 1996?
Reviews.Author: matt b "matt b"
Reviews.Content: The video quality of this thing is ridiculous. If you're trying to determine if a Sasquatch or a toddler has broken into your house, but not be able to identify which of the two, this is your device.I was thinking "the price is right", it's not. This thing is real bad.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with product. Setup was a pain due to poor instructions
Reviews.Author: Tyler Cracraft
Reviews.Content: The manual should definitely include the following:1. Factory setting IP is 192.168.0.178, the http port is 80.2. Connect the pc with the included cross-over cable to the ethernet port of the webcam.3. Change the IP address of your ethernet interface, IP address of your 192.168.0.177, subnet mask 255.255.255.0 and gateway 192.168.0.1784. Open your browser and type [...] and press enter.5. Once you assign the webcam a new IP address, you'll need to reassign your ethernet IP also to match also (if you change the camera to 192.168.1.111, set your ethernet to 192.168.1.112)The rest is self explanatory if you can get to this point.  Just follow the onscreen instructions.  After you're all done, don't forget to change your ethernet IP back to its correct setting.Other than the setup, I am happy with the product.  Night vision motion activated recording works well.

Reviews.Title: stop buying cheap s***!!! spend the extra money one better ones
Reviews.Author: suffolk long island
Reviews.Content: holy cow the setup sucks we are in 2013!!! it should be easy  to set up cameras by now!! what are you doing with selling a product that is crazy hard to setup  for u people that know how to and can spend the time to hook this thing up .. gooood for you... i rather walk my dog for 5 hours so she can pull me around instead of sitting at this desk  pulling my hair out!!!! people listen to me do not buy this!!!

Reviews.Title: great technology, poor documentation, one already broke
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: This would be a fantastic product for the price but the problem is that the documentation and support is excrutiatingly painful.  I had a tech expert work 5 hours to get them going using blogs on line to figure them out.  Now one does not work and they are not real conducive to working with Apple computers you can only watch one at a time or set up multiple websites.  Now one is broke after only running for a short time.

Reviews.Title: Instructions are HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: PattyM
Reviews.Content: Got my package today - spent this evening trying to set it up.  Might as well not come with printed instructions, that's how un-useful they are.  There is a PDF file on the enclosed CD that is a little better, but still not good.Got it to work wired, then tried wirelessly.  What a joke - basically ended up resetting my router so I could get computers to connect to internet again.Finally, after about 5 hours, I got router re-set, computers reconnected, camera connected wired, and finally connected wirelessly.Have only tried it inside tonight, but in a dark room, it seemed to work well.For the price, so far, it seems pretty good.  WOnder how well it will hold up to the weather?If you don't know much about computers and networking, you will have a terrible time trying to get this set up.  I have a pretty good knowledge, and it still took me forever!! The instructions don't make any sense, so you are basically on your own.

Reviews.Title: OK if all you want to do is live view..  Terrible software.
Reviews.Author: B. Sutton
Reviews.Content: I have this camera pointed out of my window looking over my parking space. During the day, the color is so washed out that it might as well be black and white (and no, it is not in direct sunlight). During the night viewing isnt very good, although it does work well in absolute darkness (which will never be useful in my situation since it is never that dark outside).My biggest issue is the lack of network recording functionality. I have the camera set up wirelessly and can access it from anywhere via web browser. This is great if you plan to stay glued infront of a monitor all day watching your camera. But there is no useful network recording options. The software on this thing is garbage.Can someone suggest a reasonably priced wireless cam with decent software that can record directly to network storage or to a network attached computer that is always running?  Or even better....can someone say how to get this camera to do this simple task?

Reviews.Title: wireless ip cam
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got the Wireless IP pan/tilt/Night vision internet surveillance camera.  The product was a little tricky to install; but if you follow the directions ( A little broken as translated to english) but if you follow them exactly, it works the first time!Nice for home or office security.  The email alarm pix is nice.  it sets an alarm if motion is detected and then emails the picture of what triggered the alarm.Mike

Reviews.Title: works on lan line but not on wireless
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: Having hard time to set up the wireless, if you just want to connect with network cable it would work pretty well, but if you need it wireless, I found many people had same problem.

Reviews.Title: defective, second try
Reviews.Author: rblaw
Reviews.Content: Got as far as setting it up with a direct wired connection to the router, but the tilt function didn't work. It would only tilt in one direction. When it tilted as far as it would go, it would be stuck there. So it is going back to Amazon. It provides a good picture compared to my Panasonic BL-230A, but it sounds like its motion detector will not provide a video like the Panasonic. So I am not sure if I will get another one. Maybe I need to spend more money. The installation instructions were pitiful. And the installation DVD was a hassle to use.Second try: Raised the rating to two stars. The first purchase attempt produced a product that provided a very  crisp view, but was obviously broken. The package had very little padding and things looked wrong when I took the camera out of the box. But after I got a full refund (including postage, I thought I would give it another try. The second version came today. The camera was securely packed in Styrofoam. Instead of the tiny playing card instruction that came with the first, there was a CD that had a manual and a video on how to set things up. It was on one of those little two inch CDs that often get stuck, but it ejected on command Of course the both instructions suffered from bad translations. Things went well in setting up for a local network with wiring directly from the camera to the router. But getting the thing to work wirelessly has so far eluded me.The LAN setup was easy, but the getting the WAN working was a challenge. At one point, my messing with the router software caused me to lose all wi-fi reception. The cause putting a range of ports in the port forwarding. When I just mentioned a single port, wi-fi was restored. It seemed like I tried the same WAN setup many times, but it finally worked using the address on the bottom of the camera. I spent much time on this project and don't plan to spend anymore time trying to get a wireless connection. Instead, I am going to buy a 15 foot Ethernet cable.I have a Panasonic network camera which was not a breeze to install. But there came a point when I simply clicked a button asking for access via the internet and a working Internet address popped up. Nothing like that with this camera. The picture from that Panasonic camera is not great, and it sometimes forgets its address, but the setup was much easier than for this camera.Update: After I returned my first defective camera, I quickly got a refund. Then I read some Amazon review and decided to give it another try. It took me an age to get the WAN and the wi-fi working, but both are now functioning. Now I need to figure out what to do with the problem cause by the night view through a window. The infrared lighting turns things into a big blur. It seems that my options are to tape over the infrared LEDs or to ensure enough outside lighting that the LEDs don't fire up.My initial rating was one star after receiving the defective unit. Then I got an email from the manufacturer urging give more stars. My rating now is 3 stars. The picture is great. The pan and tilt functions work well. And you can't beat the price. But the setup difficulties require a lower rating. I sure have learned quite a bit about my router from messing with this camera.I would refer to this camera by brand name, but I don't know the brand name. The camera shown in the Amazon photo is marked as Wansview. However that name does not appear on the camera, on the box or in the instructions.Update: I was about to order another of these. until I read a comment about the Foscam network camera. As the reviewer noted, the Foscam is well worth the extra $20. Setup of wireless LAN and WAN was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: easy set up, good camera, NOT A WANSVIEW
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and was very excited to test it out. The setup is not too hard, don't need a PhD in networking to figure it out. I was able to even set up remote viewing and different level access accounts, as well as email alarms on motion alerts in less than one hour. My one disappointment is that this product description CLEARLY says Wansview is the manufacturer, when in fact it is Apexis.

Reviews.Title: bought it a year ago - still cant set it up to stay on without network cable
Reviews.Author: honest opinion
Reviews.Content: not wireless for me , sadly !!! keeps loosing connection when i take it out from the internet  cable !!! will be happy to change my review once i figure it out !

Reviews.Title: Constantly causing network issues...
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera was going to be awesome when I first got it.  The price, the ability to pan and tilt remotely, remote viewing, and night vision were all things that I was interested in.  However, when I began setting the camera up to the network is when I began to get frustrated.  I wanted to use this camera as a Wifi security camera so that I could check in on my house while I was away.  So after struggling through the small instruction pamphlet, I finally was able to get it up and running.  I played around with it in my living room while controlling it with an app I downloaded on my phone.  It worked well and I was extremely happy.  Until I realized that I could only view the video while connected to my own network.  I spent hours researching on the internet and found a few things to try but had never found the perfect solution.  When I finally had it set up to view from anywhere, the camera began shutting down my wifi network.  I would have to unplug the wifi router for 10 seconds to reset it and get it going again.  Any time the camer was plugged in and connected to my network it would eventually shut it down.  If I ever get it to work with my network then I will increase to 4 stars.  The only reason it even got 3 stars is because aside from connectivity problems (that could be my fault or my service providers fault) the camera seems to work well.

Reviews.Title: not the total solution for the ley pc guy
Reviews.Author: Richard Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I'm still struggling with access on my phone outside of the local network.  Very code intense.  D link is a more straight forward option for that aspect,  but i like the wansview emailing of photos during motion or sound detection

Reviews.Title: sucks
Reviews.Author: nathan
Reviews.Content: it came broken i was on hold for  hrs called amazon to get anothe one shipped to me and have had many issues the password and uusn that comes with the cam dont work there is no reset button where the reset hole is

Reviews.Title: I like this item when I first bought it
Reviews.Author: R. Duffy
Reviews.Content: It worked as advertised and was very happy with it for almost 3/4 of the year.  However it did not survive the New England winter that we just went through.

Reviews.Title: Great ip cam for day or night!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "ML"
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and love these cameras because they allow me to check in on the house when away. They work great especially in complete darkness. Even with no light you can see perfectly. There are apps you can download to your phone or tablet that allow you to view and control your camera as well as take screen shots and video. The only reason I gave it 3 stars is that you have to have technical knowledge to set them up. You have to know how to assign ip addresses. If they made it easier to set up I'd give them 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Poor Support and Software
Reviews.Author: Ryan Ricciardi
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine but the software and support to view online was terrible. Wouldn't recommend to anyone who isn't very well versed in finding their own way to make a camera work over the internet or a home network. Never figured out how to access it via my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: JILL JONES
Reviews.Content: The camera works as advertised. Good picture for both day and night viewing. I would like an easier software interface.

Reviews.Title: Im so happy I purchased this !!!
Reviews.Author: Theresa Washburn
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent night vision cam.  We use it to keep track of our 2 dogs while we are out.Unbelievable night vision.  We had all the lights out , pitch dark in our sunroom and the nightvision was as good as turning on the lights.Great quality.  I will be adding more for caretaker purposes and when we travel.  The free android app  is awesome and connects quickly.Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great value! Challenging to setup.
Reviews.Author: DrDave1958
Reviews.Content: I'm no rainman when it comes to IT, but pretty close. LOL This thing is easy to setup...ONCE you know the secrets that are not in the manual. E.G. that it is already set to a static IP (192.168.0.178). That IP is the example in the manual, it just doesn't say that it's already set to that. To sum up, I would not have got this working if it weren't for the details in the reviews. Particularly the one from Justchill (lots of details). The other main problem I had was getting a port that worked for the port forwarding. I tried several but none worked until I tried port 310, (also found in a review). That said, the functionality and picture quality is fabulous! The four star rating is based on what you have once you get it setup. I'd recommend buying one, in fact I'll probably get another.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Roy Zepeda
Reviews.Content: So far no issues with the wireless camera, setup was very easy, all the cabling and was in the box, no missing parts. Great Service

Reviews.Title: Good for money hard installation
Reviews.Author: jeff williams
Reviews.Content: Needs to have a much less complicated setup software other then that high quality pictures and image for the price and even real well in low lighting.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: mgtprofessor
Reviews.Content: It took five minutes to install it and, so far (after two month) it shows clear pictures of the location even at night or low light. Good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Works pretty well
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Thayer "geminidreamz"
Reviews.Content: Looks bigger than I thought it would when mounted on the wall. I put this in my toddler's room as a "monitor". It does the job well enough. I had to put a piece of electrical tape over the blinking light. The image isn't as clear as it could be, but for the price, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Still working great (since January 2013)
Reviews.Author: Anthony W. Brown
Reviews.Content: It was a bit of a challenge to get it working wirelessly via the Internet, but once done I haven't had a problem since; which is much better than the Tenvis I purchased in December (of 2013). The Tenvis is going in the garbage and I'm buying a 2nd Wansview.The only con I have with the Wansview is the audio doesn't work (microphone or speaker); that was the ONLY positive for the Tenvis. but, since the more important feature of the two for me is video, I'll stick with the Wansview.

Reviews.Title: Installation is not easy
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Installation is not easy, but if you know about networks you should be able to install it. I did install in an hour. with airport extreme and mac computer. There was not very clear instruction how to do it but i read the instruction and did help me to figure it out for my apple system. it works fine the quality is good. the only problem i have the mic and speaker is worth less on the camera because the browser does not give you any access to listen to sounds tried on mac and windows still same. I use it to watch my dog when i am not at home and it does the job.

Reviews.Title: Cool product
Reviews.Author: Cory Dykstra
Reviews.Content: Need to be a technical person to setup.Understanding DNS, Email transport, IP addressing helps.Great Camera for the price. I am going to order more.Manual focus. I happened across that by mistake.Cool product!!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price...
Reviews.Author: Eric Peterson
Reviews.Content: Works pretty well (I'm using it with an Ethernet connection on a ham-radio mesh network, not WiFi.)  But it would be nice if both network interfaces could be used simultaneously, but heck, the price is right.Make sure your anti-virus code is up-to-date, I got a few flags when I loaded the software (note that it may not actually have a virus, but perhaps is written so poorly that it does things a virus signature catcher may hit on.).

Reviews.Title: Does the job I wanted it for
Reviews.Author: AJH "AJH"
Reviews.Content: I wanted the camera to look outside into the yard and it does that very well.  The support crew actually installed the wireless and mobile viewing functions since I am marginally computer literate and they did a good job.  The IR does not work looking through a window due to reflectance but I knew that going in.

Reviews.Title: This is Garbage
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Please see my other review for all of the dirty details. But all you need to know is to leave this page and buy something else. Terrible support and wasted days trying to make this work. Guess what... is still doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Mac owner? PLEASE LOOK ELSEWHERE!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Hoogmoed "Jeff Hoogmoed"
Reviews.Content: This thing is next to impossible to set up on Mac…and I'm pretty savvy too!I would look elsewhere for something that's Mac friendly.I'm going to keep trying a bit more, but not very hopeful.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Branden Burnard
Reviews.Content: Good picture. A little hard to understand the set up for the first time user with no knowledge of how this stuff works. But provided a good learning experience.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!!
Reviews.Author: Dennis E. Blake
Reviews.Content: This is a super camera for the price and works exactly as it is advertised.  The setup was not at all difficult

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Heriberto Guevara Rivero "Heriberto"
Reviews.Content: I still have this camera outside for about over 7 month, it resist winter and hot during summer. Good quality Wansview got over my expectations.

Reviews.Title: No customer support
Reviews.Author: Tom Diab
Reviews.Content: Hello,The camera works but I cannot view it over the internet outside of my network. Their website is basically a translated from Chinese to Engrish. No Customer Support. You must be an network expert to view this came remotely. I do not recommend because of the lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the money!!
Reviews.Author: Silvio
Reviews.Content: Very easy to setup. I bought two and the software include I can watch both cameras remotely with a little configuration on my router.  Also I love the fact they have a motion sensor and the ability to notify via email and at certain times of the day too!!!  easy to setup wifi but I only use them with ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Video, and bad software.
Reviews.Author: RPM
Reviews.Content: Enough said.  Software is limited.  Camera errors out with many other free surveillance software, tying you in to using the manufacturers software, which is very limited in functions.

Reviews.Title: Great device....
Reviews.Author: Elvis Douglas
Reviews.Content: Great device for the price...Picture quality is good...Had no problem setting and connecting it to my network....I would recommend it to everyone..

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with Internet Explorer
Reviews.Author: BrownTooF
Reviews.Content: You need to use Firefox to view. I returned it for a refund because it was blurry even after adjusting the lens.

Reviews.Title: Low quality only lasted 6 months
Reviews.Author: Matt McKee
Reviews.Content: I used this wifi camera as a baby monitor.  It was mounted on a tripod at the babies crib, there were no extreme environments involved .  with in the first 4 months the tilt function died, then around 6 months the camera stopped working.  I emailed Wansview customer support and have not heard from them.

Reviews.Title: Worst product/customer support ever!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Petruff
Reviews.Content: Bought first, could not configure WIFI, Felt it was defective so bought a identical replacement and the same thing; WIFI could not be configured.  The second also arrived with a loose/wobbly top camera assy.  I tired to contact customer support (no reply) and tried to find/download the latest firmware (totally unsuccessful) so decided to return it and buy a replacement off Amazon from a company with better support.  Funny how you pay more for this decision and winds up not requiring customer support because they are better products to begin with.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect
Reviews.Author: iciconnect
Reviews.Content: Surprising!! This little guy is still working. Wireless works great even with a hidden network. Video quality is average so no high quality videos, grainy after about 10". Would've gotten all 4 stars if it had a UV filter. Night Vision works stunningly well. Not good for window surveillance since glass reflex, so it would be recording itself 90% of the time. So if you're trying to record outside a window at dusk or night, this isn't the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: 40 days old and it died.
Reviews.Author: Michael B. Mcnelly
Reviews.Content: Worked ok for 40 days in clean dry ideal location.  Then nothing, stopped..  Only has 30 day policy. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: Rudy Botello
Reviews.Content: Picture is good quality. Its compact design. I like how it can be mounted upside down. I am satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: poor
Reviews.Author: John Hefenfinger
Reviews.Content: Purchased by mistake  but I thought I would keep and use as home security.The instructions are not user friendly and is not plug and play, I shoved the unit under my computer desk till I get some one more intelligent than myself to install it.

Reviews.Title: Does the job as described
Reviews.Author: DCLW "DCLW"
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to get up and running. Complicated setup procedure and I have a lot of computer knowledge. I don't recommend for anyone who isn't computer savvy. But once I figured it all out, it works as described.

Reviews.Title: Wansview did it Right
Reviews.Author: Mark Felgenhauer
Reviews.Content: Good functions and features, very cheap. Buy it. Probably the highest quality inexpensive camera on the market. 12 MP camera doesn't lie.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Gary Slivka
Reviews.Content: The camera works perfectly.  Night vision is really clear and the audio it picks up is pretty damn good considering how small it is.  I use an app for my iPhone called Foscam Pro to watch my dogs and hear what they are doing while I am at work.  The camera can turn left and right almost 360 degrees and up almost to my ceiling and down.  I like being able to easily view from any webbrower and my phone.  I am thinking about ordering another for my front door.  It comes with two way audio, but requires you to attach a separate speaker for that, probably can pick one up from Radio Shack or use any old school PC speakers that don't require amplification.Pro's:- Rotating camera, silent motor- Excellent Audio and Video- Nice nice vision- Ability to turn off the green activity led flasher- Does not require DMZ to be enabled in your routerCon's:- Bad manual, directions are a bit scarce of good description, so I looked up a different manual online.- DDNS, is confusing and requires you use a third party website to use (just do port forwarding in your router if you plan to access the camera outside of your home network eg: cell phone or from work).Advise:- Attach the camera directly to your router via provided patch cable to start- Use the searching tool and change your port number from the default 80, to anything over 8000 - I used 8098.- Set up port forwarding in your router to the local IP you assigned and port number you chose- FTP set up for recording, and email snap shots isn't too bad either.I have not used the motion alarm just yet on it, but plan too in the future if I add another camera to my front door.I would buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Not simple to set up
Reviews.Author: Ontaria williams
Reviews.Content: Can't get this thing to work its not easy as advertised, they need to spend more on disk to auto install software

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Reviews
Reviews.Content: This camera is somewhat simple to setup, the instructions are not very clear, in some parts. Quality is about a 6-7 I would have liked the camera to have a zoom feature, but this model does not have it, its on the description. The night mode is decent, a little hard to see on defaults so you might have to tweak the settings. When connected to the router directly its pretty smooth for the pan/tilt but if you have it wireless, it might take a little longer for moving the camera, and specially if the signal is not super strong it will take a lot longer.

Reviews.Title: They work
Reviews.Author: Christopher Kurowicki "chris Kurowicki"
Reviews.Content: Hey everyone. So, I have two of these cams. They work great. Setup is kinda wonky like some people have mentioned. Scheduled record does not work. They also "phone home" way more often than I'd like (Shanghai, China), so I created a firewall rule to block any traffic destined external from these. I VPN in to view my cams remotely, so insecure port mapping for me isn't needed (I'm a data security analyst, information security is my profession).

Reviews.Title: Good and Efficient
Reviews.Author: Probar
Reviews.Content: Took me 30 minuets to setup.  Once I got the camera an IP address I manually changed all other settings via the web gui and had it connect to the wireless instead of ethernet.  I was skeptical at first by seeing all the reviews but quite honestly it was pretty simple.  Granted I work in the IT field.  The software it comes with isn't the greatest nor is the iOS app flashy but they work and for the price, $30 used, it is usable.  I plan on buying 1 or 2 more and set them up as a security network.  The settings are pretty advanced for alerting.Sorry my review is all over the place, normally don't write reviews but after reading so many horror stories about this camera I figured I would throw in my 2 cents on the matter.  For the price, its a good IP wireless camera with a lot of settings.

Reviews.Title: Needed this camera as a roomate was stealing me blind.
Reviews.Author: Katie Wazmer
Reviews.Content: I am computer savvy and spent an entire day working to make this camera functional if nothing more than for 1 day and still could not configure using the directions and customer support.  I didn't have a lot of money to spend on a camera, but needed something optional to prove theft.  The directions were impossible to work through or understand and after spending an entire day I had a dead line to present the information to the police.  Unfortunately this camera was a total waste of money and is sitting in the original box.  Don't waste your money on this camera and its claim of inexpensive, because in this economy I didn't have the money to through in the trash and ultimately could not prove the theft.  The entire experience with the Wansview Wireless is a loose, loose situation of valuable time, money, and effort.

Reviews.Title: ITEM WAS INOPERABLE FROM THE BEGINNING
Reviews.Author: max camacho
Reviews.Content: THE CD TO DOWNLOAD DRIVERS AND OTHER APPLICATIONS ARRIVED CRACKED.  I WENT BACK AND FORTH WITH THE SELLER, SEVESTO.  THERE WAS A LACK OF UNDERSTANDING (LANGUAGE BARRIER POSSIBLY) AS TO WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS.  THEY SENT ME LINKS THAT "FROZE MY PC" AND WHEN I WAS ABLE TO LOOK AT ANY CONTENTS, THEY WERE SCRAMBLED IN BINARY COMPUTER LANGUAGE.  HOW IS A CUSTOMER SUPPOSE TO DECIPHER THAT?  FRUSTRATED THE PRODUCT WAS RETURNED FOR A REFUND.  NEEDLESS TO SAY, THE ITEM WAS NEVER USED.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ray K.
Reviews.Content: This is my first attempt at home surveillance and I must say I am pleasantly surprised and happy with the purchase. The only reason I am not giving this a 5 star is the documentation couldn't have been better, you can tell that this was translated into English at one point in time. They could have added some more details on some of the feature descriptions and the english was a little off at times. As far as use, it is very easy to use and the remote features are great.One thing to keep in mind, this is an indoor camera with infrared, my plan was to place the camera above our garage and keep a watchful eye on the driveway however if you take your time and do some research you'll discover that infrared does NOT do well when placed up next to a window, there are qualities in the glass that cause the infrared light to reflect back so you end up with a halo effect or glare which renders the camera useless at night but it does work fine during daytime hours when it's light outside. This is no fault of the camera so I can't hold it against it, same issue with all infrared devices.I have instead redeployed the camera for interior monitoring and piece of mind knowing that when we are away it will capture and send me snapshots of an intruder as well as being able to bring up the camera from our phone or pads from where ever there is a network and look over things (with full pan/tilt support). Without a pane of glass in the way the camera works great at night, we are able to see our entire living room with all the lights out and the motion and audio detection works like a charm, I immediately have 6 snapshots in my mail as soon as the alarm is triggered by motion or by audio.You will need to do some network setup with this camera (just like any other IP camera), you don't need to be a network guru but for most home networks you will need to know how to go into your router and configure port forwarding if you want to access this from a network outside of your home (plenty of help info out on the web). As far as configuring the camera itself on the home network I did not have any problems (I use uVerse and have a 2wire router). The setup menu is controlled via a web browser, more function in IE then other browsers. You can configure multiple userid's to have snapshots sent if one of the alarm functions is tripped, all alarm functions are configurable so you can active motion detection and audio detection, both of which have multiple levels of sensitivity that you can adjust (1-10). You can also attach a speaker and talk through the camera which I haven't try yet, kind of neat telling someone to get the he!! out of your house :) One tip, for initial setup you need to attach the camera to your router via a cat5 cable, once the initial configuration work is done and you have configured your wireless setting you can detach the camera and place it anywhere that your wireless network will reach.I have had the camera for several weeks now and no problems, will probably purchase one more except will get the ourdoor version for the driveway. The only other thing I am struggling with is getting the camera to work on ROKU, there are a couple of ROKU camera apps but so far no luck at getting this to work under them, once again this is not a showstopper for me as it does work well with computers, cell phones (IP camvew application) and tablets. I also like having the ability to turn on the camera led which you can have blinking all the time (want to be seen) or you can turn the led off if you want to make the camera a little less noticable. I would have used the LED to monitor my driveway as I want people to know they are being watched but inside my house I want the camera to stay hidden. There is a little glow from the infrared at night, not enough to be distracting but you could track the camera down if looking for it, if this happens I'll already have their mug shot in a couple of in-baskets as the mailing occurs within seconds of tripping the alarm which can be adjusted to be very sensitive to motion, audio doesn't appear to be as sensitive which probably is determined more upon the location of the camera.For the money, this camera meets my expectations. If you want HD quality and need to be able to monitor outside then this is NOT the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Patrick Godbey
Reviews.Content: First lets get this out of the way. The image quality is not HD. Max resolution is 640x480. That said, it is still awesome. Pan/Tilt is very fluid and silent. I have this camera mounted outside my house with a 6inch deep punch bowl on top of it to keep the rain/snow off of it and it works like a charm. I can use any open source security cam app (android/ios) to view and control it. You can even tap into and listen to the audio from the built in microphone. Motion detection can trigger FTP/email upload, and it can take "idle" pictures and upload them as well. Once you set it up via ethernet, it's all WiFi driven.I took a chance on this camera and am extremely pleased with the results for the price.

Reviews.Title: Worse than I expected
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: The documentation did not accurately represent how to setup and run the camera.  The documentation was written in VERY poor, hard to follow English.Once installed, the camera panning/tilting was erratic.  Sometimes one click cause the camera to move a little bit (which is what I would expect) but other times one click caused the camera to pan or tilt fully to one end.  Using a clock as an example, if the camera was pointed at 12 o'clock, one click to the left would cause the camera to pan to 11 o'clock, but other times the camera would pan all the way to 4 o'clock without stopping.Then there was the picture.  At night it was so-so.  During the day it was completely washed out.  I searched the documentation to find a solution but found none. I searched the documentation to find a support number, but found none.  I went to the website to possibly download updated software, but found none. I searched the documentation to see if I could turn off the infrared LED's but couldn't find out how to do that.  Based on the generally favorable ratings, I did not expect this.All in all it was a very frustrating experience, and I've been in the computer field for 35 years so I'm what you might call a "techie".  Packed it up, sent it back.  To be fair, maybe the unit itself was defective, but that, combined with the poor documentation caused me to just call it quits.

Reviews.Title: So far it works stable for wifi camera around $50
Reviews.Author: KK "Kyrylo"
Reviews.Content: It works stable with openVPN access from iPhone to home network to see camera home page with Video. Camera app also works fine through VPN. So it is possible to use it as cheapest Surveillance solution with iSpy software.All features work fine but sound to camera has very long latency. I am not sure if it is camera app VPN or network issue. Sound from camera is ok. Mic in camera is not good as iPhone mic but good enough to hear if air conditioner on or off and definitely you can tell if roomba is running.I also enjoyed tilt control so I can turn around to find my dog. Unfortunately I cannot speak to my dog remotely yet.It is not HD and colors due to night vision are weird but for surveillance it is enough.I bought only one camera just to try how good it is and considering about to buy few more to setup cheap in home surveillance system.In overall I pretty happy with it for this price.

Reviews.Title: It's a toy...
Reviews.Author: Woodlandsman "Woodlandsman"
Reviews.Content: Well, it was worth trying, I suppose. Very plastic, very silly in use. It does work. However, anyone and anything can knock it over, put something on top of it, etc. Maybe OK in a small apartment, but, seriously, not really much more than a toy. Still, sometimes you just want to play... If you enjoy fiddling with IP settings, odd software, odd noises, etc. - have a ball!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Manuel Humberto Garza
Reviews.Content: totally recommended, easy installation, compatible with mac and pc, I have no more words. To the best camera inside. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: NOT SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: First of all i was expecting to get what was on the picture i guess its one of 8 i wasnt even able to chose my style then when it came to installing it i didnt get the cable or the alarm piece that goes on the back usually when i order something everything is included and if theres diffrent models they should be shown when being purchased i wont ever do this again

Reviews.Title: Terrible
