Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: This product was supposed to be new. Came in a box clearly used. No instructions or a manual. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Not HD but good enough
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: i followed the many instructions on other reviews on how to set this up via ethernet connection (on a mac) using the free nameserver and a port forwarding / virtual server configuration on my router and everything worked as expected. I have set up the camera to send mail from a new Gmail account to itself, and a filter to delete both sent mails and received mail. I can now view motion-activated snapshots in the trash folder, and since the trash automatically clears mail older than 30 days, I have a 1-month archive of snapshots and forever free storage. Yay!

Reviews.Title: Poor Wi-FI
Reviews.Author: Anthony O.
Reviews.Content: The camera has features similar to other knock-off Chinese cameras.  So no change there.  Wi-Fi connection is poor.  Even from two feet away I was unable to establish a connection to my router.  Camera was returned.  On to the next one.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Franklin Pino
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the purchase, I got it yesterday and had it installed at work in 10 min, went home and added it to my house wi-fi and that was it.  It does require a basic understanding of networking but with a little reading it will be OK.I am thinking about getting 2 or 3 more of this camera for my house.  Just need to work on the $$$$ first. Pretty broke after Christmas. :(

Reviews.Title: Wired connection only!
Reviews.Author: J. Toton "SIXFT1"
Reviews.Content: No way to connect wirelessly. Instructions read like stereo instructions, very cryptic. I even bought a new router to connect this thing and it still doesn't work. Complete waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Setup sucks, but it works well
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: First of all, were it not for justChill's detailed review laying out how to set this thing up, I would never have figured it out. The documentation is badly translated and not very helpful, and my network required some specific changes to get things working. In other words...setup is a PAIN!But, for the very inexpensive price, it works well. Remote viewing and control work well from the web interface, iOS, and Android, although Android's integration is a bit better unless you get a paid iOS app. The power cable is about 5 feet long, so you'll need an extension or replacement if you want to make serious use of the included wall mount.

Reviews.Title: Everythig was OK
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Everything was ok, and the camara arrived in very good conditions, and it works very well, thank you very much,

Reviews.Title: Guess I got one of the lemons
Reviews.Author: S. R.
Reviews.Content: I was initially very impressed. Went through many features thinking this really is a lot of features for the $. Then I noticed the night vision did not work. While the Infra-red LEDs came on when the sensor detected a lack of light the camera would not switch to night mode and therefore resulted in a completely black picture. Adding a little light I could see the picture was still in color and would never switch to black and white (Night mode) even when manually set to night mode. I will say I was surprised by the quick email responses I got from their tech support. Reading other reviews I didn't expect to get replies but I did several times. Unfortunately most replies came back with the suggestion of a return. They did recommend a factory reset which I did several times but to no avail. It's a shame as I liked everything about this camera but it does need to work. Amazon of course was great with the hassle free return and quickly posted credit. I decided to try the Dlink 5020L version instead of this one. That cost nearly double but works great.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Joe Braun
Reviews.Content: I got this camera up and running in about 5 mins.  I am a network admin so setting this up on my router was very easy, but this can be very hard for those that don't know what they are doing or have experience working with networking equipment.  I think this is the frustration that people are running into.  If you are having problems, please research network ports, port forwarding, and your routers manual.  I don't know if the camera's manual is any help because I didn't use it.Also, my wife loves the camera.  She can now look in on the dogs and get mad that they are sleeping on the couch when we leave.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my Expectations
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: I have two of these cameras now: 1 at an average distance and 1 at a 20-30 foot distance. Both cameras come in a decent picture quality (as expected for the cost) and were fairly easy to setup. Other reviews have some great in-depth guides, so before you rant about the camera not working read one of those reviews! For someone of an average to high technology skill, you might even be able to skip or change some steps in the setup guide/reviews posted, like I did.The only negative thing is that both the cameras had different firmware versions and updates for them are hard to find. So if you have some issues with the administration panel, usually just refreshing the browser (maybe rebooting the camera) fixes it right away. The maximum range (diagonally) I can reach with these is about 75 feet. I believe it's because of our basic-level home router and all the different things we have connecting to it wirelessly.Overall, I got more than what I expected. A fairly straight forward setup with easy-to-learn administration panel and limited frustration makes me more than satisfied with this purchase. :)

Reviews.Title: Good for a time, then very unreliable.
Reviews.Author: Islander31
Reviews.Content: I bought this product via Amazon 22 months ago and have used it 24x7 since as a baby monitor (LAN only, I don't trust the internet access support) using the Android app tinyCam Monitor Pro. The documentation for this device is poor and the web interface is poorly laid out (when compared to something like a Netgear or Linksys AP/router). However it is possible to get things running without too much trouble, if like me you only care for getting it up on the wireless network. It was easy to get running with tinyCam.I have not seen any software updates for the product in the time I have owned it.Had I reviewed this product during the first 12 months I would have given it 4 stars. It's cheap and functional. However at some point in the last 10 months it started playing up, now I get frequent video connection failed errors, often I'll connect and then try a pan/tilt operation and it will just spontaneously reset. I would say I now get at least 9 out of 10 connection attempts failing.I wouldn't buy this again. 2 stars because it was only $50, it did work for 12 months.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This is the Best camera for $50. Clear picture, easy to set up, great for watching your pets during the day.

Reviews.Title: Instructions are incomplete
Reviews.Author: Spud
Reviews.Content: I have been here 2 hours and have searched tutorials...thinking Im assigning a pass word but it is incorrect. The instructions are very incomplete. Maybe it would work if I could get it to work but I have not seen anything yet. Uninstall all software and restart and it is still the wrong pass word. How can that be? My tech level is not low. Viewing account..what account? Is this my operating systems user account or is it creating a new camera account, nether work. If you see a good review it was probably written by a seller.

Reviews.Title: It get's the job done for cheap. Email notifications have small delay.
Reviews.Author: Oscar Cardoso
Reviews.Content: Super functional and versatile. I had it in my room for a couple of months before some thief stole it. It did help me identify the felon, but the sad thing is that I didn't act on time to get him while he was inside my house.Email notifications have some delay, about 3-5 minutes, so bear in mind that while it will notify you, you must have other ways to know if someone is indeed trying to access your house.Live video is OK, albeit in low resolution. It consumes a lot of data and you must have that in mind if you are using the mobile apps to monitor the camera.I didn't try the speaker feature.Night vision works OK but I wasn't able to turn off the IR LEDs. The colors you get in this mode are washed out.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: homerlucas
Reviews.Content: Excellent, it works as the descriptions says, I have it outside and the nigh vision is so cool. I have to buy like 4 more!

Reviews.Title: Needs better QA
Reviews.Author: W. Worth
Reviews.Content: WiFi connection died after about 4 months. Now it's wired only. Aside from that it works great. Unfortunately WiFi was necessary for what i was using it for.

Reviews.Title: I am not a network engineer
Reviews.Author: Lynn T "Lynn"
Reviews.Content: So far I dislike these two cameras because the wording in the manual is so poor that I can't figure the instructions out.  A person who does network configurations and installations has to install these cameras - not a layperson.

Reviews.Title: Works great, price is right
Reviews.Author: Mark Gehring
Reviews.Content: Works great, price is right. One star taken off for no free iPhone app that lets you hear the sound. We use it to see what our dog is doing when we aren't in the room. Functions well with iPhone, iPad , or computer. We do not use the sounds features.

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: Crap.  i  BOUGHT 2 OF THESE ONE DIDN'T WORK STRAIGHT ON AND WAS SENT BACK THE OTHER IS NOW NOT WORKING,

Reviews.Title: can't see camera
Reviews.Author: sheila simpson
Reviews.Content: Can't use this without desktop computer. Thought it was wireless. Oh well....when I finally get a desktop computer it will be here ready to use....

Reviews.Title: Good Cam for the money.
Reviews.Author: Shawn F
Reviews.Content: Good cam for the money! I have not had any issues with this cam since installation. I use this cam as a security cam in my home as a backup while I am away on business I am using it hard wired and not wireless so I can't comment on the wireless stability. Remote web viewing is not bad at max resolution and frame rate is fine for security monitoring. I use the alarm, email and ftp upload functions and it has not missed a thing. You need to "tweak" the setting for the alarm to get the sensitivity correct for your needs. I would buy this cam again for use in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: Beware this thing does NOT do what they claim it will due to faulty firmware and support is non existant.
Reviews.Author: Tom W
Reviews.Content: This is my second unit and the first one works great.This one is crap they updated the firmware and it uploads blank images via FTP which makes it useless for my needsThey claim they offer support and firmware updates but that is simply NOT TRUE!I will be returning this for a refund.

Reviews.Title: damaged CD ..
Reviews.Author: Khaled Bukhari
Reviews.Content: the cd of installation was damaged ,, i couldnt install it ..  and now its usless .. and can not find installation online

Reviews.Title: Hard to setup
Reviews.Author: Professor "Wood worker"
Reviews.Content: This is a challenge to set up.  You really need to know what you are doing.  It has a very wide angle lens.  Once I got it working it has been fine.

Reviews.Title: IPviewer software...
Reviews.Author: Chicken-Nugget
Reviews.Content: I bought a different product, but it's the same function really. I bought the HooToo white camera, but I wanted to let others know to check out the awesome camera software for your PC, better than any of the included viewing software with these types of cameras.ispyconnect, it's free and has so many great features! I found out about it from some else mentioning it in a review many pages back! do check it out, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Bumpkin "PM"
Reviews.Content: Just set mine up last night.  When I first set up the wireless, without problem, (thanks to the other great reviews here,) I was dismayed to see that the picture on the monitor was extremely fuzzy, to the point that I couldn't make out the features on the human test subject. (my son.)  I emailed the company to ask how to repair that problem.  Granted, I DID skim through the instructions on the disk, but I did not see how to refocus the camera in them.  I tried the brightness/contrast controls, and it didn't help at all.  Today, when I looked to see if I'd heard back from the company and saw I had not, I decided to take matters into my own hands.  On the front of the camera is a movable wheel around the lens...  I sat my son in front of the camera, then went back and forth between the camera then the cpu to slowly adjust the 'wheel' (actually more a ring).  Turning that wheel counter-clockwise brought my camera into a MUCH clearer focus.  On my camera, there are only the words "night vision IR" printed around the wheel.  So, if your camera is fuzzy, try slowly adjusting that wheel.  -Thrilled the camera wasn't a dud!  The other thing I was surprised at was the instructions which said to keep the camera between 14* and 122* Fahrenheit.  (I converted centigrade to Fahrenheit.  -Great, but it ALSO says to keep it under 85% humidity.  I wanted to use this thing outside. I live in a rainforest.  Likely not going to stay under 85% humidity.  Also the thing obviously, being electric, has to be kept dry, so, in a rainforest, can't be installed out of doors.  Cant be in direct sunlight, cant be moved while plugged in, - don't move it while setting it up.  My CD came with the user manual loaded, but all the graphics were missing from it, so I went to the website and downloaded one.  -Much better.  The manual's setup instructions really are adequate, except I had to read reviews to comfortably set it up wireless.  I have a LAN, (local area network), so didn't need the WAN ( wide area network,) setup.  To turn off the green blinking status LED light, once its set up and you are viewing the video from the camera, go to 'advanced', then 'other' setting and turn it off under status LED mode, top line, using the drop-down.  Its then, while in the dark, very dimly-lit with the pale red lights around the lens.  Not hidden by any means, but not glaringly obvious, either.  Its overall a great product, -their documentation could be better.  If it were, I'd give it 5 stars easily.

Reviews.Title: terrible chinese Product
Reviews.Author: texas
Reviews.Content: Terrible product. you pay what you get for. Also not very good near the front door or near an exit, i live in texas and it only lasted 7 days. one came with wireless not working right out of the box. besides consumes 2amps

Reviews.Title: One star reviews are false
Reviews.Author: Christopher Marino
Reviews.Content: I have eight (8) of these cameras and they all work. I am not a networking professional or even a computer savvy person but I have a brain and have figured out how to use these cams. Are the directions terrible? Yes! But the cameras work great. Anyone echo says they have a roommate or friend or relative that is a networking or computer professional who can not get this camera working is either lying or their professional is a schumck! This is not a casino grade camera, but again only an idiot would think it was for $50...  I'm here only because I'm buying my 9th for my ski house... Get real 1 starers!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: John Hogan
Reviews.Content: Does what it says it does. Bit of a PIA setting it up but once done it works as expected and works pretty well at that. Night vision is also pretty good reaching out to 30 feet and the pan/tilt feature works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Good product poor instructions
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: It had me banging my head against my desk. I'm not some IT person but I'm pretty handy with computers and networking.I've installed another wireless camera with ease this one not so much. After days of trying to get this camera to work with the wireless I looked online for instruction which is what I should have done first.Once it was installed and working properly it's a good product for $50 plus free shipping with prime. Panning back and fourth with ease. Sometimes when you idol the computer it freezes.I like the option for screen shots or motion sensors. Lots of options! Good because we have dog sitters and house keepers that come in and it's a good way to keep track of them.

Reviews.Title: Wansview Surveillance Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Cigar "ladycigar"
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price, but given 4 stars for software that sucks. I even downloaded it directly from the website and it doesn't install properly. Finally got it to work but I get an error message every time I try to use it. I finally gave up and just use the IE browser to view on my desktop. Records in a decent video and serves its purpose thus far.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend For Home Security!
Reviews.Author: William Michael Legg
Reviews.Content: Very nice wifi product, easy to use... and the best thing is the price was right!Overall No Complaints! Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Here's the Trick
Reviews.Author: Brian M. Henderson "Czarb"
Reviews.Content: So I've bought two of these cameras.  They work well enough for the price.Here's how to set it up if you don't have an IP address in the range of 192.168.0.x:Hook it up to your computer directly.  Disconnect any wireless networks you have.  Manually set your IP address to 192.168.0.222, subnet mask to 255.255.255.0 and leave the rest of the settings blank.  Open up your browser and enter it to 192.168.0.178 (seems to be the usual address).  Username: ADMIN PW: 123456Go to the settings, set it up for your wireless network.  Then change the IP address to the range you use.  Save changes.Then return your computer to the original IP settings.Works every time for me!

Reviews.Title: Great cameras
Reviews.Author: P. Garrett
Reviews.Content: While you do need to know a little about your home network to set these up, I was able to do so with no problem. I bought six and placed in different rooms of our home. The cameras give us peace of mind when we are away from home because we can check on our pets and our property 24/7. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: A Little Tough to Set Up But Manageable
Reviews.Author: Florida Brewer
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  Had some issues setting up but the 2nd person I talked to at Foscam helped me get it working.  FYI, if you can't figure out the password, try 123456.  You'll know what I mean when you get there.  Good support and camera works well now.  Will be buying another.

Reviews.Title: Awesome quality yet inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Kenn G
Reviews.Content: My family and I were going on an extended vacation and were looking for an inexpensive way to check in on our house from out of town and these small cameras worked beautifully.  We purchased one as a test and were so impressed with the ease of use and workmanship that we bought 3 more to fit our needs.Pros:Setup was accomplished easily and in less than 10 minutes a camera.Infrared worked as advertised - we were able to keep an eye on our house day and night.Pan and tilt worked very well; we were able to look around each of the rooms that had a camera in it.Sound was very good; some slight distortion but nothing to really complain about.Works extremely well on a mobile device; each device houses its own web server for access to the cameraCons:Couldn't get the all-in-one feature to work; although a camera indicated it was hooked to the others in the web server, I couldn't view all 4 cameras in one window;  this meant I had to look at each camera individually (through a different URL via Dynamic DNS which was a separate purchase).  A minor inconvenience.Occasional issues with the pan-and-tilt web buttons either taking a while to respond or not responding at all; continued pressing of the web part eventually made the camera move.All in all, for this price, this camera delivers AMAZING value.  The cameras were on for over a month and a half straight and, other than noticing that the base grew fairly warm, I never had a single issue with them.  I highly recommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Video is nice but didn't meet my needs
Reviews.Author: biglove
Reviews.Content: Software package with it is just so-so. BUT, for the money, is a great little camera. You won't be concealing it as it is larger than you might first thing from the pics.Returned as the monitoring software was really bad.Wireless worked great, though!

Reviews.Title: Couldn't set up with Mac.
Reviews.Author: John Q.
Reviews.Content: I've tried a couple different Ip cameras and they are all too hard to setup for me.  I'm actually pretty sharp with computers and technology with the exception of routers and ip forwarding.  I eventually used a old iPhone and a app called "Presence" to watch my wife's cat while on vacation.  It works pretty good.  Next is drop cam  Haven't bought one yet but they were recommended by a friend..

Reviews.Title: Wansview IP Cam
Reviews.Author: Melvin Gooding
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to hook this up. Perhaps its my ISP or me or both. Perhaps its a good product. Its is working with direct connection but for some reason the remote is giving a lot of headache to connect. If I should get everything going I would review this review.

Reviews.Title: Love this item.
Reviews.Author: Lwheele
Reviews.Content: A very good value for the price.  I use it 24/7 and have no problems at all with it.  The Detailed setup instructions you download from Wansview are better than what comes in the package.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly complicated!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Kassaseya
Reviews.Content: The description on Amazon implies that this camera is simple to use and run. I consider myself pretty tech savvy and yet had the most difficult time using this camera. In fact, I had to call Tech Support twice! Calling Tech Support (based in India) may seem like a simple way to solve problems you might have, but it'll cost you...at a rate of $29.99 per call. That's right, there is no free tech support for this product.The instructions are poorly translated into English as well.The biggest problem I had was using the camera on wifi. When connected to the router, it works as it is supposed to. But when trying to use it away from your router it loses signal.Tech Support is able to solve this problem with a 45 minute phone call at a cost of nearly thirty bucks at which point it works kind of okay. However, every other time I try to view the camera on my computer, it seems to not be working.Overall, it's not the worst device in the world but I'm sure you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jon"
Reviews.Content: This camera is ideal for monitoring property and cost much less than a similar camera I won. This is an excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: crw856
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera. I ordered two of these and I think one of them may be defective because it constantly loses connection with the computer while recording or viewing the surroundings. Hopefully will be able to get a replacement for it. Other than that, they're ok. Setup and configuration is VERY COMPLEX!! Never saw anything like it in my many, many, many years of having networking experience.

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Easy Set up
Reviews.Author: Omair
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a well reviewed product with a good price for what it offers.I'm not an IT professional but I do know how to work my home network.  It took 15 minutes from the time I unboxed this time to the time I had it up and running on WiFi.  It is now sitting in the nursery and we can keep an eye on the babies.  I'll spend some time this weekend on getting it to work so that I can view it from work and mount it on the wall with the provided mount.Works great with my Android tablet and phone.If you're not tech savvy, have a friend who is or a professional do it for you.  You really do need to know some advanced concepts of networking.

Reviews.Title: Very effective and inexpensive
Reviews.Author: siddharth khatiwala
Reviews.Content: Set up needs some effort. But once the set up is done,it is very easy to mount and operate.  Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Jason A Hoover
Reviews.Content: I purchased this web cam because it had dry contact ports on the back.  I ended up wiring this directly into my garage door opener.  I can now open and close the garage door from either an Android app or the camera's web console.  Things work great!

Reviews.Title: excellent but read this carefully
Reviews.Author: Pedro Crespo
Reviews.Content: arrived on time, easy to set up until you want to see you ip camera from the internet.The manufacturer offers a virtual server for you to see the camera anywhere in the world, but for me, it didnt work, I had to purchase a $25 suscription from DYNDNS for it to work on the web and in my mobile phone monitor app.

Reviews.Title: better than i expected
Reviews.Author: Theresa Rossi "tr-ka"
Reviews.Content: It almost set itself up. I just wanted a camera so I could see people coming into my office.  It was so easy to monitor that we bought a couple more to monitor our lab.

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Lindsey Neidig
Reviews.Content: Worked for what we ordered it for. We had one of our children taking cookies and we were pretty sure it was my daughter that is diabetic. But we couldn't catch her and couldn't prove it. We set this camera up to catch her in the act (since the cookies are so bad for her) and we did. It is a little slow and a lot of the still pictures it emailed us were not useful in this. But the video was fine. We didn't like that we had to have a computer on to capture the video, but we could deal with that. It was extremely hard to get it set up and working. Took a while to figure it out and my husband and I are computer people. An average person may not be able to get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Tons of features. WAN installion is a pain!
Reviews.Author: Tony T. Lou
Reviews.Content: Works well locally (when it's hooked up to your router) and easy to hook up. Still not able to access via the internet. Instructions are very complicated and confusing.After trying for 3 weeks, still not working.Will try again later.

Reviews.Title: Worked Okay for 6 months
Reviews.Author: James Sommers
Reviews.Content: This item was great ...while it worked.After 6 months, it no longer works and I'm unable to return it.Do not buy

Reviews.Title: Cool toy
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought this product and it lasted about six months before it completely quit working. I called the company and they said there's nothing they could do, I could order a new one.

Reviews.Title: The WORST in terms of administration
Reviews.Author: B. Pearman
Reviews.Content: If you think this camera is priced right, think again.  It almost never works properly with any type of monitoring software. Constantly dropping frames, ceases to work with monitor software such as Webcam XP (and stops responding to PTZ controls in said software)Overall, Not at all pleased.  Spend the extra money and get the FOSCAM model (which I also own) and you won't regret it.And what the heck is up with that monitoring Dynamic DNS? As if we aren't already monitored enough!PASS!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Chan
Reviews.Content: Basically just what I need it, same quality and specs than other brand $20 expensive. Great purchase at the end.

Reviews.Title: ip camera support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I called Wanview and Andrew help me to set up my ip camera. He was very nice and friendly. On 08/014/13.

Reviews.Title: some words of wisdom
Reviews.Author: Zane N King
Reviews.Content: Okay folks.... indeed.. you need a bit of router/internet ip address nowhow to set this up...if you don't know what an ip address is and how to set it and a port # for it,  hesitate to but this one...  2ndly... the software that comes with it... don't bother ... I found a program called ispy that is doing just fine...  I got it to do what I need it to do ... after about 9+ hours of fiddling with it and the software settings... If I had had the ispy program it would have cut that time down...some of the hangups I encountered... The directions leave some 'little' stuff out... like that you don't have to set the ip manually... you can just check the box to set the IP automatically... and while it 'recomends' using Microsoft Internet Explorer over the other browsers...  That you really MUST use it to set all the features.. (that was 2 hours down the tube right there)...remember to set the port to something other than 80 and autoset the ip address with the manufacturers software ( one that isn't taken) and then use some REAL software to control it..... ( ispy....  and use the ispy wizard to recognize said camera... )the pic quality is not that great but it lets me see what i need to.. .the neighbors dog so as to complain to the city about it and to record it...(will try manually adjusting the lens to see if it just needs better focused...)

Reviews.Title: NOT for even tech savvy amateurs!
Reviews.Author: Rita Linck "Aria Borzoi"
Reviews.Content: Amazon won't support this product other than referring you to the company.  The company doesn't return emails and you can't reach them via phone.  The correct website isn't even in the 4 page installation booklet - it should be [...]  A lot of the website is dummy text.I'm much more tech savvy than the average customer, and even after searching online for tutorial videos (the booklet is useless), and following the instructions step by step, I could never make the product work.  I had to learn to program my router, and all sorts of new skills - still, no functional camera after 3-4 hours of work.If you're familiar with security systems and setup, this may be a great product.  But if you're trying to find a DIY security system for the average tech-savvy homeowner, THIS IS NOT IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice little cameras
Reviews.Author: Trimble Epic "Trimble Epic"
Reviews.Content: I had one previously, so I ordered three more to place around inside my house.  They get the job done, but beware I can't find updated (or even ANY) firmware files on the net anywhere.  Three of my cameras require manual wifi setup because the scan feature is broken in the firmware (it works on my older camera with a different firmware revision, so I know what it's supposed to do)These work well when you add a speaker for two-way communication!

Reviews.Title: Complicated instalation!
Reviews.Author: Gus
Reviews.Content: It comes with a disc, which for some reason it cannot be read by some computers.  Even thought it's in the same network it has to be connected on the same router with your computer otherwise you cannot set it up.  After I reconfigured my whole network I was able to get it to work...........................for a day or two.  As far as remote access it's a hit or miss.  And as far getting it to work via Wi-Fi.............good luck!!.  I thought that I was computer savvy, but I guess you need an MS in computer science to get this camera to work.I would have sent it back if I had more time to waste, but instead I put it where in belongs,,,in the trash can!!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Eddie Frye
Reviews.Content: This Camera was the best thing I bought. I bought another before this and it would go offline every day and sometimes several times a day until it finally would not work. This camera has never gone down and it works great. The picture is great and it has helped me keep safe

Reviews.Title: Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Robert Dickinson
Reviews.Content: Still cannot get this to work. What a nightmare to setup. No troubleshooting at the company website, no help, no numbers to call unless you speak chinese.When I click on the browse button like the instructions say all i get is a webpage that says cant open. Doesnt matter what web browser I use. NOTHING.No login screen, no help, no nothing.Not useable

Reviews.Title: Would not work.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Could not get the camera to hook up wireless, tried for hours, finally gave up. The instructions are horrible. Worked great for wired application. Company mobile app would not work, kept crashing on Galaxy Note 2. Returned.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to install if no IT background
Reviews.Author: rhonda basarich
Reviews.Content: This was difficult to install on a Mac let alone a PC.  So I had a friend who had an IT background set it up on a PC.  Another downside is that the camera has to be connected to power so if the power goes off, then the usability of the camera is lost. There are upsides to this camera - the wireless function works well, the motion sensor is great and the notification on the web works nicely.

Reviews.Title: Worked exactly as expected. Very happy with the product.
Reviews.Author: robert graham
Reviews.Content: I did the set up using temporary wired ethernet, then switched to wireless mode. Set up all 3 in half an hour.The picture is more than satisfactory for day and night surveillance, which is why I bought them.

Reviews.Title: Camera good - support non existantant
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Washburn "redleaven@yahoo.com"
Reviews.Content: The camera and it's software is very good and has very good quality video response. Setting up is somewhat involved. Just do not buy from this manufacture if you either want support or are planning to use it as an internet camera because there will be no active site available even though each camera has one assigned to it. If you call the support numbers (all are in China), you need to speak Chinese, that is even if they will answer the phone. Even their local distributor fails to answer the phone or emails. Considering the failure to use them on the internet by the buyers, I can see why they don't respond.

Reviews.Title: Doing Its Duty
Reviews.Author: Mr. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the unfortunate purpose of monitoring one of my children. He has some severe behavioral issues. I figured that being able to monitor his activity would help to (a) hold him accountable, and (b) prevent issues from happening in the first place. Amazingly enough, it seems to have worked. After six weeks with the camera in the house the rate of certain types of incidents has dropped precipitously. That means we can put our efforts into helping him in other ways.I found the camera to be relatively easy to set up, but I had the benefit of a strong tech background combined with some really great setup instructions in some of the other reviews. Buyers who aren't tech savvy will probably want to recruit a helper.The camera works more or less as advertised. Once it's connected to your local network you just plug it in and start watching. You can monitor and adjust the camera via the included web interface, which works well enough. You can also use third party monitoring solutions. On one computer I have used iSpy64 for monitoring and recording. On my Android phone and tablet I use Tiny Cam Monitor Pro; that app allows me to not only monitor the camera when I'm at home, but also when I'm out and about.I didn't expect much from the night vision, but it actually works surprisingly well. Interestingly, the night and day vision sometimes work simultaneously. Because of where I have the camera mounted, sometimes half the frame is bright and the other half is dark. The camera shows both at the same time with little problem. I have to admit, though, that it's a little creepy walking through the dark house at night and seeing the LEDs glowing a subtle, but menacing, red. There's a definite Big Brother vibe. For our purposes that's exactly what we want; our son's nighttime shenanigans have ceased because he knows the camera is staring him down.Those of you looking to take advantage of the camera's audio capabilities will probably be disappointed. The camera has a microphone but the listening experience is pretty poor. It might be useful for use cases where you want to hear a specific sound in an otherwise quiet room (i.e. a baby monitor), but that's about as far as I would go. You can also send audio to the camera ... IF you attach speakers. I don't have any to attach so I haven't tested that feature.All in all I'm pleased with this purchase for the money I paid. I would buy another one if I were to need it.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job
Reviews.Author: Donald Cruz
Reviews.Content: It does the job once you get around to installing it.  A bit on the 'difficult' side to install and setup (and I'm an above-average tech guy)  I'm sure people who aren't too techy would need some help setting this up.

Reviews.Title: Es muy eficas para tomas a corta distancia
Reviews.Author: cuauhtemoc emmanuel peguero diaz
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say is I constantly Recorded In no videos. Some times it stops recording without a logical pattern.

Reviews.Title: Returned due to the lack of picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Returned due to the lack of picture quality.I would have to upgrade to the next model or purchase another brand with better specs.

Reviews.Title: Tricky to get set up.....
Reviews.Author: John Cook
Reviews.Content: You'll need to know a little about IP addresses to get this setup locally and for remote access.  Once you figure out the IP address (both local and masked external) for your router, this is easy to install.  Works as advertised, and I'm not even using some of the communication features yet.  Price was great for features provided.  Does not have zoom capability.

Reviews.Title: Good price, Okay for the money
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Unless you are computer friendly this is not for you.  Poor instructions and difficult to configure.  Works well but some features such as zoom are not available on a MAC which is what I have.  Works well on my iphone but again no zoom.  Gives you peace of mind when you are away but image focus and clarity could be better.  Very little depth of field.  You might not be thrilled that it is hosted by a website in China so do you best to lock it down.

Reviews.Title: Very useful and affordable IP camera (not the easiest to setup, but quite usable once it is configured)
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: We bought this IP camera as a replacement for a broken baby monitor handheld thinking that we would be able to use our laptops, tablets and/or smartphones to keep tabs on the baby and not be tied to a proprietary handheld screen which can vary wildly in construction quality/durability and are very expensive or impossible to replace.As far as the camera functionality itself is concerned, we have been very happy with both the range of motion of the pan/tilt functions as well as both the day and nighttime image quality from the (relatively low resolution) camera. This is not an HD camera and we did not expect perfect image clarity, but both my wife and I were happy with how clear the picture is when viewed on a laptop or small handheld device. The tilt function will not allow a view much at all below the horizontal, so if you want a viewpoint downward from where the camera is positioned you will need to mount it with the base horizontal (e.g. on a wall, or a tilted tripod).The generic IP camera mobile application we use to view the camera (the one recommended in the camera documentation) is 'Bi Smarteye'. As with several of the other technical parts of this camera, it is not the easiest to setup but once it is configured it can be used quickly and with little confusion. It allows you to control the pan/tilt functionality remotely, to mute/unmute the sound, to speak to/through the camera's built-in audio-out connection and to take screenshots of the camera. We have use this functionality all of the time to take snapshots of the baby and to monitor him while out of the room.One important thing to note here is a slight annoyance - the connection between the smartphone app and the camera will timeout if it loses focus (regardless of how long it was running in the 'background') such as when the screen is allowed to lock or if you switch to use another application. We have found a workaround for the screen locking issue by simply disabling screen locking when we need to watch the camera on iPhone for prolonged periods of time (cooking, showering, etc).The nighttime IR view is as good as any night-filming camcorder that I have seen and you can even configure the green 'camera in use' light to turn off so that it will not cause as much light pollution in the space where it is installed. There is a much smaller red LED that will remain on when the IR mode is in use, but it is much less intrusive.Once connected to your wired or wireless network the camera functions well to be viewed from a laptop or handheld device via its IP address and, while I have not used it yet, does provide the ability to connect to a dynamic DNS service so that you can reach the camera via a website name rather than its numerical address (or from the internet if you setup port forwarding). Unfortunately, the administrative console does not provide much in the way of support for long/complicated passwords and is not SSL enabled so password data is being sent to the camera unencrypted which will likely prevent me from making it internet-accessible.The initial setup of the camera on the network is fairly complicated, but once it has been setup you are able to un/re-plug it in and move it around easily without having to change any settings. You will need to plug the camera into a wired network first (where you have access to the router to find the IP address that was assigned to the device) once you have the wired IP address you can connect in and configure the camera to join the wireless network. Once joined to the wireless network, you will need to rinse and repeat the process of finding the cameras IP - in my case, once the camera had been assigned an IP I created a reservation for it on the router so that the IP would not change every time the device was reconnected.The camera comes packed with a bunch of features that I haven't had a need to use yet (mostly centered on security monitoring type functions) such as emailing screenshots upon sensing motion and timed operation that looked pretty neat.All told, I like the camera enough that I would buy another one if a need for a security or 2nd baby camera presents itself.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price. Easy set up and easy remote viewing.
Reviews.Author: BRAD SLOVER
Reviews.Content: Best camera for the price. Easy set up and easy remote viewing on our pets. It works wherever you go unless you don't have wifi on your device.

Reviews.Title: BEware the installation is not easy and tech support doesnt exist
Reviews.Author: JMP "jmp_industry"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product and was not able to install it. the SW that comes with it asked me to do certain steps and one of the steps keeps failiing. I tried to contact vendor, there is no phone number. I found their email and I was asked to purchase $70 installation package to get support. I have returned this product. needless to say the documentation it came with had no troubleshooting info. I am SW engg so I know SW but still couldnt get this to work. Ended up buying a D-link product which worked out of the box.Never buy stuff from wansview seems their support is non existant.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Devis D.
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, it is a good deal. The camera works with all browsers on both my PC and iPhone however only Internet Explorer will reveal ALL the features. One example is that the audio features don't even appear in Firefox but in IE they are readily accessible. I would say that It has decent manufacturing quality, considering that, my kids dropped it a few times when we first got it, but it still works fine. The two-way audio is very noisy so I don't use it. The video is decent both for day and nightime. Daytime is in color and nighttime is in black and white. Don't expect the High Definition video that is usually advertised with these kinds of products. You will be disappointed if you do. The bottom line is that it gets the job done for most uses.

Reviews.Title: A good ratio quality/ price
Reviews.Author: Amedee Jacques "Citizen of the Universe"
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this product. I use it for physical security at my house and I have no complaints. The product description was accurate and the shipping was very fast. I had no issue with the service.

Reviews.Title: FIRE hazard
Reviews.Author: OrangeSpots "OrangeSpots"
Reviews.Content: I keep this in my baby's nursery on a professional grade tripod using the mounting screw hole on the camera. It melted through the thick rubber grip and thick plastic mount of the tripod. I mean destroyed it, the mount crumbled into dust it had been heated melted warped and cooled so many times. Owned it 3 months. Thank god I needed my tripod or it eventually would have started a fire inches from my infant daughter's crib.

Reviews.Title: Works very good but i have some complaints about the phone app. You can not control all the functions from the phone
Reviews.Author: Arturo
Reviews.Content: Works very good but i have some complaints about the phone app. You can not control all the functions from the phone

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: MegaGadgetMan "pamscloset"
Reviews.Content: I was able to connect the camera to my wifi and it produces acceptable images. I use it with iSpy to produce video.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly Easy Set-up with Mac
Reviews.Author: Robert Sheitz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use for security.  It monitors all three potential entry points of our house from one spot.  Set-up was far simpler than expected.  If you have ever set up a wireless router and have some familiarity with router settings you should be up and running in no time.  It was nearly plug and play.  I only needed to match my router ip with the camera's and change the port number and the wi fi was up and operational.  You must enable port forwarding to gain access from outside your home network.  I love the email alerts for both sound and motion.  The night vision works well as does the remote control for panning and positioning.  An outstanding value!  Using with iMac, iPad, and a Cisco E4200 router.

Reviews.Title: No Firmware - I wouldn't purchase again!
Reviews.Author: Gruen33
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely no firmware for this device.  Normally that wouldn't bother me but the device is stuck in Night Vision mode.  It looks great at night but during the day you cannot see anything.  Even when resetting to factory defaults and attempting to change the Night Vision to "Off" or "Auto" is reverts back to "On".  This camera is useless during the daylight hours.  If someone has a firmware download link other than [...] please let me know.  The manufacturer's website only has the PDF and software download, no Firmware.  I would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome but no audio with mobile app
Reviews.Author: Jordan Baczuk
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, a little technical if you don't understand modifying router settings and IP forwarding.  The only browser that lets you use the microphone and speaker is internet explorer.  Needs support for chrome, firefox, and mobile phones.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says
Reviews.Author: Warren S. Kyle
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product even with the some reservation.  I have to admit, works really good.  I have an Iphone and downloaded the app, setup the security through my router and boom...I am able to control from my iphone, listen to whats happening in the house, day and night.  Not to sure what others issues were, if you follow the directions, it will work terrific. My suggestion...follow the directions.

Reviews.Title: Value != Price
Reviews.Author: J. K. Schrock "kelly"
Reviews.Content: This camera costs roughly half as much as a Foscam, and does essentially the same thing. However, it's the kind of device that is so obviously cheaply made, you feel like you paid too much for it even at half the price. The picture quality through the (apparently) plastic lens is terrible. Everything looks like an abstract watercolor painting. There is no audio in/out on the back. There is a bright green flashing LED on the front, so forget the idea of this being an unobtrusive camera for a baby's room or some kind of secure area.If you're in the market for an IP camera, just get a Foscam. You won't miss anything if you pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding for the price.
Reviews.Author: Robert Hadley "too many tech toys"
Reviews.Content: I gave this five stars because of the quality *relative to the price*.  Wired / wifi, remote connection, pan/tilt 640x480 with IR LEDs for nightvision and microphone to hear what is going on is just crazy for what I paid ($60ish if I recall).Main downside is security issue of passwords to use it exposed in cleartext but again for the price I have no problem dealing with this by changing the password (from inside my home network) after I have used it from outside, and dropping an opaque large plastic cup over it when I am home.  You could also get around the security issues by using some kind of camera aggregation software inside your home network and getting your images off that.  Documentation is awful but you can find the info you need to do some interesting stuff... for example I run a very short python script on a Raspberri Pi processor which uses this camera to grab images and email me whenever anyone opens the front door.

Reviews.Title: Hard to set up
Reviews.Author: Ronald Robey
Reviews.Content: Instructions are lacking.  Have not been able to get camera to work yet.  Manufacturers need to write better instructions for the end user.

Reviews.Title: Webcam not what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Craig Loring "Craig"
Reviews.Content: Directions were hard to read (Chinese translation was bad).  camera worked fine after it was finally hardwired to the computer but never could get the wifi to work.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: David Esposito "DigitalSteel"
Reviews.Content: Setup does require some technical know how. But the quality is fantastic, much better than I would have thought in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Confusing but worth it.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: The only thing I cannot get it to do is record a live stream to my FTP server or even clips. I have managed to get it to take a picture whenever movement is detected every second which ended up meeting my needs, but I would like the ability to record clips when it detects movement.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Bruno Goulart
Reviews.Content: I started with 3 of them. Got them working pretty quickly and able to see and hear via my iphone/ipad. Bought 3 more and now I have surveillance all around my house with motion detection email alert that sends 5 stills to my email with whoever is at my door. Plus it freaks everyone that pulls in my driveway or comes to my front door. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth the price
Reviews.Author: R. Duarte "rahjicom"
Reviews.Content: It works great for the price. I'd give it five stars if it weren't for (1) the fact that it's hard to determine which camera you've actually purchased (mine used the Digital777.com driver in Live Cams Pro for iOS but it took a lot of trial and error and eventually an email to the Live Cams Pro developers) and (2) the image is completely washed out in bright sunlight. Supposedly there is sound being transmitted but all I've ever gotten in Live Cams Pro is crazy static/noise. I wasn't expecting sound, though, so I'm not complaining. I'd definitely buy one of these again, but I feel like I'd have to cross my fingers that I'd get the same camera.

Reviews.Title: Too hard to set up.
Reviews.Author: Lupe
Reviews.Content: Didn't work for me but maybe I'm not tech savy enough for it. Good luck, hope you have some IT experience to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Great unit
Reviews.Author: James L Butts Jr
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice unit. easy to use and the night vision is outstanding. Just to let you know if you want to use it looking out a window you will get glare back from the night vision lenses. But all of these types of units will do that. The images are very clear and the use in total darkness is outstanding. I now have 2 of these units and my neighbor loved mine so we bought him one also. These will work great in a warehouse or a retail store. I use them in my house. I love being able to see them with my phone or tablet when I am away. Lots of features along with sound, motion and email.

Reviews.Title: good and bad.
Reviews.Author: Mr. Waitt
Reviews.Content: the instructions are horrendous.  luckily there's a video on YouTube to find out how to hook it up and that was easy.  however the YouTube video doesn't tell you that you need a public ip so you can look at it through 3g or 4g on your phone.  I also still can't get it to connect to my wifi for Wireless operation.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the price
Reviews.Author: Mark Odell
Reviews.Content: One tip for people new to surveillance cameras.  The lens does manually focus.  I plugged mine in and could believe how bad the picture was.  I literally had started the return process and scathing review, when I decided to check to see if the lens could be focuses.  Ta da....  much better.Color is a it washed out, but after figuring out the focus, overall not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: Ugh! 6 hours and failed to install!
Reviews.Author: roberto
Reviews.Content: This camera had incomprehensible instructions to set up with router. Enclosed CD was not read by PC. Downloads were different than the long, painful detailed instructions attempted by other reviewers. Ultimately the process created conflicts with other devices on the router and the set up screens did not permit changes. Three semi-experienced geeks could not set this up over 6 hours time. So unless you are a confident uber-geek, don't do this at home! The various companies that brand and distribute this unit need to get it together and provide proper, clear documentation for setting up. It just should not be this difficult. We returned this item.

Reviews.Title: its a knock off but works
Reviews.Author: Kara James
Reviews.Content: was a bit tricky to set up but read through the reviews, and you will mostly likely get it. i did buy 2 of these, first one i got working, second one did not come with an address installed and could never connect to it. dont recall if it came with apps for smart phones but i found the android app, ip cam viewer by robert chou, works great (select wansview nc541)

Reviews.Title: I am going to order another
Reviews.Author: must have....very fun!
Reviews.Content: The video is pretty clear and night vision really good too.Using indoors. I will be getting another one for outdoors,under some cover and see how it withstands the weather. Setting it up using the YouTube Videos help me understand how it works. You also need to pay for a DNS service if want to access the cams on your mobile device. I used DynDns.org 14 day free trial, then $25.00 a year I think it is worth it. I still need to set up my recording when motion is detected.

Reviews.Title: Very hard to setup
Reviews.Author: nancy spetkar
Reviews.Content: Following the instructions for several hours trying to get it to work with my router to no avail. Finally gave up and returned the unit.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I bought this to keep track of misbehaving puppies.  Set up was fairly easy (though I have a lot of electronics experience) and the web server works great for remote monitoring.  I can keep my eye on them on my phone, Ipad, or PC at work.

Reviews.Title: WIFI Camera Good buy
Reviews.Author: jeep2012
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit. The only Drawback is no remote zoom. The remote zoom model is a couple of dollers more. But to scan the yard for prowlers (mine are usually four legged such as Deer) it is great. This unit and the more expensive units are not water tight.  I use a glass light globe and a little RTV to make a seal. But it is not a bad unit. Setup is simple. You must plug the computer directly to set  up bot onec set up you just WiFi.  It keep an eye on flower eating deer and a pesky fox'es. I have two units.

Reviews.Title: Great price.
Reviews.Author: Richard k Rose
Reviews.Content: The thing is a little tricky to set up but I had no problems when I followed the instructions provided in the description. It helped us put the neighbor in jail who had been stealing our stuff for drugs.

Reviews.Title: Horrible product, with little or no support
Reviews.Author: Photoman30
Reviews.Content: After trying for two days to get the Wireless to work, I decided it was time to return this item.  Searched over and over again for some good support. amd all i could find was articles posted with the same issues that i had.  Would not recommend to buy.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase!!
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: This product is not supported by wansview...at all. It is an outdated product! Save yourself some hassle and frustration and buy locally!

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Clinton Keith
Reviews.Content: If this camera were to photograph a burglar, we might be able to tell the police the color of their clothing, but that would be it.UPDATE: This camera stopped working after 6 months.  Garbage!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: edrock "edrock"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, it works well. The motion sensitivity can be a bit touchy in the sense that the slightest difference in lighting can set it off, but otherwise it works well. One tip, the ring at the edge of the lens turns for focus, I didn't realize this right away. So if your image is blurry, turn the lens. This unit does not have an internal speaker, but it does have a built in mic. It also has an audio out jack to hook up external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Very very poor image quality ...
Reviews.Author: Raymond Chen
Reviews.Content: Very very poor image quality, color is off as well, can't recognize anything...Camera rotation is not convenient either. It stuck at some point, so you have to go opposite 360 degree...

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Juan Ramos
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. You can't beat it for the price. I also have a linksys wireless n which was released a few years ago; it still cost more than this one and doesn't do half the things the wansview does. If you're looking for an ip camera at a great price..look no further.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, gets the job done and then some.
Reviews.Author: Woodbooger
Reviews.Content: Directions are a little sketchy but beyond that, great purchase and happy with product.  Infrared is a nice backup at night when the baby monitor starts acting up.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get it Connect
Reviews.Author: RJS "Robert"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a cheap option to keep an eye on my dogs and my teenage kids after school.... I tried for two days to get this thing connected and I couldn't... I called their support people and was on the phone for nearly 2 hours... They offered to do a remote install for $49.99 which was almost as much as the camera was.. I didn't expect this thing to be a super bad HD surveillance camera I just wanted something basic that I could view from anywhere... I got the software installed and then it popped up that MAC address was incorrect..... I went into the command prompt and was able to verify the MAC address and it matched perfectly with what the software was saying... I tried to save and it told me the username or password is incorrect.... The bottom of the camera said default username was admin and password was 123456.. Didn't work... I even put a pin in the little reset hole and held it for 20 seconds to try and factory reset it... Didn't work.... Nothing would work for the password section... I even tried my wireless router password and everything.... too frustrating to mess with... So I am returning it.. In the mean time I went to a local electronics store and bought two My Dlink Cloud camera's and they were installed within 10 minutes and up and running... They do not pan/tilt but I got two of them for $100 and can keep an eye on my daughters when they walk in from school and keep an eye on the dogs in their kennels... Plus the my Dlink app and software works great with my Galaxy S3 and Nexus 7 Tablet....

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get the camera's to work
Reviews.Author: Martin Jones
Reviews.Content: I am computer literate and I couldn't get the cameras to work so I have to call tech support and pay and extra $60 to see if they can get them networked.  The camera's have to be mounted near a power supply in order for them to work properly...the cords show and well it's a mess...By the networked cameras and pay to have the wires run...

Reviews.Title: Wansview Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera
Reviews.Author: You Knowho
Reviews.Content: Wansview Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera is working for me. I have no networking background, no IT background, didn't go to collage and there was no such thing when I was in high school. To get this up and running this is what I did. I lurked maybe 3 security cam forums ( keywords ; IP cam, Wansview, Mobile Phone view. To start ) Of course I had to read and reread the directions more than a few times. After reading the forums the directions started to make sense. I started Friday after work and it went live Sunday morning, I took maybe 6 hours total to set it up for internet access WiFi style.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but....
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera since 1/2013. It does work as intended, the setup involving port forwarding (purpose of viewing on mobile device or computer not at home/work/location of camera) is tough for those who are not tech savy, but if you are a fast learner, then should be tough only once. After you have set it up, you remember it for future problems if any. I did have to activate the camera by plugging it directly into my router with an ethernet, after it was activated, wireless for the remainder of the setup. I did install the software from the CD, it is just a managing tool if you plan on recording on a computer directly. If you have only intentions of doing remote viewing, then the software on the CD is not needed, but you may want the pdf file for the directions of port forwarding and what not, as it does guide you to what to look for (very limited guide, but can put 2 and 2 together). There is a lot of lacking on this camera though, and it is my first, so I cannot comment if this is normal with other cameras or not. The lacking is, this is not a smart camera, So you may set up a motion detect alarm for a certain time, well in some cases it will just do the whole day instead of what you put the alarm for (example, I only placed motion alarm from midnight to 5am, but it kept sending motion alarm pictures to my email 24/7), so that part has failed, it did use to work a while ago. You can set up username and passwords for multiple people, family, friends. and can make them an administrator or operator, this is a poor feature as an operator you cant really do anything, so you pretty much have to make everyone an administrator. NOTE: The only way you can turn off the camera, is by unplugging it. Yes you do have a "power" button when your viewing in the browser or mobile device, but it only disables YOU from viewing it, so if two people are viewing it remotely and you hit the stop button to turn it off.. it has no effect on anyone else currently or planning on viewing it, MUST unplug it. The manufacture should greatly get on the wagon with enhancing the features as this camera has great potential. I would still buy it knowing what i know now. it is well worth the price... However, it does matter greatly on the location of the camera, cause once you are beyond 10feet, you cannot tell clearly who is there (unless of course you know them), so if a burglar comes in you will never get a good shot of him/her depending on its location. The only thing really you would be able to make out if a robbery occurs is, what they took, not who they are. I am NOT ordering more of this type of camera as I do need cameras that can get clear shots of faces for recognition in the event a burglar does enter. But I do recommend it for like babysitter spy cam, baby monitor type actions.

Reviews.Title: POS
Reviews.Author: Al Buterol
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty Tech Smart but I can NOT get this to work AT ALLNo support, no disk and no satisfaction. Not to mention not enough ports on my router. I had to remove either the network printer or the network enabled hard drive just to mess with this POS and STILL have it not work.Don't buy the cheap knock-off, you'll only get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good!
Reviews.Author: A. Fung
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to buy this for awhile now, and I finally bit the bullet.  It arrived promptly.  Unbox, connected it to router and pop in the CD.  I'm a computer technician so most of this is easy to me.  I used the config tool on the CD and set the IP, port, username, and password.Remoted in via my browser and hit a snag.  You need to download drivers from the camera itself, which Norton identified as a virus (WS.Reputation1).  You only seem to need these drivers if you use IE (as the documentation recommends) but it seems to work fine in Chrome with no additional drivers.  Curious.Remoted into my router to set up port forwarding then went to whatsmyip.com and got my IP and plugged it into my iphone plus the port (EG: 12.34.56.78:80) and it worked fine.  Controls for iphone are very simple - wish it was a bit more robust.

Reviews.Title: excellent for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: charlescrose
Reviews.Content: The cameras are great for the price. Programming for remote view was a little bit of a challenge, and getting them to be wireless was a challenge with the instructions included. Had to watch several youtube videos but got it nailed down. I ordered 6 more cameras after getting the first 2 hooked up and running. The IR is also very good on the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Wansview is good for you
Reviews.Author: Oldsoldier10
Reviews.Content: unlike the other eleventeen reviews I will limit mine to a single page.  Good cameras terrible instructions and hard to use software.  Using win7 pro I could not get the bsearch software to work, so I opened a WinXP virtual machine and copied the bsearch to it and ran it on the virtual and BAM I got the cameras to configure.Good cameras bad instruction GREAT PRICE and shipped via Amazon all around WIN.  I am getting an outdoor version soon.

Reviews.Title: Works great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Erik Johnson "EkriirkE"
Reviews.Content: Works just fine as advertised.  Nightvision is decent, very quiet pan+tilt. You can turn the indicator LED off.It has alarm hookups in the back if the inbuilt motion sense isn't enough to start the recording for you, and conversely can trip your alarm with its inbuilt motion sense.Natively it only saves individual JPG frames starting at 1x a second (no faster).  It connected to my WiFi fine and uploads to FTP no problem.  You can view live streaming on its internal web server.  Clarity is just shy of being able to recognize faces unless about 10ft close.BUT: VLC can stream 640x480 video from it without audio no problem, so you can use VLC to record the video to AVI, MP4 etc. if needed! ( File > Open Network >  [...]  ex.  [...]  )Also, the sentry modes (contant back-and-forth, and/or up-and-down) only work for about a minute before the unit stops in a random position.  Manual pan-and-tilt controls are click-at-a-time, meaning you cannot hold a button down and maintain a constant motion - just increments, no big deal.Compared to the Foscam, I think this is the better deal.  Foscam has hold-to-move where this is incremental, but this one has alarm hookups.  This one also has an optional blinking light which can be a deterrent, ut has a slightly cheaper build-feeling to it than the Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Great cam for the price, not so good documentation, but.....
Reviews.Author: Ak295
Reviews.Content: After a little playing around with the software, I think I have found the in and outs of how to set these things up properly first try. All 6 of mine are wireless now and work great bringing them up on the IPCMonitor software that comes with them.The Documentation lacks a lot, and i'm in the process of typing up a how-to on them to hopefully make it easier on others.I have high dollar cams at my place of work, and personally I think these are just as good if not better, pan/tilt, two way audio, all works great. Just the darn documentation isn't so good, ok, it's just plain bad. Just ordered 2 more :)

Reviews.Title: Does not work wirelessly
Reviews.Author: James J. Rank
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this simple.  I purchased this device hoping to use the wireless functionality that they advertise.  I discovered that it does not in fact connect wirelessly, and that there's a firmware problem with it.  However, Wansview support offers no firmware upgrades and simply told me to return it.  No support at all.  So it doesn't work and they won't support it...yeah...terrible product.  Don't buy this.

Reviews.Title: Not the right camera
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Set up was complicated and difficult. I had to return it. I do not recommend this camera to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: Could never get it working
Reviews.Author: Gina Garcia
Reviews.Content: The instructions are poor and I have still to get it working..I will let you know when I get it hooked up, I bought it a year ago.

Reviews.Title: perfect cheap IP camera
Reviews.Author: D. Soriano
Reviews.Content: this camera really works, easy to install and configure. I will buy another one for the other room, recommended the best one

Reviews.Title: Easy setup & works great!
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: I was able to get the device up and running on my wireless network in no time. I was a little discouraged when I ran Firefox on my linux box only to find out all of the controls require ActiveX (IE only). Still, I looked into my options, and found the apk of BI SmartEye on the CD. I looked on the Google marketplace and found an updated version also. The app itself doesn't look pretty, but it works and is free. I have also purchased TinyCam Pro from the marketplace and it connects to the camera flawlessly. Both apps (BI SmartEye and TinyCam Pro) allow me to control Pan/Tilt and hear audio, plus I can use my Android phone.I do not need to access this camera from outside of my network, so I have it blocked in my firewall. Being able to access the camera from my phone with an app has been great if I'm in any other room. Speaking of being in another room, I live in an older two-story home. My router is a Netgear WNDR4000 and the camera is on the second floor while my router is on the first. The signal is still great!

Reviews.Title: Can't get it to work wireless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When an amature buys something like this you take a risk of getting it to work. To this day it hasn't worked wireless even after many hours and attempts. Not user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Bought one then bought two more....frikin awesome
Reviews.Author: Ted "Ted"
Reviews.Content: FREE Android app (I used tiny cam but I'm sure there are others) allows you to monitor multiple cameras from your phone.  Bought this to keep tabs on the cat.....wife liked it so much we bought two more.  You could spend a grand or more with a professional security system or get the same thing for way less with these.  I agree with other reviews, setup requires some tech ability and knowledge of port forwarding on your home wifi router.  Have been using them over a year now....no problems, just fun.  (We travel a lot....cat cam is entertaining)

Reviews.Title: Works Great a year later
Reviews.Author: drpc2010
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item in February, 2012 and have had 2 running for 14 months. The initial setup was moderate however I have a networking background and already knew exactly what I would need to do to view the cameras from within and outside my network. I have viewed these cameras using IE 8,9,10 Iphone 3GS and 4S and the software on the vendor website. There is an app that the vendor has on their website that give Pan and Tilt control along with audio for the iphone. I am extremely happy with these cameras and would love to have more.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work.
Reviews.Author: Melissa Cirigliano
Reviews.Content: It doesn't turn on. I waited too long before opening my package and trying the camera. Now I'm stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: Going in yard sale
Reviews.Author: Cathy Olive
Reviews.Content: Not Cathy writing this, but her husband, Tom...I started my "surveillance system" with a Foscam model that preceded the F18918W. I purchased it over a year ago and still think it's a great camera.  The only thing it does is reset every so often on it's own, but that isn't a real biggie.When I saw the Wansview, I did a little research and came to the conclusion it's basically a renamed Foscam since it looked almost identical to my current camera.  IP software was similar as well.I didn't have any issues setting it up, but focusing was much more problematic than was the Foscam. Also the IR seemed to be brighter than the Foscam, which was a good thing.  Also, you could not create preset camera positions.  Still, for the price, I liked it alright. Sooo, I bought another.This one was trouble from the start. It just did not want to connect to wifi.  I finally found that if, after I set it up, I would need to unplug, hold the reset button (which is really, really small), plug it in and reset it again.  For some reason, this would cause it to adhere to the wifi. But if any little thing happened, it would lose the connection.I did notice the software and firmware was different than that of the first Wansview I had purchased. Thinking no big deal, I'd just download updates....good luck with that.  They just aren't there.  Wansview does have updates for Foscam cameras, but don't say if they are to be used with the Wansview models and if so, which ones?Another thing is that I could tie the first Wansview in with the Foscam software for multiple devices. The second one would not connect.  I ended up having to buy Blue Iris, which I have to admit is a good program.  The only problem is that the software must run all the time for it to serve to my DNS. If I could have just tied them in with the Foscam software, or their own software for that matter, I would not even have to leave my PC on.Yesterday was the last straw.  I pulled up Blue Iris and was greeted with my trusty Foscam image and two other images with colored bars.  My frustration peaked at that point and I just unplugged them both thinking they would hopefully sell in a yard sale for a few bucks.Before I do that, I may just go ahead and try the Foscam firmware and software updates offered on Wansview's website.  If I do, I'll come back here and share my results.April 22...Well, I decided to keep them.  They're back up and running, but not sure why.  Still have a range issue with one of them.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for its price
Reviews.Author: S. Lam
Reviews.Content: I bought one base on some of the reviews but there are a couple things I want to add to them.1) Yes, the picture quality is quite good even at no light. The audio part though is just alright due to a lot of background feedback from the build-in Mic. Installation instruction is straight forward but not for a normal DIYer. You need to know some computer networking knowledge to do it. BTW, you NEED to download the new version of the IPMonitor software to view it properly.2) The not so good side is that this camera uses Wireless-G standard (even though it says support 802.11b/g/n). Why do I say that? Because the range is very short, and it won't connect if I put it at the same distance as my Cisco Wireless-N IP Cam location. You definitely need a wireless/wire extension kit to work with this one.In conclusion, even considering the extra cost of the wireless/wired signal extension kit, it is still a very good buy for its video quality.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Garry the Mc
Reviews.Content: If you are not computer savvy, stay away from this product. Trying to hard wire camera because it cannot be returned. There are better camera out there do your shopping. Wansview made installation easier then it is.

Reviews.Title: good ip camera
Reviews.Author: yana vilenchik
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is not too bad to set up. Although you do need to have some understanding of networking, the instructions for the setup are very well put together and give you step by step instructions. The only thing is that I can't seem to figure out how to get the camera itself to record. There is a setting on it to record locally but then it won't let you set it. Also the software that comes with the camera is a bit buggy. You can record video with it, but it doesn't always work and the sound constantly dies or the app dies. There are other free software available on the market to use with an IP camera so probably better off trying one of them instead. (i haven't found a good substitute yet) Other then that, the camera itself works as advertised once you go through all the set up, you can access it online, move the camera around via the web, and if you set it up for motion detection and email notifications that seems to work but it's not perfect (not as responsive as I would expect it to be). For the price it's not a bad camera, but if you're looking to have a stable monitoring software you might want to look into what options you have available.

Reviews.Title: Wansview Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product! It looks very solid and very good.  It is inexpensive.  You will not regret to buy it with such price.  Highly recommended! I bought 4!

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Dario Pulcinelli
Reviews.Content: I've already bought load of these to install in family's houses. Versatiles, cheap, easy to set up and use with custom software/scripts. If only they have the vpn option will be perfect...

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: This is the only IP camera that I have every bought/used but I like it a lot. It was really easy to setup, I had it running in under 5 minutes.
