I set it up to watch my front door and it worked without errors for months. I had some software on my server that accessed the feed from the camera 24/7 for motion detection and recording. The camera sent the video over the WLAN at ~3Mbs for months without any problems. It didn't even get warm or anything like that. The night-vision mode works surprisingly well, there is a problem with reflections off the glass but angling the camera fixes that. I am glad I bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price, But Non-Techies Beware
Reviews.Author: Gerrit L. Burke
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a specific reason: I hated when I would just crawl into bed and gotten comfortable under the covers and my wife would say "Did you remember to shut the garage door?". Never being entirely certain, I'd always get up, find my robe, head downstairs and check the garage door only to find that I had indeed remembered to shut it...However, this camera has been waay too much fun to leave stuck in the garage all day. We've thoroughly enjoyed using the TinyCam app for our android phones to monitor our pets while we're out at work all day, and even found out that our dog makes a regular habit of sleeping on our living room couch at night.I'm in the IT industry, and I've been able to configure this camera to do some pretty cool stuff using the unintuitive, poorly translated instructions and interfaces that you'll see described in other reviews. However, there was lots of documentation and help on setting up similar cameras elsewhere online, and I was able to get this camera up and running on wifi in less than a half hour. Now that I've continue to play with it, I've scheduled the motion control alarms to send me email alerts whenever it detects motion while we're gone (which also includes 6 still-shots of whatever motion it captured). I also have it upload stillshots to an FTP server.All in all, this has been money extremely well spent. My previously skeptical wife has even voiced interest now in purchasing several more so we can monitor more of the house while away.PROS:1. Neat features built in (email alerts, ftp uploads, remote controllability with web interface or mobile app)2. Price3. Wifi range. So far, I've yet to find a spot in my house where this doesn't pick up a signal.CONS:1. Poor translations in interface and instructions2. Not designed for tech novices. You'll definitely want to phone a friend if you're not comfortable with basic networking and router configuration.3. Lack of remote control zoom. There is auto-focus, but no zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Skoczynski "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend for use in any room in the house.  Great for a kids room - scans and has night vision.  This is our third camera in our home.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy
Reviews.Author: nickelman
Reviews.Content: Dont buy it is nothing more than a camera shaped piece of with a blinking light ,  and dont try to call tech support they are not even in the country with no 800 number so be prepared to pay for long distance charges.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: T. Hughes
Reviews.Content: Setup was a little buggy, but read the reviews here and figured it out.  Had a bit of trouble configuring my router but after about a hour of work it was all up and running

Reviews.Title: IP Cam
Reviews.Author: GraffixBot
Reviews.Content: This product works as described. The people with bad reviews probably didn't setup the cam correctly. I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lots of cool options
Reviews.Author: robbyrobaz
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Lots of options available in this little guy:  Auto FTP upload, alarms to motion, mobile phone browsing and remote control, night vision is awesome, resolution adjustment, wifi enabled, etcI used this to check on my house while away, and record conversations when we have an argument (to prove the whole he said/she said) lolThe audio recording doesn't work well because the software doesn't record it unless it plays the audio live on your computer.  I don't want the echo of the recording playing live 24/7.Everything else works great.

Reviews.Title: product not does not do what it is supposed todo
Reviews.Author: Customer
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera a few months ago and over the corse of a few months useing it i noticed it wasn`t doing what it was supposed todo. when i would record and put on the microphone to record audio i noticed it would shutoff after about 5 or 10 minutes just recently i recorded video and it would shutoff after an hour or 20 minutes and this would happend all the time so if i were to buy another camera i wouldn`t buy this brand again "TWO THUMBS DOWN" its a ripoff and a fraud.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised
Reviews.Author: gb
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine for the basic functions.  It works both in daylight and in the dark, and it can be rotated around and up (and down a little).  I have the camera operating smoothly with viewing via the internet and not attached to a computer.  I could not get the motion sensing to do exactly what I wanted, but I could get a series of  pictures when motion was sensed, and I never was quit sure about whether the audio was working properly since it is not pertinent to my application.  However, the visual and rotation were the prime features for me, and they work well.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great
Reviews.Author: Joseph Brohman "Old Joe"
Reviews.Content: I recieved the camera in good shape. After some goofas we set it up to monitor a live trap in my attic. my squirrel problem resolved.The key to the setup was calling customer support,letting a tech take control of my computer from India. I just settled back in my chair and watched him set it up on my computer. Problem solved

Reviews.Title: 3 stars only
Reviews.Author: Aliendude
Reviews.Content: I have trying to keep my wits about this, so far Can get it to work for little while then loose it and spend for ever trying to get it to work again.  software is okay but could defently be more informative on setup etc. This is the second set of cameras that I have bought and so far non of them are easy/simple setup. so good luck!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. Palencia "Ron Palencia"
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else has mentioned the manual is not the greatest but with help from other reviews I managed to set up my 2 cameras in about an hour.  Networking knowledge is definitely helpful!  Picture quality is good. With motion detect on I found that the camera will use about 1/4 GB an hour for heavy activity.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product support
Reviews.Author: Dan Hinsley
Reviews.Content: First the camera performs really well for such a low price.  Setting up the wireless was a little tricky, but the customer support was really excellent.  I had several questions about how to use the product and got timely and informative answers to my email questions.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This camera is decent. I have it set up so I can monitor my house from my cellphone and every once in a while I get a nice surprise like a picture of a cow moose and her 2 newborn calves!

Reviews.Title: Great added security
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera is fairly small, easy to install and somewhat easy to set us so as to view from anywhere.  It's a great addition to my home security system.  If the alarm goes off I can quickly check all entry points and the main living area of my home from anywhere.  I only gave it 5 stars because there wasn't six.

Reviews.Title: friendly interface for pc
Reviews.Author: William R. Delano Jr.
Reviews.Content: easy to setup and see images on pc screen. no image on LG android device yet.lots of flexibility to pan images from pc screen

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: DEADMAN
Reviews.Content: I bought this item for security reasons in my office.... this item has been working well.... night vision is good (B&W;), the color is good... it is a narrow view but fully pan and tilt able to view your area...The alerts and motion detection are spot on.  Would recommend to a friend. :)

Reviews.Title: Wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Leggalegalu
Reviews.Content: This camera was difficult to set up and I haven't been able to view remotely. Also it hasn't downloaded images to my hard drive or email alerts. Also the support is out of the country and they don't help you immediately. They call you back but I'm usually no longer available by then. Waste of my hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: Out of focus, disconnects too frequent, and NOT dependable.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Out of focus, often disconnects, and not dependable.  Looks a lot like Foscam but does NOT come close in video performance.  I can handle everything but the OUT OF FOCUS video.  So sad, I had a lot of hope.

Reviews.Title: Absolutley Awesome
Reviews.Author: M. & S. N. "Bargain Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this as a security camera through our router for months. It's worked perfectly. It sends any motion detection (night or day) to an e-mail address that I can keep track of.

Reviews.Title: Great for the dollar!
Reviews.Author: Deadlyfrog
Reviews.Content: Purchased to keep an eye on my dog when unattended inside. Setupwas a breeze. Had online within an hour. IP and MAC addresseswere not what the instructions stated, but I setup through my netbookwith supplied cable. Once setup, I attached to my wireless systemand used my windows phone to instantly view locally and remote. Once I adjustedthe focus ring, picture was perfect. Night IR picture is also great. With a littlenetworking experience this camera is worth the bucks!

Reviews.Title: Wasn't as wireless as expected
Reviews.Author: Luana S. Feigelstock
Reviews.Content: It seems to be made well but I returned it because it involves wiring that seemed too much for me.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for an excellent price
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I checked out a few different cameras before selecting this one.  It has been very reliable and I get great picture - including night vision in the dark.I saw in some of the other reviews issues with the software - yes it is not the greatest. After you use the bsearch_en utility and give it a valid ip on your network (or leave it at dhcp and just scan your network for it later).  Then use iSpy opensource software. It's model is in the dropdown list and once you either put your ip address in you specified or scan your network and find it - it works flawlessly.So anyways - great camera. Just use iSpy (free) or some other nvr software.  I will probably get another one for monitoring some of my animals outside.

Reviews.Title: works fine
Reviews.Author: kalvan
Reviews.Content: It took a while to set it up with internet, but it works fine. I can see what's going on in my home from my cel phone. higher resolution would be nice, but great for the price.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Zvi Cohen
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good and I use it in my house. the shipment was just in time and fast.

Reviews.Title: Wansview
Reviews.Author: Tati
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the camera to be wireless with an easy set up. Turned out it's neither one. I am very upset by the purchase. The seller also should mention that mac computer is not to be used for installation.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: supratik gupta
Reviews.Content: This camera is really great . Its far far better than what I expected.The night vision feature and its remote turning capability is really awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - virtually impossible for the non-techie  to install wirelessly
Reviews.Author: alex massimi
Reviews.Content: The camera works great and is priced right BUT... unless you have a PhD in Computer Science, you will find this device challenging to install without the use of the Ethernet cable.  I'm more computer literate than most and it took me more than an hour to get it to work using WiFi.  Even after I got it to work, I'm not sure how I did it.  The directions are useless and most of the advice you'll find on the Internet is as well.  Once you do get it working, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Dinh Nguyen
Reviews.Content: The product seems to be ok. Other than that, have not had a chance to put it to work yet.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price.
Reviews.Author: Reston_CEM
Reviews.Content: Resolution is as advertised, good motion etc, I have one sitting outside (not in direct rain or snow) works as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and effective
Reviews.Author: GWillz
Reviews.Content: Works great out of the box, I have two setup as wireless and I don't see any noticeable bandwidth issues. Simple to setup administration and alerting [I have mine send pictures to my phone]. I do wish it had native capability to store actual video clips; right now it can only FTP/email 1 second interval pictures. I will probably be adding to recording software, I recommend Blue Iris.

Reviews.Title: Wansview Wireless IP Camera
Reviews.Author: SE
Reviews.Content: This order came on time and was what I ordered.  I ordered two of them and one cdrom software disk was broken.  I was able to use the other cdrom to get the software so everything is good.  I have not used the wireless, just the wired port and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Wrong Camera
Reviews.Author: Joe Guff
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this product from this company.  I was not shipped the camera in the picture but it looks the similar worked so I thought it was just an aesthetics thing.  When I attempted to access the camera using Apps it would not connect or function properly when I would select Wansview cameras.  When I went to update the product I found that they had shipped me the wrong product.  I was shipped a far inferior MayGion IP camera instead of the Wansview.  Unfortunately I found this out too late to return.

Reviews.Title: If you know about networking this is a gem of a deal
Reviews.Author: Timothy Harris
Reviews.Content: I received the product early and it was very easy to assemble and hook up.  The best way is to use youtube and it is smooth saling.  It is also a great price and I saw them on ebay for 100 dollars.  So if you know how IP addresses work and watch the videos, you will love this cam.  I plan to buy more in the future from this same seller hoping they stiil will have them in stock at such a low price.  It does what is claims and you just have to be patient.  I give this an A+ because the shipping was very fast and the price was right for sure.  I work on computers for a living, so this was a snap to get going.

Reviews.Title: Depressing
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: It took several attempts to obtain a 'working' product and when I received one, the item was not what I ordered, but it did work.  This does not end here...  the product I did receive was more expensive then the original, did not have the features advertised nor did it operate properly.  I recommend anyone looking for this type of device should not purchase from this vendor.

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Terrible Setup Instructions
Reviews.Author: RyFi
Reviews.Content: This camera seems to be working perfectly.Upon getting it home and attempting to get it to work wirelessly, I came back to the instructions listed in a previous review. Although the instructions were greatly helpful, it still took me roughly 4 hours to get everything set up correctly. Keep in mind that that does not include setting up a static IP address for the camera as I was simply fed up with messing with it at that point.Overall, good product, worked as described, glad I purchased it for such a deal!

Reviews.Title: Just what I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: SueGunny "SueGunny"
Reviews.Content: I am not a highly technical person.  So for me to be able to install and use.... it gets 5 stars.  Love the night vision.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Wissam
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for the price, i connect to it from my phone, kindle fire HD, PC and it streams very well. It doesn't come w a lot of documentation, so you have to do some internet research on how to install it but it is fairly straight forward.

Reviews.Title: Works quite well
Reviews.Author: Eric in Vegas
Reviews.Content: The software and admin web pages on this device leave a little to be desired, but once configured this works well for the price.  It's obviously not HD quality or bitrate, but the sensor doesn't do too bad with the IR LEDs.  I can clearly see 20 feet in pitch darkness.  The built in motion detection isn't too great; the still captures it emails upon detection show people but typically with so much motion blur they cannot be identified (unless you already know who you're looking at).  While this probably would not help identify a burgler, it seems good for keeping an eye on the kids.

Reviews.Title: Best choice I could've made!
Reviews.Author: xenasculee "Crystal"
Reviews.Content: Everyone's instructions on here seem complicated...BUT I was willing to go through a few hours of figuring out how this thing set up, to save a hundred or so bucks on a camera.Things dumbed down for setting up:Regardless where you're setting up your cam, set it up initially near your router. You've gotta hook it up to the router to get the wireless to work. Once you've got your software downloaded to your computer, you can run it from there.I'm running through google chrome (not IE). Let's see if I recall correctly...because the "quick setup" instructions seemed to be a lot different that what actually needed to be done.Run the IPCamSetup, client, and appinstall. One of them makes you restart your computer. Once it restarts, there's an icon with a video camera on it (mine showed on the desktop). When you click it, it'll open a window. If you're cam isn't plugged up to the router, that window will be blank. Once it does show up, it'll be an IP address. Double click that and it'll open up a web browser where you can set everything up. Wireless connection-- tell it to scan. THEN SCAN A SECOND TIME. For some reason it won't work on the first try (even says this in the instructions). Click your connection and then to use it. There's info to fill out under that. Then submit.Your cam will reboot, and the browser will do a countdown for you. Wait until your cam stops moving, then unplug the ethernet cable from the cam. Now, I had a bunch of trouble getting it to work once taking the cable out. But I ran that scan again after it was unplugged, and somehow it decided it was gonna work.From there, I put my camera down in the basement where I intended to set it up. Upon plugging it back up, its connection was still good. You can control everything from the web browser view, but I like the client app because it's smoother. But while your browser is open, if you want it to email you upon motion detection, you'll need to set it up to do so. This is under the "other" option. It's a little confusing if you don't use smtp stuff often. Basically fill out your email addy in both the sender and recipient boxes. I use gmail, so in the smtp box you would type smtp.gmail.com. Port box: 465 and choose TLS from the dropdown. CLick the Need Authentication box and fill out the next set of info, which is your email addy and your email password. Now...that little test button says to test before clicking submit, but I couldn't get it to be successful until I submitted. You may not have the same problem. It'll send you a test email, then. And to make sure your alert is set, go jump around in front of the camera and come back and check your email! Alerts are also set up in the "other" option.It took me a better part of the afternoon to get this set up...But hey! It's working and I spent a small amount of money! I'm happy lol

Reviews.Title: Much better than expected
Reviews.Author: Samuel Grund
Reviews.Content: The software is a little silly, but the web interface is great.  Much better quality than I expected for a cheap wifi camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera to watch a home renovation project. The camera was easy to set up even on a Mac. (The was a Mac utility included on the CD.) The utility gives you the IP address of the camera. You enter that IP address in your browser. The remaining set up is done from the browser.I have the camera mounted upside down in my window looking out at the project. There a toggles to flip and mirror the image to correct the orientation. The video looks great.The only downside is that every so often the camera loose its wifi connection. Unplugging the power gets it back online.

Reviews.Title: Camera functions okay/Audio useless
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, actually a bunch of them, because I thought they'd make a good security/surveillance/intercom system for my house.  They don't.  If you are looking for one or two cameras to use as a remote web cam they will work okay.  But the video quality over the internet is quite poor.I connected just 4 cameras to a wireless router, so data congestion on the router should not have been a factor.  The video clarity is okay, certainly not half as good as standard definition television, but not too bad.  But the frame rate varies wildly from 15 frames per second (fps) to zero, frequently locking up for half a minute at a time.The built in web page that is used to interact with the camera is pretty good, but you will spend several hours tweaking the settings to get it to work the way you want it to.  If you want to access it from outside your home you will need to know how to set up port forwarding on your router.  And you'll likely need to contact your ISP and get them to bridge your modem (lets just say they're not plug and play).  You do have the option of accessing the camera through a Chinese website.  So please password protect your camera in the settings!  Because as it comes in the box a Chinese website will have access to your video stream.  I personally don't trust their discretion.Now the audio.  The microphone on the camera is okay when listening to faint sounds.  But they quickly overmodulate when someone talks nearby, and voice quality becomes unintelligible.  Also, the intercom feature is useless.  Many sellers incorrectly imply that the camera has a speaker.  In fact one side of the yoke is designed to look like a speaker.  But it isn't.  There is instead only an audio out jack that you must plug a speaker into.  If you do you'll find that the volume is not controllable, and is always low.  So to work as an intercom as advertised you'd need to plug a powered/amplified speaker into the camera.  If you do this you'll find that it is still useless, as the audio is so intermittent that it sounds like your talking to China on a cheap cell phone with zero bars of signal.Basically, don't expect much from this cheap camera.  I gave it 2 stars because it is cheap, otherwise it would get zero.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price.
Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: Other reviews have already beat this guy a few times. I can say after picking up different brands that look similar, this one has had the best night vision so far, distance wise. Could be better IR Cut elsewhere, but I didn't find the colors that big deal since I can see way down the hallway. Not the greatest web interface, but solid. About the networking, there are already instructions on there for creating a private network from your laptop to the camera with the supplied network cable just long enough to configure it. Once on your wifi, this thing can sit just about anywhere.Price vs resolution, really good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: WansView
Reviews.Author: Geovanny Salazar Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, lacks nothing but the zoom I tried it from different places and work without any problemPerfectly recommended, while my colleagues at work bought it days after I made a presentation at the office for the safety of my home

Reviews.Title: Wireless surveillance
Reviews.Author: Derrick F. Gaillard
Reviews.Content: I returned this, a little more complicated to set up then I expected.  I was really hoping for a hide a way type camera.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: George Boozer "bowhunter"
Reviews.Content: I loved the cameras, were very clear, but had a problem with them working with some other cameras on my system, I think it might have been software issues, or more technical setup problems and not the cameras themselves, so I had to go a different direction.

Reviews.Title: Damn the setup
Reviews.Author: H. P. Carr "hollyfrog"
Reviews.Content: The setup of this camera wasted two days of my time and half a day of a friend I enlisted to help me.  My friend is a tech geek so I was hoping this would speed up the process but the setup just sucks.  When I read the instructions I thought no problem I can handle this but there were so many other issues not addressed by the setup that I was totally frustrated. The camera gives a grainy photo but for the price its fine.  The sensor works pretty acurately.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: John M. Eeckhout
Reviews.Content: I paid <$100 for my unit, with partial knowledge of computer networking. After several grueling hours, I am pleased with it.The best features are the free internet hosting, email alerts and the programmable time schedule. John Upstate NY.

Reviews.Title: 50/50----- GOOD N BAD
Reviews.Author: Al Smith
Reviews.Content: tHIS IS A GREAT CAMERA, BUT IT'S NOT FOR THE LAYMAN WHO TRIES TO GET IT CONNECTED AND TO GET IT TO OPERATE. i HAD TO HIRE A ELECTRONIC TECH TO CONNECT IT. GOOD BUY AND GREAT AFTER IT'S WORKING.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to set up
Reviews.Author: GrammyWindy
Reviews.Content: Was very difficult to set up, and it doesn't work the same as the EasyN cameras I had purchased. Still fiddling with this thing to learn how to get it to work like the others! I have old windows...regular window with a storm window..and the reflection even with putting tape around the focus ring didn't help! Am going to try an IR illuminator!

Reviews.Title: Awesome features for a low price!
Reviews.Author: DE
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviews have said, it does everything that is says it does... if you know what you are doing and are proficient with IP address configuration and router management.  The reviews that gave this product a low rating probably just don't know how to set it up correctly.  Overall it is a great product and I plan to buy a couple more.

Reviews.Title: Tough to setup but works great afterwards
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: This camera isn't the easiest to setup but once you're able to get it configured it works great and is powerpacked with features. To set this up I simply installed a DHCP server on my windows computer and plugged the camera in directly using a network cable. The camera received an IP and I was able to access it via the browser on that IP to configure it. Once it's configured and on your wireless network you can configure it wirelessly.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the price, the reviews were not all that great on it but I figured I would give it ago.  Camera arrived with the factory seal on it but when I opened it the flashing around the leds on the camera was peeling off.  The first time I barely tried to tighen the mount to the camera the knob to tighten it broke.  Seemed to have pretty clear video for the first few hours but when I left and came back home the video had gone really fuzzy and I could not get it to clear up.  Just seems to be a cheap camera so I returned because it was defective it and purchased  another brand.

Reviews.Title: Works as described
Reviews.Author: Aaron Hall
Reviews.Content: Cheap wireless IP P/T Camera with night vision says it all. Great bang for the buck. Video quality is decent, wish it was higher resolution but over very pleased. It was a little tricky getting it setup on my network.

Reviews.Title: Buyer feedback
Reviews.Author: debton
Reviews.Content: Received exactly what is promised.  We received this product in a few days and the packaging was very good, no problems with the product.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Nettles
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but I can't figure this camera out so I bought a wireless webcam instead. How does it work anyway?

Reviews.Title: Did not work with any smartphone IP cam software
Reviews.Author: Pappy Hound
Reviews.Content: Regarding the Wansview Wireless IP Camera - I previously purchased 2 similar IP cameras (Foscam FI8910W) and set them up no problem. I'm familiar with setting up routers, port forwarding, dynamic dns, etc, so I know the process. I wanted more cameras and did some research and found these. Supposedly Wansview makes the Foscam and similar clones, so I figured it should be no big deal to get them up and running. I was partially right. I got them running on my LAN (the picture quality was poorer than the Foscam). However, the cameras refused to work when trying to view them on any of our smart phones (Android using IP Cam Viewer Lite and Win 8 using IP Cam Controller). IP Cam Controller kept throwing an error message about an invalid header (or similar, I didn't write it down). Also, the cameras are not even labeled Wansview. They look like generic, bootleg copies taken off the line before they were even branded, thrown into a small white box and hustled out the back door of the factory. Nowhere did it have a model number I could look up and try to find firmware. WTF! After searching and trying to identify firmware that might work, and dealing with sketchy websites with partial or crappy information, I decided I didn't want to screw with them anymore and returned them the next day.

Reviews.Title: IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This would get a 5 star rating except for one problem. If you ceiling mount the camera (which I needed to do) the image is upside down. The web page that uses ActiveX controls (so you need to use Internet Explorer to access it) allows you to flip and reverse the image, but the "mobile" web page will not allow you to do this. So, accessing the camera image on a cell phone means flipping over your phone (or creating another web page to flip the image correctly - if you have the skills).Otherwise, the camera was really easy to set up and get working.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Little Camera - Setup not for average Joe
Reviews.Author: John Silvia "Piratefish Org Guy"
Reviews.Content: So setting this up is a little annoying.  Basically, my unit came with an IP address hard-coded of 192.168.0.4 and DHCP wasn't turned on - and neither was UPnP.  Once I turned on DHCP and saved the setting, it rebooted.  Then I "found" it again (by looking in my Netgear router and seeing the list of connected devices), and then I told it to turn on UPnP and THEN it was reachable via the name on the sticker on the camera.The folks in their QA department need to hire someone that reads and writes English better, because the Engrish documentation will send more sensitive types jawing about how things just don't make sense, Etc. Etc.  Deal with it Bubba, you got a PTZ camera for $50, now shut up.Once you start focusing on the features and capabilities, you realize a few things:1) Camera performs EXACTLY as I expected.  It's not great, but it's better than being blind.2) Documentation is minimal and is written in Engrish.3) Web interface is written in Engrish as well.4) It takes someone who understands what they want to figure out all the corners of this thing.5) The web gui has some pleasant surprises that aren't documented well.So item 5 needs some qualification.  First up, I connected my camera to iSpy running on a VM and it worked great - now I'll setup a dedicated server for iSpy and let that go - and get more of these.Without iSpy and all it's magic running in the background, all but the zoom feature is accessible on the camera - I've not found the zoom feature in the web gui yet, but in iSpy it actually does OPTICALLY zoom and pretty well too - no digital zoom!The camera has built in smarts that include the ability to send email about motion, use automatic DDNS, connect to MSN, activate ADSL connections and the Wifi works pretty decent too - my house has N and G, and it only works with the G stuff, which is fine - all the high performance stuff runs on N, so they can live and play nicely.The alarm stuff supports the external triggers (the rear pins) and Audio triggering as well as motion and can be  scheduled, plus it can send emails, FTP pictures out.  iSpy at no cost could take videos and upload them to youtube automatically...There appears to be some kind of built in networking these cameras can do as well - not sure how that all works, but it looks interesting.  There's some stuff about setting record and alarm paths as well.  The unit keeps a connection log and has the ability to control it's name, time, date, and even has the option to update the firmware.Overall, the thing is impressive.  For the price I paid (just under $50), you get a solid wired/wireless camera, power supply & mounting bracket.  Mounting these outside is likely a bad idea - definitely not waterproof, but as an indoor camera, these are perfect - I should have gotten it in white..

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for a low price!
Reviews.Author: Arquimedes Paredes "Arqui"
Reviews.Content: I just bought two of this cameras, I didnt want to spend too much money so decided to get these. It's really easy to set (it have a good guide) but you need to have some basic knowledge of IP, routers and stuff like that. I gave 4 stars because the software to manage multiple cameras and record video in your computer it is not available for Mac!

Reviews.Title: Good Product, Lousy Setup Instructions
Reviews.Author: R. Schatten
Reviews.Content: The product performed as expected once the setup was completed. Unfortunately, the set up instruction are incomplete and, as usual for most Chinese products, unintelligible. The set up instructions are fairly clear to the point where you are ready to attempt to use the wireless capabilities of the camera. At that point, the instructions are non-existent. I spent a few hours trying to get the wireless to work. After reading multiple threads found on the internet, all of which did not help, I finally stumbled onto how to set up the wireless.Since I now know how to set up the camera, I have ordered a second one to complete the coverage I require.

Reviews.Title: Setup is easy both wired and wireless. Included software did not work on Win7
Reviews.Author: Mizon
Reviews.Content: Setup was easy and you don't need to be a computer scientist to it. Others on this forum have given great instructions so I will refrain from giving more. The only issue I faced was that the software did not work on Win 7 (this is the software that I got on the company website). Outdoor mounting will be tricky since there are no included accessories for it. Cannot see thorough window in the dark due to IR reflection off window pane. So, it will necessitate outdoor installation if you want to monitor the outdoors. Otherwise it works great.

Reviews.Title: Wifi not connect
Reviews.Author: Z. Li "electronics lover"
Reviews.Content: Wifi connection did not work for me. I tried it for a week, only once the wifi got connected. After a reboot, it would not connect any more.

Reviews.Title: So So
Reviews.Author: Mark Grand
Reviews.Content: The documentation is a bad translation from chinese. The camera is not reliable. The password to access the camer's web interface already reset itself to the factory default.  The night vision feature makes blurry still pictures. The software that comes with it to monitor and record video is unable to access the video.

Reviews.Title: Bargain purchase for the quality
Reviews.Author: sf reviews "monki415"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a really good deal for the price.  I am no techie and so if it was up to me to install, I would struggle.  Thank god I have someone who is familiar with the lingo and he struggled a bit, but was able to over come and follow the directions of other reviewers and got the item up and running within a total of few hours.  It's definitely not a plug & play.  So far image quality is pretty good.  Able to view online and via phone (iPhone & Android) app.  Can remotely pan/zoom.  There is a record video feature, but haven't figured that one out yet.I will come back to add more comments once I play around with it some more.  Oh one thing that does annoy me about this camera is the green blinking status light; hard to discreetly place this.  I should say the purpose or purchasing this camera is to use it as a baby monitor so the night vision is fantastic.Bought this for $47.99.  If the price is any higher, maybe re-consider because it is a pain in the a to get this up and running.  It's definitely note a plug and play.In retrospect comparing to this and my $250 Motorola baby monitor, I have to say that the Motorola is much better in terms of quality.  The monitor is instant, the connection is consistent and dependable.  Only difference b/w the two is the ability to view via internet.  I wouldn't trade my Motorola for this.

Reviews.Title: Impressive amount of options
Reviews.Author: Merrick
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the capabilities of this camera.I have a fair amount of technical background so I had no issue setting it up, though I could understand other consumers frustrations. The documentation was rather poorly translated.Pan, tilt, night vision (Hampers color a bit) Wireless, easy mobile device connect, can use it as an intercom with speakers connected, groupable, programmable scan templates... all for a very reasonable price.Over all I am quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great value if you can set your DCHP, Port Forwarding
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: I've setup many of these cameras, so I was up and going in minutes.I can tell you this camera is a preset in popular Android and IOS software so you can get the full functionality of PTZ on your device, and it also comes with a native android app which isn't as nice as most IPCam viewer software available on their respective markets.  Web interface works great in FirefoxIf you're a novice looking for precise instructions, easy install, etc - you're going to have to spend a couple hundred dollars and go with a brand name product.If you have some basic networking skills and want a great value in a PTZ IP camera - get this one.One tip - use the focus ring on the camera to get a crisp picture.  I was worried everything was blurry when I first started, but after turning the focus ring about 900 degrees counterclockwise I had a nice crisp image anywhere in the large room.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Jason D. McDonald "Sir Cusfreak"
Reviews.Content: Works great, good wifi. Easy to set up and use, was steering it from my tablet in minutes. Good picture quality. PTZ is a must have, and this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: Watch out this is a Brand X camera
Reviews.Author: Steve D.
Reviews.Content: This is not a Wansview camera but a generic one that looks the same.  Is that bad?  I don't know I am unsure if the Wansview firmware will work with it.  Also the image is washed out but what can you expect for this price.  I recommend getting an IP Cam with an IR Cut filter for better image quality, it's work the extra $15-$20.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Manoj T
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and easy to set up with my Mac and pc. I was able to set up alerts easily, too. The UI is outdated.

Reviews.Title: About as good as the rating indicates....
Reviews.Author: Jason Lane
Reviews.Content: I figured most of the issue was with people not knowing how to config, hence the low ratings. I work in IT and figured it'd be fairly simple. And it should be....But the PDF instructions for the unit actually misguide you. I had no issues getting port forwarding and WPA2 - AES setup with no issue. Followed instructions to a tee even though I knew what I was doing - but the instructions actually say that the MAC address is the same, wireless or ethernet connection. That would have been a new one for me, and they're wrong.Indeed, you must repeat the setup process once you've turned wireless on via wired connection, as the different MAC addy will cause your router to issue new IP's for the different connection, as is always the case.That the poorly written manual instructs you other wise is really annoying.Ignore the manual, google your model number and search for <10 mins and you'll find some simple instructions for hooking up WAN and LAN.Slow frame rate on wireless, but I think my signal is weak  - gonna make a coupleold routers laying around into repeaters to see if that helps.Overall OK, lots of audio interference.

Reviews.Title: Hmm...
Reviews.Author: ape263
Reviews.Content: This is an OK camera for the price. I have two of them set up, and I have them both set up to email me when something changes. I also have them both set up to where I can view them remotely, and also via an app on my phone. In that regard, These cameras are great. The problem is, should anyone ever want to come in, if they run towards the camera, all you will see is a blur. Even if they walk somewhat fast towards the camera, all you will see is a blur. With the email feature, you will be alerted that someone has broken in, but you will be unable to provide an accurate description to the police, and that is what counts. Also, light (a flash light) tends to block the camera's view, but this is something I'm assuming would happen with any camera.

Reviews.Title: easy to use & no problems on my mac
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Oleary
Reviews.Content: the version i received, which looks just like the picture, came with a cd with both mac and windows software.  easy installation - plug it into my network, run the software, it finds the camera.  give it a manual ip address and you can access it via browser or the included software.i had used http://www.amazon.com/gp/pdp/profile/A18YNTBE5AQMHD/ref=cm_cr_pr_pdp guide as a reference & the only thing i found different was that once the ip address was assigned manually the camera keeps it so when you unplug the network & move the camera to a place where you want to use the wireless you don't have to change the ip address again.

Reviews.Title: Works as expected.
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This has worked as expected.  We can now make sure our 1 year old is safe in his toddler bed.  It was a bit hard to set up as others have said and the instructions are bad.  There are some good reviews on Amazon that help.  The key I was missing was that if you have a WEP or WPA, you need to go into the camera setting and enter this information.  Seems obvious, but it isn't in the directions.  Wish the resolution was better.

Reviews.Title: good function, with good price
Reviews.Author: Rocky Lee
Reviews.Content: it does work through internet network, I can monitor from anywhere, the only drawback is software supported well, lots ipcam software not list this brand and model.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but horrible documentation
Reviews.Author: Todd C. Keyser
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera more for fun than security. I was curious what my dogs were doing while I was away so I wanted to have a camera that I could keep an eye on them with. I am pretty good with computers, but I have to say that I struggled with getting this camera configured the way I wanted it, which was being able to use my iPhone to view the camera feed. The was not too difficult to get set up to view from a computer on my network, but getting the camera to be viewable from my smart phone took a lot of guessing and searching on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Works great, couldn't ask for more at this price
Reviews.Author: Sumpter Smartt
Reviews.Content: I received this item yesterday and had it up and running in a couple of hours. If you don't know what a static IP address or subnet is you might have trouble setting this up. The documentation isn't great, but google around for better documentation written by someone whose first language is English. The included software isn't great, but isn't terrible either. I may try setting up ispy or zoneminder to really unlock the full potential of this camera. I've got 2 more on the way. I purchased this to act as a video baby monitor. It serves that purpose quite well, I was worried I wouldn't be able to see if her eyes were open in the dark, but the IR light reflects in her eyes similar to how a cat or dog's eyes reflect a camera flash.

Reviews.Title: Wansview IPCamera is a pain...
Reviews.Author: L. JARQUIO
Reviews.Content: I've had the same problems as the 1 star reviews of this product and obviously have had some IT experience under my belt.  The instructions even if followed to the T yielded no results as well as not being able to ping the camera from my webbrowser(s)  After several hours of frustration and trying different things even suggestions from the web.  I was not able to get a picture nor able to get this product working.  I kept getting the message the device does not want to accept a connection while it was tethered to my router, I had not even gotten to the wireless part because I could not even get into the camera itself after several hours of trying.  I tried looking for updated firmware, changing the several things on my router, but I quickly realized that I had a substandard product a hit or miss item and a defective poorly manufactured product.If you want to frustrate yourself for several hours and have nothing better to do, want to waste your time playing with JUNK and raise your blood pressure, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.  If you want to get something that actually WORKS and your not into being an IT detective, then get something else... this product IS A JOKE.  Rather the instructions that came with it are MISLEADING and will have you trying to fit the square peg in the round hole....My shipment didn't come with the REAL instructions, you have to download them by googling the model number of the camera... I didn't realize that your ROUTER IP CONFIG has to be 192.168.0.X!!!! not the REGULAR 192.168.1.X  After that you have to follow the WORD DOC instructions and you should be able to get into the CAMERA to make your Settings...I wish they had made that CLEAR but the instructions that came with it made me change the last octet of the IP address to the same octet of my ROUTER!!! Causing many problems...This will HELP the 1 Star reviewers... I think....[...]

Reviews.Title: inexpesive
Reviews.Author: BW "Wintros"
Reviews.Content: was a little tricky to set up but works great on any PC, have not had any luck with provided software for my Mac or iTouch, however you can veiw the feed from any web browser.

Reviews.Title: Alarm Server Function Missing
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Frey "MD Modeler"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this product 5 stars.  I have ordered 5 of these cameras and they have been great.  However, the last 2 cameras came with a different version of the Web UI than the previous 5.  This was really an issue for me.  I found a way around it but the camera was advertised to have an "alarm server" function (just like the last 5 I purchased).  This function has been removed from the WebUI for this camera and I can't find the older WebUI firmware that has the alarm server feature.  It took some hacking but I found the API supports an HTTP_URL setting.  This allowed me to get the functionality I needed but it's not at all intuitive.  Essentially, I had to call the camera's API then I could enter the alarm server URL I needed: [...]After that API call is made then go back to the Alarm settings in the Web UI for the camera in your browser and you will see a new field for the HTTP URL for your alarm server.  Enter your alarm server URL and submit.These cameras come with the a lot of features for the cost but you'll have to work a little to get to them.

Reviews.Title: Good network camera.
Reviews.Author: occasional-buyer
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera I purchased.  Only had an issue with the power supply.  Other than that, they're fine.  They work better in bright lighting.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and great product
Reviews.Author: Derrick Cawthon
Reviews.Content: For the price I could not ask for more. I installed this easily and it works great to monitor my children. I like the fact you have 3 different views (IE, Chrome, mobile) and the interface is easy to use. The camera stays connected to my wireless network and is very easy to control. For the price we paid it was a great value. I will probably buy more to augment our security system. The power cord could be a little longer (about 3 ft) but other than that it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Works bad WiFi and Noisy
Reviews.Author: R. Smith
Reviews.Content: 1. Documentation week2. Hard time with IE best with FireFox then Chrome3. It works great with direct Connect.  Would give it a 4.5 on Direct connect4. WiFi worked but the range was POOR - FosCam FI8910W had a fine range.5. Noisy - made noise when moving. Which is not fun.I also, have Panasonic BL series which I like but are more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Bought two, both died within 3 days
Reviews.Author: nate
Reviews.Content: It works great once you get it working.  At least, that's what I thought.  The first one I bought became completely unresponsive after 3 days, the second one after only 1.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Most bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: ohmylittlecamera
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based on mixed reviews. This is the best camera you can buy for 50 bucks. It is feature packed, has Wifi and wired ethernet built in and have external alarm points and a whole host of other great features. Word to the wise, if you are not familiar with setting up computer networks or at least have a working knowledge of it then this camera will not be the greatest thing for you since the instructions were poorly translated from Chinese. To anyone else who has experience setting up the advanced functions of a home internet router this is an awesome little camera. The only reason why I give this item less than 5 stars is the poor translation to english on the instructions. Also this camera IS NOT meant to be out in the weather.

Reviews.Title: Sound did not work
Reviews.Author: Michael Dosch "Fr. Michael"
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this security camera until I found out that I could not hear its microphone, which was my main reason for getting it.  Apparently, you have to have an older 32-bit processor.  That seemed odd to me.  I could not get the sound to work on any of our computers or cell phones.

Reviews.Title: Video Quality Marginal - DDNS did not work correctly for me
Reviews.Author:
R. Fairchild "Love Audible.  
Interests incl...
Reviews.Content: Ok..I have two other cameras, both cost more, so, the video quality probably matches the difference in price on this unit...$50 vs $85.The DDNS setup works fine and fairly easily on my X10 and my Foscam..this one worked for a minute or two, then couldnt get it to work even after a few hours of constantly trying different things.  Possibly operator error, but with other cameras working fine and I have an MCSE, 25 years of computer experience...I'm just saying :)Would have just exchanged it with excellent Amazon customer service, but the combination of poor video quality and that made me just decide to move up a notch.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 ?
Reviews.Author: Wilfredo Berenguer
Reviews.Content: Can't seem to get it to work , followed all instructions , it won't open a page it suppose to my router won't recognize what is a virtual what ever lol. Help anyone

Reviews.Title: Great with a couple caveats
Reviews.Author: bluridium
Reviews.Content: This camera performs excellently for the price although the setup could be difficult for somebody that is not familiar with networking. As mentioned in other reviews, the camera comes with a static IP that can be difficult to find if you do not have a "typical" network. Other quibbles that also have been mentioned before that I can confirm: • You cannot turn off the infrared LEDs that turn on automatically in the dark, and they do emit a red glow that is noticeable. • Mine did not come with a built in speaker as advertised, and the built in microphone is very low quality. • I am unable to program preset positions (using the Android application "IP Camera Viewer"). • The camera does appear to "phone-home" to an IP in China, which the manufacturer claims is used for the built in dynamic DNS feature. I had to block this traffic manually in my router.I am still using the camera despite the issues I mentioned, and would likely buy another one. The features and price more than make up for the negatives.

Reviews.Title: Wow! It's Cool
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I love how you can pan the thing around with the browser-interface.Works good, even in very low light or darkness, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: does what I want
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M Musser
Reviews.Content: except for broken-english instructions, works fine.  to set up, you may need some networking experience to set up..  you have to access your router.  fortunately I used to do that for a living.  display interface program works well.

Reviews.Title: Good product!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: Great for a small bussiness use. My boss got 3 of them and they keep up pretty well. He likes them!

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: Jim Rogers
Reviews.Content: The  English  translation is terrible. That being said if you have a basic computer and router back ground you can get this camera installed. The key is to get the LAN set-up done and then the port forwarding. Then you use the address on the bottom of the camera it will lead you to the address to access this camera on the web. It will detect your router and the correct port. Took me about 4 hours to get this done. This was my first camera install and I had to print the long instructions from the disk to get it done. It could have saved me about 3 hours if I didn't use the quick install.

Reviews.Title: Just like Foscam
Reviews.Author: MrMIke
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the product being inferior, given the lower cost.  So far, NO PROBLEMS.Installed easily, works the same ... I can't be happier.  I know the NEW Foscams have better outdoor color,but that's not what I bought this cam for. Coor is not of importance in all cases!I'm Happy and will probably buy a couple more.

Reviews.Title: Decent value, hard to upgrade
Reviews.Author: M. Veloso
Reviews.Content: I got a white box device with no branding. From various web searches, I discovered I had a MayGion version of the IP camera. The chip inside is a Ralink RT5350f, so it's the mips-based version...which is good, because that one is the one that's being worked on.The upgrade process looks to be a bear, but the files are out there on maygion dot com. I'll be updating to the latest 3.1 firmware sometime this weekend, and I'll edit this as things progress.Update 29-Dec-2012So, this device actually used the ARM chipset. Upgrade information for it is at [...]. Instructions there are kind of scattered, so here's a quick how-to:1. Download and extract firmware3.1_full.rar2. extract [...] into an www folder3. extract app.rar into an app folder4. connect to your IP camera using an FTP client. Username/pw is MayGion/maygion.com5. download the /tmp/eye/app directory to a folder somewhere. This backs up the on-device directory.6. download the /tmp/eye/www directory to a folder somewhere. This backs up the on-device directory.7. Delete the contents of /tmp/eye/www and upload the contents of the extracted [...] file to /tmp/eye/www8. Delete the contents of /tmp/eye/app and upload the contents of the extracted app.rar file to /tmp/eye/app9. Pull the camera's power cord and plug it back in.If everything works, you'll have a brand new UI with a blue border. If it doesn't, the camera will hang out at 192.168.1.111. You can ftp back in and restore the files you downloaded previously.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but came with a cracked cd
Reviews.Author: edrich
Reviews.Content: Great camera but came with a cracked cd. The people in china were helpful. Kind of tricky to setup. But camera is great

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Uday J Dixit
Reviews.Content: Great basic IP camera for the price. Big THANKS to all the people who wrote detailed instructions on how to get this camera setup. I would have had major struggles if it wasn't for their help!Pros:Pricegood night vision resolutionConscolor is way offmotion alert seems to be sensitive

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: HWNHVYHTA
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 3 mos and it works great! It took about an hour to setup. This is supposed to be an indoor camera but I put outdoors under my roof and it does just fine. I can see some water spots on it from rain but it still performs perfect. Good buy! I would recommend this to anyone especially for a baby monitor type camera!

Reviews.Title: Get ready for a heap of frustration!
Reviews.Author: PsiChi2025
Reviews.Content: The camera works properly but the software CD is defective. I ordered 4 cameras and the cd was defective for all of them.  It does not download correctly which  does not allow the camera to use all the features it  supposedly has.  The camera website does not have a download that corrects this problem. Also, what downloads  available on the site are in Chinese and are not functional.  The installation instructions are useless because they are not complete enough for different problems one might experience during installation.  It took me many hours of frustration to get the cameras to work.  There is NO customer service! You just leave a phone message and no one will get back to you.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: overall
Reviews.Author: userX
Reviews.Content: -microphone,speaker sucks, dont expect it to work-camera ok quality-software okbuy a $65 foscam when they are on sale is much more worth than this...

Reviews.Title: These are not FOSCAMS but work just as good
Reviews.Author: Billie
Reviews.Content: So far these cameras work just as well as the FOSCAMS I have.Cannot beat them for the price.Setup was rather easy, I have them wirelessly routed through my routerI plan on buying more in the future

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: H. Clay "CC"
Reviews.Content: I got this a couple of months ago. It has been working great. I have it mounted above my front entrance door. I have a spare computer that I am running iSpy (which works great) software on. The motion detection and PTZ all work great. It is not a 300.00 camera, but it does the trick. I will purchase the same product again.

Reviews.Title: Worst ever!
Reviews.Author: applecider
Reviews.Content: This is the worst ever camera.  It has a very little view, and I could not make it work.  I purchased through ebay their dealer for $54, and supposedly with 3 year warranty. In just a few month, the CD comes with it dead.  I could not download the software from their website.  I contact them and the ebay dealer mutiple times without any kind of answer.  This kind of service would not go far in USA.  As a chinese, I am ashamed by this kind of product and service unfortuntely made in China.

Reviews.Title: No instructions and unusable diskette
Reviews.Author: Ken Trammell
Reviews.Content: There were no instructions included and the diskette provided (3") would not work in my laptop. So, I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Instructions and support are very very inadequate
Reviews.Author: B. Barrett
Reviews.Content: I am using the camera as a deterrent to home burglary and the presence of the camera is a plus. I like the red led lights that come on at night if there is motion in the driveway.However, I am not that great at figuring out the technical issues. Once I removed the camera from direct connect to the computer, I can no longer find the IP address of the transmission. I assume that i am missing a step with the router.Otherwise, the camera appears to be working as it should and if I could actually monitor it, it would be great.The Wansview support site specifically declines to support this camera if it is bought from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision Internet Surveillance Camera
Reviews.Author: Ray "jb92563"
Reviews.Content: Very cool and configuration instructions are moderately clear with a bit more elaboration required for the more advanced features.It has a manual focus ring that you set once, but it feels like its attached to a geared motor internally so perhaps there might be an auto  focus of some sort.Works well, great price

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: EarlB252
Reviews.Content: Works great. Had a little trouble getting it to work, but looked at it as a learning experience. Great info in reviews on setting it up. Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Cartelli
Reviews.Content: Very cool what it does for the price. The video quality is so so. Set up isn't bad if you have some basic network knowledge, otherwise you will need setup help.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: bugsy 77
Reviews.Content: This works great and perfectly quite, But used the set up directions on You Tube, they are so much easier to fallow.

Reviews.Title: cant get it to work wirelessly
Reviews.Author: t
Reviews.Content: everytime i unplug the internet cable. it shuts off and it will not come back on. i am not able to access the camera remotely. that makes it very difficult to place it where i want.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Andres Loyola
Reviews.Content: I have three comments about this camera: it works as expected, however colors might be different from the real ones due to the night vision feature (under sunlight, green appears gray); the second thing is that it doesn't support HTTPS conections for remote access, so all the information (password and images) travels unencrypted. Finally, it support uploading images to FTP sites (also unsecure) but not to cloud storage services like Dropbox.

Reviews.Title: Not right for me
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Not enough info on how to use an What need to use with it got two in the closet poor directions an need to use company to help u with it

Reviews.Title: Decent IP camera for the price
Reviews.Author: IT Guy
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and set up. It's a pretty good unit camera for the price. The instructions are typical for a translation from Chinese to English so it takes some a little thinking but for the most part, if you have some IT experience, it's intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation. Work well so far
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Received item in brand new condition. Installed very easy following instruction in included CD. Running wireless with router using MFG DDNS for one week smoothly. I was able to log into the camera and rotate it from Iphone which show image very clear. Could hear both side talking. Could not figure out how to work with email and FTP yet due to instruction limiting on this subject. I got it for only 47 dollars. Compare to other brand this IPC has good value and less complicate installation. I won't underestimate Chinese engineer anymore after trying this product.  I rate one of good buy for this year.

Reviews.Title: almost 5 but..
Reviews.Author: alexaandria andrews
Reviews.Content: Initially daunting to install but everyone should know YOU CAN JUST GOOGLE ALL THE INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS YOU NEED!!!!The sole complaint I have is that the particular camera I received will not move downward. When you hit the down button from the view site you can hear the motor in the camera whirl but it simply won't do it. All the other movements work quit smoothly but something internal just seems to have been stuck.We ordered this camera for and immediate issue with some neighborhood vandals however and so we chose to go ahead and set it up any way; as a possible deterrent.  Truth is it is still quit useful with just the side to side panning if set up high enough. It is quit a hassle when someone forgets and we have to manually reset, but all and all for the price and the quick shipping it was a nice gift of security for our house. Maybe in the future we will purchase another more functioning replacement.

Reviews.Title: It was installed Nov 26th , and it still works for us as of today
Reviews.Author: GGFR
Reviews.Content: It was installed by a friend at our rental property. He also has it installed at one of his clients homes to watch over  an elderly 24 /7. He works with security system and he recommended this one.It is installed inside our garage , even when  dark, the led lights help us  see activitity in the garage. I get alerted with an email when there is motion sensored. as well as sound alert if I watch LIVE video  from a remote PC.It does the job.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Saurabh
Reviews.Content: Anyone thinking of purchasing, just be patient with the installation instructions since they are written in poor English.However the product itself seems to be sturdy, catches wi-fi and works well in lightly lit areas.

Reviews.Title: Best value purchase I have ever made
Reviews.Author: Titas Raha
Reviews.Content: It has been now 3 months since I bought this camera.This is probably the best value purchase I have ever made considering the price and features offered. I use it to monitor my 1.5 year old, works great even in complete darkness, never had any problems from day one. Easy to setup, came with not much documentation (in a way that is good) cause whatever documentation it had was to the point.Some technical details as I understand it: The camera has an embedded OS, with DHCP client and built-in web server capable of streaming jpg/mpeg images at a high refresh rate, it has infrared lights to see at complete darkness, capability to rotate the camera left/right or up/down remotely, jpeg streaming is what makes it work in most modern browsers without the need to install Activex/Java, although there is an added Activex version for IE that gives more control to the user, it does all that wirelessly, I don't know about you but I am not aware of any device that can do all that at such a low price.I generally don't write reviews but the product is so good that I had to write one. I can't think of any product that has such a low price to features ratio.

Reviews.Title: dont llok at the picture
Reviews.Author: bogdan kril
Reviews.Content: i bought this item thinking that i was getting WANSNIEW product but got a look alike not was was shown on the picture!!! CD that came with it dose not work with my Mac since it is the mini CD no manual came with it so during set up i just had to wing it. product works fine but not the same as WANSENIEW.  it would be helpful if the picture during the sale did not show fake emblem.

Reviews.Title: It's okay...
Reviews.Author: R. Kilinski
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera expert, just an ordinary consumer in the market for a wireless IP camera to monitor my son in his crib. The fifty dollars spent was worth what I am using it for. My son pulled on the cord of our old wireless IP cam and broke it (Zmodo CM-I11123BK). The old one looked exactly like this one (along with a dozen other cameras I saw on the market). This one was the cheapest I saw and was Amazon Prime eligible (two positives).Image quality is not important to me, and that is a good thing! The color reproduction on this camera is NOT good. Everything seems washed out. It is also difficult to focus properly. The old cam had similar color issues, but was crisp in the focal department.Beyond those gripes, setup on this unit was easier than the Zmodo, however; feature-wise were almost identical (I won't go into the specifics here). We view the camera on out computers and phones without an issue (Android market: Net Eye Cam - free or $4, IOS: IP Cam Viewer (i think) $4). There are other apps that would work with this camera too.Better color reproduction and wireless N at the same price-point would make this camera a 5-star rating in my eyes. I will try to remember to update my post with a still image of the camera once I work out the focus problem.

Reviews.Title: The installed software and firmware look like early beta versions
Reviews.Author: Kira
Reviews.Content: The software interface looks like it is from the 1980's. The version number of the firmware is 0.0.0.2 and the webui version number is 0.0.0.3, which makes me think these cameras were made years ago and have been sitting in a warehouse. The pictures of the web software on the manufacturer's website do not look like what I saw in the browser. The website pictures look like modern software.If you think a simple firmware update will take care of that you are in for a surprise. The firmware is not available for download. They want an email address before they will give you the firmware. And it is not an autoresponder. It appears that the firmware requests are only answered during business hours.Sending out cameras with software that does not look like the software on the manufacturers website, and not having firmware updates available for immediate download to get that control software seen on the manufacturer's site, tells me they don't care about their product, their reputation, or inconveniencing their customers.I missed dinner, TV, and went to bed late because of trying to find out how to update the camera. If I had spent an extra ten or so for a foscam I would be happily looking at the camera and I would not have wasted 6 hours seeking help on the internet.

Reviews.Title: NOT SO GOOD SECURITY CAMERA
Reviews.Author: D'Lena "Ima wonderer"
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about the set up of this camera andknew it was too much for this 'grandma' so I had myson set it up for me and it works great...now I want topurchase more for other areas of the house.Anyone with some computer knowledge can set it up inabout 1/2 an hour.  It provides a decent picture at nightas well as in the day time. That was my first review....NOWthis is an update.  After the camera worked fine for about amonth it stopped working and no matter what we did we couldnot get it to work again.  So my review now is, this camarais a piece of junk...and I am glad I didn't purchase anotherlike I had intended.  I tossed the box and it is past the30 day return policy or it would go right back...my adviceis don't waste your money or TIME on this camera.I am extremely disappointed in this product. Apparently itwas not made to last...the only thing I am happy about is thatit didn't cost a lot of money....but I still didn't get whatI paid for....a security camera that works. (I wasn't expectingmuch, just that it worked consistantly...)

Reviews.Title: Great camera for such a low price!
Reviews.Author: Richard P. Quon "Dyson bargain hunter"
Reviews.Content: For the low price, this camera is pretty awesome.  Was able to get it up and running and using it to watch over my front porch.  Can view it on my computer or iPhone.  Can even control it when away from home on iPhone.  Also it sends me emails with pics anytime motion is detected!  Only drawback is that the IR lights (which work great to see in the dark) aren't able to be turned off.  This occasionally causes glare and a reflection off the window when looking outside at night.  I think newer models are able to have the IR lights turned on or off, so I would recommend that if using to look outside at night.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Seconya
Reviews.Content: This brand product is very difficult to set up and support from the company, WANVIEW, is received only if you purchase from them. With that said, I had to go searching on the internet as the pamplet received with this product did not provide sufficient guidance. THANK GOD for YOUTUBE. After two (2) days I was able to get wireless connection working. However, a day after the motion sensor went and now the wireless stop working.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera in the Making
Reviews.Author: Etzio
Reviews.Content: Picture Quality:Good - Supports up to 640x480. Probably can not make out a license plate number or get a great shot of someones face, but it will do okay for general surveillance.Sharpness is OK and can be fine tuned on the lens.Product Features:I must say, these guys did a really good job with the functionality of this camera. The manual included on the disk is pretty clear and easy to understand. The software seems to work pretty well. The iphone app also works well, although it really depends on your internet connection.I did not try the built in DDNS service but I had zero problems setting up the camera on a third party dynamic dns service.Problems:The vertical panning function has broken after 2 days. The motor can be heard just spinning but not moving the camera. The horizontal panning still works well. I am not super concerned about the vertical pan so I do not plan on having it replaced just yet.Additional Information:Since this is going to be used for surveillance, I needed a much longer power cable. The barrel connector is "Type H" and can be found at radioshack. The power source required to the camera is 1.5 amps @ 5v. I ended up making a new power cable which I can run out to my porch. Camera is not advertised for outdoor use, so even though it is protected from the elements, I am not sure how it will hold up.

Reviews.Title: video quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've got this product to work, however, the quality of the video is blurry. I've played around changing resolutions and adjusted video settings to no avail. I've asked for a replacement but Amazon will only issue a refund. I still would like to make this work. I searched the wansview website to see if there are any new firmware or anything that addresses video quality but none that I can find. Can someone offer some help before I send this product back. I like the features and for the price, it's worth giving it a shot to try and fix. You think I simply received a dud? Thanks for anyone who can provide assistance.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: KV
Reviews.Content: Very good deal!  I recommend this camera.  If you are unfamiliar with computers in general, take your time and maybe even get help setting it up.  The end result will be worth it

Reviews.Title: Did not work properly
Reviews.Author: JustAGeek
Reviews.Content: I ordered this in hopes of using it remotely in a dark room to keep an eye on a large format plotter.  I was disappointed when the panning did not work at all.  I think I might have received a lemon.  The software was not bad.  It might be a little overwhelming for a non-technical person.  The network setup is more on the advanced side of things as well.  I will keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Basic camera, somewhat inconsistent
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: For its price this is a reasonably good option.  However, it is somewhat inconsistent and periodically will get into a state where it stops working for periods of time that can extend to more than a day.  I have this camera up at my vacation cabin and it is a little bit frustrating when it inexplicably goes offline.I, clumsy person that I am, dropped this and broke the antenna.  It was then that I learned from Sabrina at customer service that the cost of a replacement antenna was very reasonable--$0.50.  However, I found the shipping charge of $25 to be a bit exhorbitant.  Thier customer service ships via DHL who they say charges this much.  Yes, they are shipping from China, but I frequently order things that are shipped directly from China and generally pay just a couple of dollars.  Sabrina was not able to identify any store in the United States where replacement parts for these cameras could be purchased.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but look at your price point..
Reviews.Author: John (HCPD)
Reviews.Content: I have several Foscam (this is Foscams generic brand) wireless IP cameras and their resolution does outperform this one. I might even box this puppy back up for return come to think about it. I don't like that you can't change the Alias name, example: I have multiple outdoor cameras, I want to call one External Porch, External Rear,etc..My Foscams you can set alias name, not this one. Also have a issue assigning the Dyndns alias name for DNS resolution on the web (so I can access it anywhere in the world), its not a fault on my side as all my other cameras resolve and ore seamlessly with the name and port forwarding. I would say if your gunning for a cheap inexpensive way to throw very basic monitoring at a given area, this would be sufficient. If you investing in sound video, and features for global access, save your pennies and spend $30~ ish more for the Foscam tilt/pan

Reviews.Title: Could hope for more.
Reviews.Author: elyod_72
Reviews.Content: The camera works ok. The full functionality only occurs on Windows running IE. if you use Chrome or Firefox you will get a limited version.

Reviews.Title: A little tricky to setup but worth the savings
Reviews.Author: JFinn10
Reviews.Content: I must first say that I use this camera with Blu Iris software in conjunction with all of my other cameras.  I plugged it in and followed the instructions and couldn't find the thing at all on the network.  I downloaded "Advanced IP Scanner" for free and it found the IP address on the network instantly.  I Plugged that into the browser, entered the user and password provided in the instructions and presto! It worked like a charm.  Blue Iris picks it up really fast as if it were made for it.  I cannot comment on the software provided with the camera as I never used it but even if you pay for Blue Iris, you are still saving a TON of money with this camera.The video quality is far superior to my other $150 cams and the night vision also puts them to shame.  Even after the 1 hour of head scratching, I am still considering buying another one.The pan/tilt functions work surprisingly well too.  The response is very fast regardless of if I am controlling remotely or in the network.  The big surprise is how quiet it is.  Literally no audible sounds are made as it moves.I would only ask for better setup instructions and software.  I am sure the software can be usable but in this case I feel you are only paying for the hardware itself.I recommend this camera for anyone looking for an add-on camera or something simple to keep an eye on the house/dogs/kids or what have you but don't want to invest hundreds of dollars in a DVR system.

Reviews.Title: It is an excellent IP cams!
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: I rarely give the review, but this time I must.I have been looking at this IP cam for about 1/2 years and decided to purchase a few to try out due to the cost - less money as comparing to Foscam, achieving the same results.
