I have no complains whatsoever on the IP camera performance. I must say that it is an excellent IP camera for a first time user. The setup it so easy (I know the network setup). Below are my observation:1) When the cam facing the window, pointing it toward the street at night, the IR causes the mirror window to reflect the IR LED back to the len, making it not very useful for seeing in the dark. Another word is, only seeing itself and nothing else. Otherwise, it is fantastic for seeing stuff in the dark.2) The speaker makes so much noise when turns on, but when turning the microphone on, it balances itself and reduce the noise down to the acceptable level. I think they should have filtered this out for adding a few components.Thing you need to know for sure, how to set it in the Router.I gave it a 5 stars although it still needs improvement. I will upload picture for examples.

Reviews.Title: This one works great!
Reviews.Author: J. Mills
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the feature set for the price point. But I had serious issues with the second and third ones I bought. As long as they are purchased DIRECTLY from Amazon and not a third party thru Amazon returns are a breeze and worth taking a chance on. I'll probably buy a couple more. Also, these are indoor rated and I have them mounted outside up under the eaves of my house out of the weather and they seem to be ok with that.Set up might be a bit complex for the average joe. Especially getting it out to the internet where you can view the cameras with your tablet, phone etc. I'm a network admin and some of it had me scratching my head. Also setting up the motion detect alarms requires access to an SMTP server. You might be able to use a Gmail account, maybe. Ours works intermittently with Gmail as it sometimes sees it as spam.UPDATE: It's been over a year with them outside, and they all still work flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: This is a piece of ....
Reviews.Author: Saber
Reviews.Content: I am really good with electronics.... can't get this to work at all. Really sucks. Will NOT work wireless. Have to keep it wired. Many problems with this.... should have sent it back - now sending it to the trash!

Reviews.Title: Tech Savy? No Problem!
Reviews.Author: Jason "Jason E"
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the large amount of negative reviews on the product and almost opted for a more expensive model. After actually reading a lot of the bad reviews I realized that a majority of them were people upset with the set up process, support received from the company and the instructions but very few with the product itself. I took a gamble and bought one figuring for the price, I can't go wrong. I was right! The product itself is awesome. The price I paid is well below the value I am getting out of this product. I got one just to play around with and will now likely get some more and add them around the house and garage. Set up was pretty easy when it comes to assigning a host and getting wifi set up on the device. The trouble I had actually had nothing to do with the devices and more to do with port forwarding and my router but after a google search or two I was up and running. Be aware that when you use the smartphone app at home on the same wifi as your device you will need to configure your host separate than what it would be when you are not on the same network. The IP address is different. Many people might not care about using the camera when home but I did and it was easy to correct this issue by creating two separate devices in the app. One with the home wifi IP of the device and one when accessing from outside the home network. Overall the devices works great, is good quality and just a fun inexpensive tech gadget to have.

Reviews.Title: Great item for the price !!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Ackermann "Jimmyjohn"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased two of a similar camera with the Swann brand name, for $150. + tax at Fry's Electronics.  It had nicer mounting hardware, and most likely a better lens, because the color and clarity is a little better.  But for the price, this is a GREAT camera and a great value!  Also, this camera was a lot easier for me to configure (on a Mac), because when I called Swann for the other cameras, I watched them configure my other two cameras, by allowing the technician to have control of my computer.  So between that and trying to read Swann's manual (much better than the Wansview manual), I became familiar with "port forwarding," which is the most complicated part.Following the instructions that are included in these reviews, you should be able to configure this camera to meet your needs.  I did not need to try to use Wansview support, but their support web pages helped me to learn that this camera has FOCUS.All in all, taking my sweet time, I had it configured in less than 24 hours, including the iPhone app called "wanscam".

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Matthew Nichols
Reviews.Content: received this item back in September. I was unable to open the box and try it out due to being away from home. So how much does it suck to finally get to try it out and nothing...It is DOA and can't return it because of time...I followed the instructions plugged into router...plugged in power...and waited....and waited...no flashing green light!!!!.....Oh well... If you buy make sure you try ASAP just in-case..

Reviews.Title: Best deal out there for $50
Reviews.Author: iEspresso
Reviews.Content: After setting up this little camera, I kept kicking myself for buying two of the $100 FOSCAM IP cameras first. Sure, the FOSCAM units work perfectly as well, and they have slightly better audio capability, but they are twice the price. This one works just as well with both the web browser interface and my iPad & iPhone apps. From now on, if I need any more IP cameras, I'm buying this one.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Z. M.
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, I read some of the reviews here before I purchased and followed some of their advice. Plug it in directly to the router with ethernet cable and run find device program on the cd.. (I can't remember the name of the file).  Then configure its ip address from there to match your network settings. From there you can then use that IP to login to the camera and configure the wireless settings. The wireless didn't find anything on the first take but I selected "use LAN" and I think that is when it found the list of available networks, either that it just took 2 takes at finding the networks. After that I was all set up and was able to use them as wireless devices.Pros:- Easy to set up- Good night vision (indoors)- CheapCons:- Cannot shut off IR lights so night shots through a window will not work unless you block the LEDs- They need to be focused for best image, not a problem but should be noted. (You spin the lens to focus)Overall I am pretty happy, only had them 3-4 days so I will update if things go wrong. I bought two and both are working fine.

Reviews.Title: Wansview Outdoor Waterproof Wifi Wireless/wired Ip Camera with Night Vision, Motion Detection Alarm, FTP and E-mail alarm,with b
Reviews.Author: Kerry Holmes
Reviews.Content: Wireless part would not work, had to send it back. Lucky for me I am a techie because the instructions were lacking. Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Audio does not work
Reviews.Author: Jason Gauci
Reviews.Content: The camera comes with an internal microphone and an audio-out jack.  The internal mic does not pick up any audio and I can't hear anything from the audio jack or from the web frontend to the camera.  DO NOT BUY IF YOU WANT AUDIO.

Reviews.Title: Nice little cam
Reviews.Author: Max G
Reviews.Content: Good lens compare to my other cam EasyN , gives much better picture.Cons: 1. Does not have preset positions like in EasyN. 2. Does not have internal speaker like EasyN has - you need to hook up computer speakers if you need  talkig to camera.Other than that - good cam for te money.

Reviews.Title: Rating Customer Service
Reviews.Author: JimBob
Reviews.Content: Michael from support was great.  There is no way I could had set up my camera w/o his help.  He was very patient w/ me. I have an hearing disorder.JimBob

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price!
Reviews.Author: Michael Adinolfi
Reviews.Content: This was my first venture into wireless IP security cameras.  Once I played around with the setup it worked well.  The picture is clear (not the best color) even in the IR mode.  I have since purchased two outdoor cameras and my experience with the indoor camera helped me with setup.  The IP find software works well but the install instructions are terrible.  Overall I am pleased with the performance of the camera and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Wansview NCB541W  Great Value
Reviews.Author: Al Thompson
Reviews.Content: It took me 5 mintues to get this up and running.  Plugged camera into network with hard wire.  Ran the included BSearch_en.exe utility off the CD to find the camera on the newtork.  Assigned an IP that would work on my network.  Went to wireless section and added the SSID of my wireless router. Then rebooted.  IP is the same on the wired and wireless network.  If the wire is attached it uses that interface, if not it uses the wireless.  Pretty straight forward.  $46 bucks that a steal!

Reviews.Title: Some questions
Reviews.Author: elibohnert
Reviews.Content: With this camera is there a option to record everything on to a SD card or USB drive or is live viewing the only way?

Reviews.Title: Wireless IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Szimco
Reviews.Content: Difficult to set up but definitely worth the price.  Good quality picture and management once you have it set up.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for this budget
Reviews.Author: Kiseki Necro
Reviews.Content: I have been having issue with lost package from UPS, so I decided to find a cheap security camera that may give me a hint on what exactly is going on. for 50 bucks, this camera actually do way more then I expected. First it is pretty nice little camera, which come along with the mount and screws if you needs to do that. set up is a bit confusing if you look at the guide provided, you need to some imagination and mix and match, which is very common for most chinese ---> english translated manual. I would strongly recommend the guide provided by justChill as it will be your life saver. took me roughly 30 mins to get it setup. angle seems quite wide, at least it cover my whole front yard. and one thing I like the most is the internet monitoring feature, that means you can look thu the cam when you are outside. This unit also have the snapshot and recording feature, by far the longest I can recorded is 1 hr, and I will see if it is poossible to have it recorded to 8 hrs, so it will fully cover the UPS delivery time -frame when I am away.I havn't try the wireless part as I have a internet switch in my room so I can just use wire it for connection. If I am going to get a few more cam for other locations, I may give the wireless one a shot.

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised!
Reviews.Author: I <3 Massage Therapy
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the money! If you are savvy with electronics then you will have it set up in a little less than an hour but won't stop playing with it for about two hours. Anybody leaving a bad review probably doesn't know anything about networking. If you get this product have someone who knows what they're doing set it up!

Reviews.Title: overall great buy
Reviews.Author: rccjr
Reviews.Content: The night vision is impressive. I can login from anywhere to check house. But power cord is too short and no battery backup option was slight let down, but stil a great camera...I bought 2 of them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: Connor
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and a great buy.  I think the company improved the instructions and you do not need any lengthy reviews.  First I didn't even look at the instructions and went off long writeups based on reviews.  Got the LAN and WiFi setup very quickly but had problems accessing remotely from another computer not connected to my network.  Basically follow the instructions and they provide you with a free dns so you don't need to register an account and pay for one.It took me about 2 hours to setup and about 1.5 was trying to get the remote access but you could just read through the instructions provided and have it all up and running within 30 minutes.  The alarm mode is nice that detects motion and sends it to your email as well as viewing it on your mobile device such as an iphone.

Reviews.Title: No better bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: M. Leick "U of Iowa Girl"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this unit. After battling with some older IP cameras that were frequently dropping wireless connection, I decided to pick this one up. The Pan/Tilt function are phenomenal, setup was pretty straight forward and very similar to my other IP Cams. I didn't use the instructions since I'm familiar with these kind of devices. Configuration was pretty straight forward and had more options than one could really hope for especially at this price point. Similar products by Panasonic run about $300 and are from what I can tell of similar quality. Great bang for your buck you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend this to anyone looking for IP camera
Reviews.Author: GSH
Reviews.Content: Great product works fine both day and night. Good range for wireless IP camera.Wish it had software to auto record when motion is sensed only does that if the alarm is attached else can only record based on scheduled recording.However recommend this product would buy another one. Its been working fine for last 4 days.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars for as-expected, 3 stars for as-is
Reviews.Author: D. Darby
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews and acknowledging its the cheapest on the market the product met expectations, hence 5 stars.  And 3 stars for seeing the washed out colors and having it lock up occasionally (when it switches to IR and the motors are called upon to pan/tilt), so an average of 4.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Latha Nair
Reviews.Content: Took me about an hour to set this up with my AT&T; U Verse router. The initial delay was due to the fact that I was using my work computer to set this up and there was some security setup in there blocking the search feature. Once I got that working on a different pc, it was painless. The instructions can definitely be better but given the price, the quality and the functionality offered is very good.

Reviews.Title: IP Camera
Reviews.Author: beachaholic
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty amazing.  It works perfectly or just as described.  Pan, tilt, night vision all viewable fom my smartphone, awesome.  I have is set to send emails, based on motion alarm and it sends groups of 6 jpgs to my phone!  The instructions absolutely suck, but solid advice found right here on the Amazon reviews got me working after a few tries.  Great camera, lousy manual!

Reviews.Title: not easy to install
Reviews.Author: willard lyall
Reviews.Content: have to hard wire it to my router not my pc didnt know that, and lost the installation cd and cant find a way to download one from mfg.

Reviews.Title: Great unit, but know its capabilities.
Reviews.Author: Chito Pono "Stay CazuaL"
Reviews.Content: Sept 16, 2012I got the unit, set up is pretty straight forward. I don't know what others are talking about the setup being difficult. I got it up and running in less than five minutes. I used a wired Network first to locate it using their software to locate the device. I entered a static IP and that was pretty much it. Read the quick set up guide.The Pro's:Relatively inexpensive. Microphone is a plus. PTZ (Pan/Tilt only) is relatively smooth. Quality is 7 out of 10 during the day and 8 out of 10 during the night. My coverage area is eight feet by three feet, by six feet it is located in a 16 ft by six ft wide by six ft high rectangular structure in the ceiling. I have an Android phone and using the program called "IP Cam Viewer", the free version works, but I bought the Pro for $3.99 because that is how I roll. Setup on that program was easy too.The Con's:No Location preset set. Available on in the H series (according to the manual). Email setup is proving to be difficult, as of today, I still can not get it to work. After pressing test, it gets stuck. I have read several sites on how to do it, whether I am using GMail's SMTP or GMX, still no joy. The scheduler is a pain, the hour block are broken into four 15 minute segments. Here is a hint, double click on the hour and all four sections will be enabled.The Bottom Line:For the price, you can not complain. I will be happy if it last for a year. I have it outside in my Chicken Coop to keep an eye out for my chickens. It is under a roof, so it shouldn't get wet. However, it will be exposed to the elements including plenty of dust.I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Item
Reviews.Author: StarGate
Reviews.Content: Item received in a very good condition and exactly as described. Very simple to use if you know a little about networking. functions are as described and amazing features for a tiny low price camera. very nice user friendly software. will certainly buy more soon. I recommend it for every person who likes electronics.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful unit!
Reviews.Author: Kls
Reviews.Content: For the price paid, I would give it six stars if there was an option. I would recommend this piece to others. The other reviews helped set up.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the Price
Reviews.Author: Zoravar
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product for basic security.  It has a lot of great features for the price such as the ability to record to an ftp server, remote controlled pan and tilt, the ability to use either a wired or wireless network connection (I'm currently using a wired connection), as well as infrared night vision.The only problem I had was getting it set up for the first time.  The program they included to find your camera on the network was not working on my main computer.  I had to go to another computer on my network to get it to work. (This was the reason for the 4/5 stars). However, once I found the default IP address I was able to change it to something that worked for me.The internet browser interface is easy to use and offers access to all the settings (assuming you have admin privileges on the camera, this camera supports up to eight unique user accounts with three different levels of control over the camera).  I currently have the camera sitting on a table in the corner, but it does come with a mounting bracket so that you can mount it on a wall or ceiling.  It's currently set to record to my ftp server whenever it detects motion.Like I said before this is a great camera for the price and I would recommend it with one warning: make sure you're good with computer networking or know someone who is.  However, once you get it set up, anyone who can use an internet browser will be able to use it's basic functions.

Reviews.Title: This is a better buy than other compatible brand
Reviews.Author: Double T
Reviews.Content: I bought a different brand which looks exactly the same as this one but costs $80 instead of $50.  The two work the same and they even can be put together in the multi-device view.  The firmwares for the two are somewhat different but all the parameters and options are almost the same between the two.  You can save some money by buying Wansview.Setting up these IP cams are not that straight-forward, but it could be my home network setup.  I have about thirty devices including tv tuners, printers, wii, ip phone, ip and non-ip surveillance cameras and network drives etc in two different sets of network.  The software that came with it could not locate it.  I had the same problem with the first one of different brand.  I have to use a separate router and a separate laptop separate from my home networks to find it and set it up for wireless operation in the home networks.  Once it is setup, this wireless device works flawlessly.I have to agree with others that you need to know ip, port forwarding, gateway, activex, and ftp etc to make it work the way it is supposed to.  The four page manuals are not comprehensive to help you much.There is one more thing that worths mentioning.  If you have problem installing activex module in internet explorer, you may want to go to foscam or wansview faq to find the solution.  For IE9, you need to to to  Tools-Internet Options-Advanced-Security and click on "Allow Software to run or install even if signature is invalid."  Of course, you can always use Firefox or others which will not require Activex installation but it will not have multi-device view and maybe a few minor functionalities.

Reviews.Title: Wansview and D-Link router
Reviews.Author: TerryG
Reviews.Content: Received a Wansview NCB-541W in a small box with no packing.  The enclosed CD had a V4.0 of the user's manual.  I had the camera up and running on Wi-Fi within a few minutes.  I had returned a Foscam F18918W which died after 1 hour.  Although they look similar, they are different, but produce the same result.The only problem I had was with my router.  The D-Link DIR-601 does not use 'Port forwarding' for web viewing with this Wansview camera.  The D-Link uses a 'Virtual Server.' I tried 'Port forwarding' and DMZ for hours before my programmer son saw the tiny print on a small enclosed printed 'Quick Start' guide that showed using a 'Virtual Server' on a D-Link router.Follow these steps for a D-Link DIR-601 router.Set the wi-fi on the camera for 'Set IP automatically' and restart camera.Use the program on the CD 'BSeries Intranet Search' to find the camera and it's new IP address.Type the IP address into the address bar on your web browser, Firefox, IE, Chrome etc. and see if the camera is working.  Go to 'Maintain' in the camera menu and under 'Device Info' you will see 'MAC' you will need this set of letters and number in the next step.Open the D-Link router configure page in your web browser Firefox, IE, Chrome etc. 192.168.0.1, the default is 'admin' with a blank password and go to Setup > Network Settings > Add/Edit DHCP Reservation.  Click enable, make up a name for your camera then in the drop down tab select "ipcam_****'. Type in the IP address given to your camera and the MAC address from the above step.  Click save and go to the top of the page and hit 'Save Settings.'  After the router reboots check the same page and see if you camera is on the 'DHCP Reservations List.'  This step will ensure that this IP address is not give to another computer.Go back to your camera page and select 'Network' and uncheck 'Obtain IP automatically.'  Make sure your IP address is listed in 'IP Addr' along with all the other IP numbers.  Change the 'Http Port' number from 80 to another number of your choosing from say from 1030 to 1050 or just about any number will work.  Now hit 'Submit.'  When the camera reboots, type in your camera IP address in your web browser and add your port number after a colon  :1030 (sample 192.168.0.107:1030) to see if the camera is still working.Next go back to your D-Link router page, then ADVANCED > VIRTUAL SERVER.  Check the box, name your camera, then in the drop down tab select "ipcam_****'. add your IP Address add your port number from the above step in both 'Public Port' and 'Private Port' and 'Save Settings' at the top of the page.On your D-Link router page go to 'Status' and under WAN towards the top of the page find your routers 'IP Address' this number will not start with 192.168.x.x.  I have Cox internet and mine is 68.x.xxx.xxx.  If you can find your address use findmyipaddress . com.  Type this into the address bar of Firefox, IE, Chrome etc. and add your port number to the end (sample 68.x.xxx.xxx:1030) this will show you if you can now see your camera outside your home Wi-Fi on the internet.  If this worked you can see your camera anywhere in the world.Some internet providers change the router IP address often, others like Cox, not so much.  Wansview provides a great built-in service that will always point to your camera even if your router IP address changes, this is the xxxxxx.nwsver . com address.  It took several days for mine to start working.  Find your address on your camera page under Network > DDNS Settings.  D-Link also provides a free service to do this called Dynamic DNS.  On the D-Link router go to TOOLS > DYNAMIC DNS to set it up, if you want to use it.There is a Wansview forum at Wansview . net, that may give you some more help.All of these cameras use a standard 1/4" camera mount on the bottom, so you can get a standard 1/4" bolt and mount it to a spring clamp and then mount these cameras just about anywhere.So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: The camera has good resolution and once it's set up it's easy to use especially from the iPhone. I called the customer service number for technical support & the representative Calvin Harris helped me set up the camera on my computer as well as my iPhone and was very helpful. Once I did this it was really easy to use. I recommend this product for others to use.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Dominic L. Knepper
Reviews.Content: The camera works great once you get it set up. See the set up instructions from the other user and follow them exactly.One problem, the night vision was working, not it isn't. Not sure how to re-enable it. Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Difficult to place on line, easy to place though WIFI.
Reviews.Author: Byron-57
Reviews.Content: It has been already about four days that I have been trying, from time to time, to place this camera, so that I can watch the feed through the Internet away from home. If you do not know much about dynamic ip and such, you will be going to school for a while if you try to do it your self. I have given up because I have a NetGear router model # DNG2200, and the menu to set the camera is not like in the instructions that I have read here, and I hate to call technical support, since the technical support for the NetGear is really poor and frustrating. I will have to call my ISP and go to the EasyN website for support information. However, if any one reading this can help me, that would be great. I am pretty sure that I am not the only one with this type of router.So the only part I could not pass through, is when it states "before outer access, please refer to your router's user's manual for how to open ports to allow Internet access to the camera." You have to really know what you are doing here.Okay, I finally manage to connect it to the Internet. Once it is connected, it appears to respond pretty good. So, I have no idea what is the difference between this ip cam and others that are more expensive. When it comes to working, so far I would give it five stars, exempt I do know how long these cameras last without any problems. I guess you could know that from other reviews. I really do not care that the colour is not very close to reality. It is an ip cam; no one is going to use it to take family movies, just for secutity and piece of mind.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm, helps if you're tech-savvy
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. Hicks IV
Reviews.Content: We set this camera up today and it's working like a charm. It definitely helps that my wife is "technical" (more than me at any rate) and patient with instructions and tech-noodling, but she got it set up pretty quickly, especially with the help available here from other reviewers.My only real complaint here? The electrical cord is SHORT! I put the camera at maybe a little over 6 feet elevation in my daughter's room (we're using this to replace our previous video monitoring solution) and the cord didn't even manage to reach the floor, hanging straight down. Only way it would've reached the outlet without an extension cord would have been if we positioned it directly above the outlet, which wasn't happening. We'll be looking into getting power supplies with longer cords at some point, I'd bet. Anyone have any suggestions there?

Reviews.Title: Pretty Happy!
Reviews.Author: Shakeudown
Reviews.Content: I had no problems from the time it was shipped, to the time I received it!  The fun part was hooking it up!  I was able to follow the directions, even though they were in broken English.  Hooked directly to modem, as explained with Ethernet cable, put setup disc in drive of computer hooked directly to wireless modem.  I had to open disc to explore options.  Set everything as told, disconnected and set up wireless!  Everything ran smooth until I wanted to view over internet.  After calling my ISP and Cisco, found out my ISP doesn't have a public Ip address.  Also I had to search on my own for an open port to forward.  Luckily with the help of "You Get Signal", I was able to find an open port for my external Ip address.  I then had to invest a little more money to get assistance to find a way around my problem with the non public ISP address.  With the help of Supportrix and the extra money invested, I am a Happy Camper!  I can now check my home from anywhere in the world,"in real time" from my phone or any computer!  Also in my home I go to my network and can view from my wireless laptop,Ipod etc.  If you're a computer geek, you probably won't need the extra help.  I consider myself advanced, but getting around the problem took a little more knowledge.  The only down side is that the color is not perfect, but this product gets the job done if you want to watch your home, property or the kids!  I plan on buying a couple more, so I can see different areas of the house.  I'm 3 weeks in and like I said before, "I'm a Happy Camper"!

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: B. Barker
Reviews.Content: I am sure the more expensive cameras will provide better quality video and easier setup, but this is a great camera for the price. I've only had it for a week, but it is working great so far. I have it set up wirelessly on a network with MAC address filtering and non-broadcasting SSID so that added some twists to the setup, but once I got it configured, no problem.I just wish it had h.264 video support to work better on an iPad or Android phone, but any IP Camera app will read the feed just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great spy camera
Reviews.Author: mom-of-two-girls
Reviews.Content: For the money you pay for this camera it works. Setup is not that hard - just follow the directions that the other users posted below and logon to your router too.A few cons would be it really doesn't show anything in the night, (walk in dark room with no lights - it doesn't detect you). Hard to hide red lights, so people can see it (I wanted to be able to spy on kids late in the night). Otherwise great little camera.  I haven't figured out how to hear anything, but that's not important to me.

Reviews.Title: Surveillance cameras
Reviews.Author: Ricky
Reviews.Content: Extremely satisfied with these cameras.  Took a novice computer person more time to figure it all out but had a little technical support from some experts and then it went like a breeze.  If you are looking to monitor your home, I would recommend them.

Reviews.Title: Its great!
Reviews.Author: T. Dibiasi
Reviews.Content: I must say for the price its a steal. I have set up these cameras before. If its your first time....good luck. I went to you tube and found a great video on set up.Its great!

Reviews.Title: Ip camera
Reviews.Author: P. Neiman
Reviews.Content: Issue: Had trouble changing the password for the camera and it is resolved. ANd have done the port forwarding for the camera and it is working well.LoVE this camera, getting 3 more at least, Sandra you are the world.

Reviews.Title: security risk by using this IP camera
Reviews.Author: William C. Chang "william"
Reviews.Content: Looks like, the device name, Web IP address, and open port number are saved in the their server. That's how your [...] will be translated into your web addressSo, you need to change the default password as quick as you can. Even better, change the username admin to something else. If you don't do this, you might just open your security to any one knows your device name.Not sure if they save your username or password in their severs or not. Hope not.......The price is really good. Just be careful not to let the whole world monitor your home.

Reviews.Title: Hard to Set Up but Worth It
Reviews.Author: willwgp
Reviews.Content: I got this to use in my 2 yr old's room, as he's been sleep walking late at night and we'd like to be alerted when he does so we can quickly get him back to bed and out of trouble. So far it's working well!Many others on here have posted How-To's, and I've read a lot of them to help piece together my journey. I had never set up port forwarding before, but it was pretty easy, and seeing my son's room while at a restaurant, even though he was sitting there at the table with us, was comforting. Just knowing I had gotten it to work was an accomplishment!I set up the Alarm to send me emails whenever it detects movement. In the first day I got over 200 emails, but it was fun to see what my toddler's really doing when I'm not around!In summary:-Get this if you're into technology and want something to get the job done. The objects are for the most part in good focus, and the camera has a lot of features for a low price!-Don't get this if you didn't set up your internet network. It will take you days to set it up. I'm pretty good with tech stuff but it took longer than I think it should have. The instructions were OK, I got the idea of what it was telling me to do, but I updated the camera's settings, it disappeared and I couldn't connect to the address I had just given it, and had to go through the router to find it again. It's just things like this that make you say "Why?!"

Reviews.Title: Ok, Just Ok.
Reviews.Author: A. Coler
Reviews.Content: I give the camera 3 stars but i give the software and web gui 2 stars. I have written my own surveillance cam softawre so I know this area pretty well.The cam is good, clear, and I like the pan tilt. The angle is quite narrow so if you put it on your front porch you can't get a very good wide angle shot. Like in front of your door or them coming up to the door from 20 feet away but not both.The web interaction is good.The software is horrendous.The settings are in about 4 different places and its hard to remember where I saw a particular setting every time i want to change one. Some are different in the web ui wich makes it even harder.One big feature I am missing is some way for it to track movement with the pan/tilt when motion triggers an alarm. It does have programmable "cruise" and it does have a go to a predefined position after an alarm but then it stays there and there is no way to reset it automatically.Likewise with uploading to a web site, you don't have much flexibility with that and the description of the upload settings is very confusing and scattered through out the software.I am still getting pictures with incorrect times and not sure why even though it is supposedly synced to my computer.I like the sound and motion detection capabilities but wish i had more options on what to do during motion detection like how long the video should record, or how many pictures to take, or the interval. There is some of that but very limited.The night vision LED being on all the time makes the colors during the day look washed out. It should turn off in daylight ideally.Every time it starts up it goes to 16 window view and i have to change it to 1 window view.Its ok.

Reviews.Title: Great - especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Canaryunion
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a baby camera on most days and home security when we are away. The instructions provided are a joke; don't use them. Instead use the detailed instructions left by other reviewers since they are a lot more accurate. Works great at night and it's handy being able to see the feed from any of our devices! Glad we went with this over a baby branded camera; it's way more versatile.

Reviews.Title: Major problem
Reviews.Author: RichieO "RichieO"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of model FS-613A-M136.  I had a little trouble setting them up but managed it in the end.  Both cams re-set for no apparent reason, the default re-set position leaves the cam pointing at the ceiling, making it useless.also they keep flicking from a bright image to a dark one, light sensor defective, will not be getting any more of these....

Reviews.Title: IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Dr Bennett Frankel
Reviews.Content: For the price this camera is wonderful. Software included makes it very easy to set up. IR works great. I recommend as A++++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon.Buyer "Never argue with an 1d10t...the...
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my sister because she wanted to be ab le to check in on her puppy when she was at work. Fairly easy to setup and you can login from your laptop and control the camera. Quality is really good too even when there are no lights on. If you want to setup viewing from your mobile phone though, you will need to have some knowledge of port forwarding and setting that up in your router. Definetly reccomended for checking in on your pets.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: The C
Reviews.Content: It's great for the price, packed with features.  I've got it on WiFi so I can log in from my phone or any external computer at work, on the road, etc.Picture quality is good enough for my use (surveillance at my front porch).IR leds are always on (not sure if this is an issue) just saying.Has two way audio that works (can tell the fedex guy to leave his package if I don't want to come to the door LOL).Not much else I could ask for at this price point.  The WiFi option is a big deal, don't have to run AV cables all over the place.The software disc that came with mine didn't read in my ROM drive.  It looks like it was burned and had data on it, but probably not finalized correctly.  So I simply went to the camera's website and found the latest version of the software.Honestly, at the price and feature set... 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Works, if you can install it
Reviews.Author: Douglas B Freeman
Reviews.Content: Camera works great for video, both night and day. We use it as a baby monitor and it is perfect. The audio is crap, all static, so we use a separate baby monitor for audio.Be warned - it came pre-set for a fixed IP so you need to know how to find the IP (using included software or other tool) and then log in and change it on the functional but basic web admin page. Set a password too.Here's a hidden gem, though - it comes with DDNS included! Just use the URL on the bottom label and it automatically finds your camera (as long as you open the appropriate port on your router, again requiring detailed IP networking know-how.)So, it works great, but if you don't know IP networking, get a geeky friend to help!

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: Snowy
Reviews.Content: It takes time to set up wireless! Otherwise fast shipping working well! Pretty good quality! Night vision pretty cool! Want another one!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: Even though this product is not very pricey, it performs the way it is supposed to.  I really enjoyed it and i feel for the price paid, it is a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far well worth the price for what you get....
Reviews.Author: pacaBill
Reviews.Content: Ordered two of these cameras (mine were branded EasyN, but sound like a number of clones exist) with the expectations equal to the price.  Wasn't expecting much in the way of quality and functionality at the $5X price tag, but I've been for the most part pleasantly surprised.Pros - easy setup,even with the poorly translated instructions; the included software does a good job of quick setup - however, you should have some fundamental knowledge of how your home network and router work; all parts are included that you will need for installation; good night time viewing with the IR light, mic and speaker on the camera (although external would be better quality); low cost; seems to be a clone of a number of brandsCons - washed out images outside (no IR-cut filter in the camera makes daytime photos look very washed out, almost black and white; MAJOR issues with getting the cameras to go wireless, 5V power supply wall wart - very small and sounds like they may be prone to failure from other reviews.The washed-out daytime images are not of great consequences, as I am using the cameras to monitor my animals in the pastures.  Looking for a low-cost IR-cutoff filter that may be able to be added and improve the quality. However, the images are clear and cameras were focused as received.  Mounted under the eaves, so we'll see how environmentally durable they are as time goes on.I've tried a number of times to get the cameras to operate on the wireless network, but so far, no luck.  I've found several related posts with ideas, so I'm going to give these a try this weekend.  Right now, I've had to run 100' lengths of CAT5 cable from the router out to the cameras as a temporary fix.  They have a 400 mW wireless output, so if I can get the wireless side going, and they are used with a directional gain antenna, they should do OK well away from the house.Cameras operate very easily from inside the network, and as I've got a static IP address, very easy to hook up to and operate using software available for both Android and iPhone.  Goal is to have these uploading to our alpaca ranch website.  I've not set up any of the alert features, as I didn't intend these as security devices as much as monitoring ones.Overall, so far I'm impressed with these $5X cameras.  If I can work out the wireless network issues, I'll probably be buying more and place them around the ranch.

Reviews.Title: Blank software discs?  IR lights?
Reviews.Author: Dellywhere
Reviews.Content: I just bought two of these cameras, and each arrived with an absolutely blank software disc.  And I was not able to figure out how to download the software from their web site.  But I have software from an earlier Foscam camera, and it seemed to work fine at detecting the new cameras.  All cameras are working fine now, and the lower price of this camera (vs. Foscam) does not seem to reflect lower quality.  I'd give them 5 stars, if it weren't for the blank software discs.OK, a couple days later, I realize that the IR lights cannot be turned off on these cameras.  I hear a click, but the lights still stay on, when it's dark out.  True for both new cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Mark Reynolds
Reviews.Content: After my LinkSys and D-Link wireless cameras my expectations were low for a feature-rich, off-brand model for half the price.  Wow.  Pan, tilt, simple install, crisp image....I can't really ask for more.Oh, and while the install disk is a Windows-only app, you don't need it.  Like most of these devices, there is a web server on it that you can use to configure everything.  The factory IP address is 192.168.0.178.  I connected there and set it up in minutes with my Mac and never used the CD ROM.

Reviews.Title: Camera Resets and Blocks Garage Door Opener
Reviews.Author: HZIT
Reviews.Content: This cam does work fine however I have noticed, on WiFi it resets every now and then.  The capture leaves something to be desired, motion detection is touchy and picture captuer missing detail too long between pics.  An added benny,  I installed the cam in my garage with WIFI access to my access point.  Cam works great, good signal, however now my Garage door won't open.  OOPs will try to reprogram the openers I guess.  All in all this is a good cheep security cam.  It is what it is!  Use it wisely.

Reviews.Title: Great gadget!
Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: i will make this short,purchased and installed the camera, connecting to the router and direction (bit confusing), installation was fast.port forwarding was pretty simple, checked on the internet for port opening and it was a go.all was installed within 20 min., and was able to operate the camera, P&T.;however i still haven't figured out eMail setting.  SMTP setting might be giving me trouble but i will search and resolve it soon..overall, great cheap camera, compare to Foscam and others, and it does the job.i can see what my dog is doing, which is sleeping mostly and barking a little.

Reviews.Title: Works well for the price
Reviews.Author: kpng
Reviews.Content: I use it as a baby and toddler monitor.Unit gets warm when left on, so i unplug it when i dont need it.It has lost connection a couple times while I was viewing the feed over LAN.  I just had to log in again, and it was fine.The pan and tilt were unresponsive once.  i unplugged the camera and then it worked fine again.If you need consistency, I dont recommend this product.  If you want a camera to occasionaly keep an eye on things, and dont mind having to reset it occasionally, this is perfect.Looking at the quality, i dont it expect to last more than 4 years, but more than one.I have logged on with a Nokia Lumia 900, and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Works Great, once you figure out how to use it.
Reviews.Author: Ryan - AZ
Reviews.Content: Product preforms awesome, but you better know what you are doing as far as Networking if you are going to use the wireless feature. It is extremely hard to get the configuration right and the guide will not help you at all. You HAVE to know what you are doing or get someone who does. I have moderate experience in IT and this was a challenge for me, wasn't expecting so much going back to the drawing board to figure out why it wasn't connecting properly. However saying that, I totally love it now.

Reviews.Title: Great features and everything works.
Reviews.Author: Navin Ghisiawan "Navin"
Reviews.Content: The setup can be a bit daunting for those that are not familiar with routers.  Otherwise, I would have given this a 5.Other than that, the product works great the camera comes with its own dynamic dns support, which enables easy viewing outside of your WAN/LAN (*port forwarding needs to setup correctly though)I will likely buy another one after i put this one through its paces.There are many posts on setup of this device.  I recommend folks look at one of those posts if they are having setup issues.I have been able to view the video from all of the different devices that i own (android tablet and phone, webos tablet and phone, PC.There are three viewing modes:1. internet explorer compatible2. firefox compatible3. mobile compatibleYou can choose of the options above after logging into the carmera url as seen below.The key to viewing on a webos device is the format the URL like this:[...]or[...]<static domain name>

Reviews.Title: Wansview 541
Reviews.Author: Paul Narraway
Reviews.Content: The instructions are pretty bad.  Fortunately there was a private party instruction online that was helpful.  I use a third party app, Tiny Cam on my phone.  For $50 bucks the camera is worth the setup aggravation.  I might try a higher end cam when I add another camera.

Reviews.Title: Great !
Reviews.Author: Weldon R. Desouza
Reviews.Content: Good product, does what the item description says - very pleased. use it at home and it works fine. Thinking about getting another one, as a add on unit.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work very well
Reviews.Author: Steve Yates "tncompguy"
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for several weeks now and still don't have it working. As long as it is plugged into a router it is accessible by the network but if you try to use it as a wireless camera and remove it from the router, you can't find it. The original problem was a self created one as it generated a IP address that did not match my wireless addresses. I corrected that problem but it still doesn't work except when hard-wired to the router.Even when connected to the router, the picture isn't very good. It doesn't seem to auto-focus nor can I figure out why I can't focus it myself. When I first "discovered" it on my router, I could move the camera around as well as up and down but even that seems to have stopped working at this point. I'm disappointed in the quality of the material as well, it seems to be made out of cheap plastic but the price was relatively low so I guess I got what I paid for.  I continue to work with it as time permits. I would not recommend this device to anyone. By the way, when this came up, I had an IBM Life camera working on the system as well and it stopped working the first time I tried to use the wireless camera. It will probably turn out to be something that I've done but would not recommend this product to anyone at this time.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: obachan, CA
Reviews.Content: I set this camera up for motion detection and dynamic DNS use. Setting up to work with the wireless network was straight forward with the enclosed manual. The image is very clear. Night vision works very good, too. I am very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: My computer did not recognise this camera
Reviews.Author: Mandurai
Reviews.Content: I followed the badly written instruction manuals religiously. I could not get a step to set the IP address of my home network. I returned this unit :)

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but difficult to set up
Reviews.Author: TheCADman99
Reviews.Content: I consider myself "somewhat" of a techie, so I thought this would be pie to setup- I was wrong.Simply connecting the camera to your computer, finding its ip, logging into the camera, changing settings, and lastly viewing the camera while its connected by lan to your home network, isn't that difficult.But thats not what I bought it for.I want to use it over WI-FI, and access it from anywhere through the net.The  Youtube videos make it look easy but I've spent hours trying to get the wireless to work.  My router shows that its connected but I can't log into the camera.  The address for viewing the camera remotely (printed on the bottom of the cam) doesn't work at all.I'm sure its all in my routers settings (I've played around with about everything I know to try in my DD-WRT enabled router) and I'll keep trying.The android app IPCAM viewer did work with the camera while using it wired, the pan function however did not work inside the app, but will work when choosing "mobile" view if you open a browser on your android device, and log into the camera via IP.Using mobile view is very annoying on a phone however, as you have to tap the pan button repeatedly, and wait for the page to refresh- making panning very slow.For using wired inside your home, its not too tough.  Other than that you'd better be prepared to spend quite a bit of time wading through online posts, videos, and manuals to try to get WI-FI and external access- I've  yet to accomplish it.

Reviews.Title: Complicated setup but works very well
Reviews.Author: S. Schoeb "okcsus"
Reviews.Content: It appears from the reviews of this camera that there is the possibility of receiving a number of differently branded cameras when ordering this product. I'm not certain that the setup is different, but I'm guessing it might be due to the conflicting information I received by reading reviews. My camera is branded EasyN. I'm posting this review to share what I learned in setting it up with a Mac and WiFi. Hopefully it will save you some time if you are doing the same. Some reviews mention being able to install a Mac version of the software. The disc I received did not include Mac software nor did the website, so I used the web interface for my setup. When I began setting up this camera, I connected it to my router with the included ethernet cable and nothing happened. I unplugged the power and then powered it up again. I kept looking for it on the network, but nothing. There was also no blinking at the ethernet connection which led me to believe it wasn't connected to the network. I finally found a mention on the internet of the reset button on the bottom of the camera. Per the instructions, I held the button in for approximate 30 seconds to reboot the camera. At that point, the camera finally showed up on my network. Using my router's configuration interface, I determined the IP address for the camera by looking at the DHCP list. I then entered the IP address in my browser (Chrome) and clicked on the link to sign in to "Server Push Mode". I went to the wireless configuration page, scanned for and found my network, and entered the password. Every time I unplugged the ethernet connection to the router I lost the signal. One review mentioned that the password could not exceed 16 characters. I reluctantly changed my password and it still didn't work. After searching and searching, I finally found a mention that the camera has two MAC addresses, one for the ethernet connection and one for the WiFi. Once I realized that, I did a search of my DHCP list again and found another unknown device. I typed in that IP address, and was finally connected via WiFi (using my much longer than 16 character password).Due to the lack of information and the conflicting information I found in reviews and elseware on the internet, the setup was a bit complicated but once I got it set up on my WiFi network, I was amazed at how well it works. I downloaded the iCam iPhone app and computer software. It was incredibly easy to connect the camera to the iCam app. Now I will be able to monitor my home when I'm away. I will probably buy another one of these to cover other areas of my home. Besides the complicated setup, the only thing I don't like about the camera is the very obvious blinking green light on the front. I would prefer to hide the camera and the light makes that a little hard to do.UPDATE: I figured out how to turn off the flashing light. In the web interface go to PTZ Settings. Then select "Been extinguished" in the "Indicator Display Mode" drop down menu.

Reviews.Title: Neat little camera
Reviews.Author: Tommy J
Reviews.Content: It took a bit of tinkering to get it online. The procedure is pretty much sop for adding wifi objects to your net.1. Configure the cam to work on your net using the RJ45 cable plugged into the router or a switch plugged into your router. Using the enclosed cd load the Bsearch or Hsearch (depends on cam model). Mine was a B. Using the program do a search for the cam. when the cam is found.Click on it. Follow directions on setting the cam net configs. The paper included directions work good (if you can read them). The manual is on the cd (pdf)and much easier to read.2.Using the assigned IP enter that into your web browser (I use Fox)The login should popup. The login stuff is located on the bottom of the cam. If the login doesn't pop up then redo the cam IP config. Its easy to make a typo...3. A visual screen should show the cam pictures. Now to the wifi set up menu. Enter the wifi specs for your net. Make sure you select the proper security encription mode for your net(info is on router). When the cam is searching for net the led blinks slowly. When it connects to net the led blinks rapidly. This is the normal online blink.4. Now disconnect the RJ45 cable and the cam should be working on wifi and show up on your network scan. My Kindle Fire has a neat freebie app net scanner..The infrared works great. Colors are a bit washed but detail is good. Might have to do some adjustment for bright daylight (use online config menu). I used the enclose CD control program for cam and it works fine. Has some nice features... The app will store video snap files. If your disk is tight on space you should check this. The cd manual goes into detail on how it works...Can't find fault with any thing. It is a bit rough here and there (manual cam focus and sound,(I don't use it)). Hey, what do you expect for 50 bucks?update 2013 Apr:I have had the original over the house outside door (sheltered from the rain) about a year or so and it still works great in the summer heat (PHX). The newer cameras come with updated firmware. The programs on the included disk are updated also. The monitor program on the disk is updated and has some nice features.My Kindle fire will display the video (built in camera program) just type in the internet address then the login pops up. The default is admin and 123456. I recommend changing that for the outside cams in case they are stolen. I have four of the cams now and all are working fine.

Reviews.Title: Never Know which Camera you'll get
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Johnson
Reviews.Content: My friend ordered this and received a Wansview Camera. I liked it so I ordered one a month or two ago and got a Hootoo Camera. It worked well so I ordered another one. When it arrived, it was an EASYN Camera. I turned it on and the picture was HORRIBLE. REALLY GRAINY. I'm returning it immediately, and will order a totally different camera where what is displayed is actually what is delivered.

Reviews.Title: Buying 2 more today!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for the price. I saw someone who said something about ftp options well let me tell you that this camera shares the same hardware as the foscam p/t camera there for you can flash it with foscam software with no mods. that will give you all the function you need

Reviews.Title: Great price, and product!
Reviews.Author: C. Fayette
Reviews.Content: This product exceeded my expections.  Works great and the wireless connectivity is very good from outside my home to the inside office, where the router is located.  Personally, when trying to access via offsite, I find it easier to remote to one of my office machines, and then browse to a local IP for the connectivity.  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: A very good product so far
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions that came with this camera,the little booklet not the one on the CD, and I had this thing up and running within a few minutes.The color is very good and the night vision works very, very well, much better than I had thought it would. I think the included software is OK, not great but not too bad.If you use IE then you can talk using your microphone but you need to have speakers hooked into the audio jack and the microphone on this camera is very, very poor. The microphone is the only thing that is lacking in this camera and if it worked even moderately, I would have given this camera five stars.The Pros:Easy to setup if you follow the little booklet.The software is OK, great for finding the camera on your network.You can add users and passwords and control the users with accounts.You can chat with people if you use IE, but on mine the microphone in the camera was very much lacking.The night vision is great, much better than I had though.The color is very good and you can adjust the settings as well.Some of the settings will allow you to use MSN and add friends to view the camera. I found this to be helpful if you have a MSN account. I would love to have seen a Skype account.The cons:If you don't follow the little booklet instructions you will be lost for a while.The microphone is crap and you need to hookup speakers in order to take advantage of the camera's audio.Software needs an update.

Reviews.Title: Equivalent to foscam 8918W and saved $20
Reviews.Author: donnoyet
Reviews.Content: This camera works as promised. Could use the camviewer app for iphone. THe dynamic DNS server comes free with the camera purchase...i setup in a few minutes..dont need to spend the extra $20 for the foscam cameraFoscam FI8918W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle)..the annoying LED can be turned off in settings...I have two cameras on wifi and i access them on iphone thru internet like charm...need ti try from outside the home network on laptops..but shudn't be a problem i woul think...d

Reviews.Title: Took a while to set up but works great.
Reviews.Author: LGW
Reviews.Content: I'm decent when it comes to computers and networking.  This took me a while to set up, but now it works great.I have it set up to take a picture every five seconds then FTP it to a laptop. Additionally, it's motion sensitive and emails me six pictures any time it sees movement. Finally, I can access and control it with my Droid phone.The only issue I have right now is I haven't been able to access it remotely from a web browser.  I don't consider that a big deal since I can use my phone.I'm going to keep this for a few months.  If it doesn't fall apart I plan on buying at least three more for the house.

Reviews.Title: A lot of features
Reviews.Author: go Gints!
Reviews.Content: I was thinking of buying a baby video monitor for the kid but didn't want to spend too much since technology keeps changing. Saw this camera and like the other features besides being a baby monitor so when it's not being used at night I have it peeking outside my house. The best part is that my Android phone can be the mobile monitor so you don't need to carry around a separate device. It can also record to a DVR and record when it senses motion but haven't set that up yet. Set up was an hour to get it on home wireless but I've played with home network settings before. Be warned though - not everyone will have the patience for it. Good deal

Reviews.Title: WOW, Impressed
Reviews.Author: Dennis Crawford "Flsoberbear"
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was really impressed once the units arrived at my home, they are rather easy to get setup to view from your home computer, being able to use an Android phone is a lttle harder (Still can not get them configured on my cell phone), but at least I can see them on my Home Network from any computer and can set them to record onto my Hard Drive at home each morning.I am looking at getting a few more once I get paid again.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...........
Reviews.Author: S. McDaniel "S. McDaniel"
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and most were positive and I expected to get what I paid for. Hoped it would exceed expectations but it didn't. Instructions were lacking and translation from Chinese was awful and hard to follow. Camera was OK quality wise but software was not. It only worked full feature with IE8 not Firefox. Camera worked great for 2 days then it crashed and I could never get it back online. Kept getting a error telling me the username and password (supplied with the camera) were invalid. I uninstalled everything a couple times and reinstalled it but it never worked again. Router instructions are very hard to follow also, has too many senarios/possibilities wich makes it confusing................................I returned the camera and got what I should have got the first time, a FOSCAM 910W. Buyer beware, it might work, it might not. Pay a little more and get a good quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera great. Software, not so much.
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: This camera works great! Images are more clear than I expected. IR works quite well. Movement is a little slow but not painfully so.Biggest complaint is that the software interface does not work or detect the camera at all. Just get and error message. No choice but to use the web interface, which is rather clunky and requires some technical knowledge. (Which I have enough of but is too much for many people.) Directions in package are sufficient but tiny.All in all, need to do some work on the back end of this product.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Vincent P. Domeraski "vdomeras"
Reviews.Content: I got the one shown in the picture.  Once I smartened up and added it to my subnet it was simple.  On a Mac, go to Network Preferences and copy the first three numbers of your computer's IP address, then choose a unique (0-255) number for the camera in the setup software.I use Vitamin D software to keep an eye on our second house and chose the Foscam settings.  I works great, although I need to control the pan and tilt with the camera's software as Vitamin D doesn't seem do PT.  This isn't a real problem, since a moving camera would fill my email box and FTP with faux intruders.It's good for checking out the yard during the day but not at night.  I'd love to see an outdoor version of this camera at a similarly low price, as it is useless when pointed at glass or screens at night, unless you are studying bugs, of course.

Reviews.Title: Do not like flashing green light
Reviews.Author: Rob Marriott
Reviews.Content: The camera is very hard to set up on a wireless network, because the instructions are terrible.Once it is set up, it is a decent night vision surveillance camera. However, the green light on the front of the camera, which flashes all the time that it is connected wirelessly, makes it anything but discrete. I bought the camera to watch nocturnal wildlife in my garden - until the wildlife gets used to the flashing green light I won't see any.Having said that, the night vision is very good for the price.Ignore the included setup instructions - go online and search for help.To set it up on your wireless network you must first connect it by Ethernet cable to your wireless router - once you have done that you should be good to go.

Reviews.Title: Fine while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: It worked great while it lasted, which was about a year. The picture quality and functionality was pretty good for the price, but after a year, it just wont stay on. When i plug it in, the green light turns on for 5 seconds, and then turns off, and my computer cannot recognize the camera anymore.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value.
Reviews.Author: S. French
Reviews.Content: I rarely review products.  But in short, this is a great value.  I have been unable to find all of these features: audio in/out, wireless/wired, iphone support, guest accounts, alarms, etc. for anywhere near this price.  The video quality is actually pretty good (for a 640x480 res cam).  Can't complain for the price.  Like others have said, there are better out there, but not for this price.  5 stars.  FYI, the camera I got was branded 'hootoo'.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but still working out the kinks
Reviews.Author: John D. Bryan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for friends that wanted to keep track of their dog while they were both at work.  While I ultimately was able to setup this camera, it took several hours to get the camera working as advertised.  I will admit that I only had a basic knowledge of networking, but the directions included with the camera were far from clear and required a lot of internet searching for extra help.  Further, I have still not been able to get the camera to work wirelessly, even though I followed the directions word for word.  Once the camera was up and running (though only plugged directly into the router), I was very pleased with the results.  I was able to login into the camera from any internet browser and supply the username and password I setup to see the video feed.  Through this website I was able to control the camera's direction and get a full view of the room.  Additionally, an iPhone app called "CamViewer," was available for free, from which you are also able to control the camera.  There is also an Android app that I installed on my friend's phone.  Overall, I would recommend this camera based on it's very affordable price, but be prepared to spend at least a few hours setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Multihour Frustration But Worth It!
Reviews.Author: J. Radke
Reviews.Content: Initial thoughts:I was able to power up the unit, plug in the Ethernet, and login to see video within minutes! First, the IP address of the unit was unknown because I plugged it directly into my laptop not into a network with DHCP. Standalone, my units IP is 192.168.1.111 and uses port 81. I do not plan to hardware so my next task was to setup the wireless. My wireless configuration screen is missing some of the details in the manual but it seem to connect just fine (like the static IP section is gone). Unfortunately, the unit does not show my its IP on the wireless side so I had to determine that from my router.*Warning: Some technical jargon ahead for the geeks. (I'm a net admin so troubleshooting is 1st nature)Here is where the frustration came in. Although I could ping out to my local network and the Internet from the camera fine, I could not reach the camera's IP (over wireless) from any workstation on the LAN. With wireshark I saw that my machines could not resolve the camera's MAC address. For some reason my camera would not respond to ARP requests. If I setup a static ARP entry on any box I could get to the camera just fine. This is definitely a problem for tablets and phones on the network. I saw nothing in the manual or the config of the camera that had restrictions enabled. Eventually I saw the reset button on the bottom of the unit. I held it in for about 30 seconds (probably didn't need that long) and it rebooted. It defaulted the config (good) and I setup the wireless within 10 seconds. Now I can reach the camera via wireless! I have no explanation as to why it was failing from the beginning but I can only hope that it will continue to work.Otherwise, the camera appears to be rather full featured. I'm excited about its functionality and the picture is really good. I plan on using and managing it exclusively without windows which I think is workable for most features. Definitely a cool product for $5x. Just beware that if you need support this product may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for the cost
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the pan-tilt features and am quite pleased with it. I have several other cameras (all Trendnet) and find the picture quality is fairly comparable to them. Network setup is not a problem if you have done it before. The IR is the cheaper red light type, standard in cameras of this price range but it works well. For those not familiar with IR, your display will not be in color and that is normal. Overall I am quite happy with the unit and it is a good value for the cost. For a low cost controllable camera, this is a good bet

Reviews.Title: Fantastic features for the price
Reviews.Author: NYinNJ
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the directions are a bit difficult but if you have basic networking knowledge, this is one of the best, most affordable DIY home monitoring options I can imagine.  I'm going to pick up at least one more.  To be able to control the camera and also toy with the cat (cheap pair of speakers are extra) from anywhere with an internet connection is really cool.

Reviews.Title: Worth the $$
Reviews.Author: Nano
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera for single or multi security systems. The optins are what you would expect on much pricer modles.

Reviews.Title: Works well, hard to get it to work over the internet
Reviews.Author: Msh "msh123"
Reviews.Content: The instructions are hard to understand but I somehow got the camera to work. It works well over the wifi network in my house. Picture quality is 5/10. Did not get the sound to work yet. Did not get the camera to work over the internet and that was the main reason I got the camera for. Any links to get this to work over the internet are welcome!Update 3/20/2012: Camera returned after a lot of hard work.  One fine day, suddenly all the variables on the camera went to "undefined" too. Finally could not get sound to work, and could not get it to forward to the free dns provided. Will buy something else which has customer support number.

Reviews.Title: Awesome! Works on LAN and WAN
Reviews.Author: Spooby
Reviews.Content: All the features are cool. You can have it send photos to an email address for when it detects motion. Has a great range for pan/tilt. I can literally see above/below and even behind this thing. Allows you to listen to audio and has a line out jack, for speakers? I guess so you can talk to the person standing in front if it?The IR illuminator on this is just great! I can see everything at night, even at 20 + feet away!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good depending on your needs
Reviews.Author: Tiberius "Memetic Engineer"
Reviews.Content: For the price, it is hard to complain about this little unit.  I was pretty happy with it at first, but its quirks quickly got the best of me, and i will be returning this unit in search of one that works better for my needs - i am sure i will have to purchase something much more expensive, but it was worth a shot to try this unit. The motion sensing is terrible (at least when sending pics via FTP) - so bad i have been able to walk up to it, wave at the camera, make faces, and walk back and it didn't capture *ANY* of that.Pros: - Wired and wireless networking works great. Wireless has excellent range - good signal at about 100 feet through a brick wall - Pan/Tilt works great - Easy to set up and get working quickly - Image quality isn't bad if you're not concerned about being able to, say, identify license platesCons: - Its motion sensing ability is finicky at best. My inbox is filled with pictures of nothing different. - It only sends a picture once about every 5 seconds when it *thinks* it is sensing motion. - Image quality is not good enough for my purposes (identify license plates) - Often jpegs are corrupt - sometimes blank, sometimes the pic is visible but the file has bad bits causing error in thumbnail (using gallery software to organize pics with thumbnails)All in all, it's not a bad camera - especially for the price.  Take my criticisms with a grain of salt - I think this camera would do best on your porch or inside monitoring a hallway.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Sports Fan "DJ"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. Wireless setup was pretty easy and took 15-20 minutes. The instructions might be a little confusing for non-technical people.I'm using camera as baby monitor and I love picture quality and night vision. Blinking green status LED is annoying but you can turn it off. I'm using free CamViewer and IPCAM Lite apps on iPhone. So far no issues.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and features for the price.
Reviews.Author: MikeN
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera with awesome features for the price. However, it does take a little time and intelligence to get everything working.I'll make it easy for you though and refer you to this website ( [...] which has guides to setting your camera up and viewing it remotely over the internet.If I had that web address when I was trying to setup the camera, I would have saved myself 2 hours.I have successfully gotten the camera setup and have the alarm set and the camera emails me pictures when it picks up motion. I am currently setting it up for port forwarding via the guide in the website mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: Super cool !
Reviews.Author: Richard Andrew Pinckley Sr.
Reviews.Content: Pans ! Tilts ! Zooms In / Out / Microphone on unit ! Speaker jack on unit to plug in speaker to talk to anyone near unit ! Well worth the price ! Thinking about ordering 8 more units ! ( system handles 9 units ! Very pleased with simplicity of operation !

Reviews.Title: Great Cam!!
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeGeek
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the $$. The camera controls like it should and connects to wireless AP with no problems. We have it set up to e-mail us alerts based on the sensitivity and it is awesome to see when we are not in room or go out and leave our daughter with a babysitter. The audio is OK and have not figured out how to talk through or record video with camera. Not sure of this functionality but then I wasn't looking for that in the first place.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: These cameras are amazing for the price. We use them for surveillance at work and I use them personally at home. Easy setup, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: how to setup on mac, slightly painful
Reviews.Author: John P. Eggers
Reviews.Content: I would go to either of these threads to set up this camera on a mac using a mac router such as airport extreme.  This took a while.  IF anyone knows of a way to set up a dns syn account for free so that I can remotely access the cameras that would be great.  ThanksThe included instructions are extremely painful for setting this up with wifi.Cons: doesnt work nearly as well without IE. Sig reduced # of functions available.  Cant record or do a multitude of other things, but if there are ways to use safari or firefox to attain IE features I have not discovered them yet (still working on getting vlc to run the video which may help with this).Good luck. Overall, not bad for $50 or $60 as a baby cam.[...][...]

Reviews.Title: Excelente Cámara
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Funciona muy bien, la imagen se ve con muy buena calidad. Estoy  contento con la compra, la recomiendo. / It works great, the picture looks very good quality. I'm happy with the purchase, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: my 2nd rate
Reviews.Author: Janet Lyons
Reviews.Content: After having problems with cd and giving a low rate  they e mail me with help . I didn't ask for their help but they gavehelp to get my camera up and running. The camera is great ..  love it.. I am a dog breeder and love to set up for mynew puppy owners to watch their pup grow ..  THANKS FOR SUCH A GREAT CAMERA(S)..

Reviews.Title: Has worked very well for the intended purpose and price
Reviews.Author: Todd Chamberlain
Reviews.Content: This camera was fairly easy to setup (thanks to other reviewers for posting instructions).  The only thing missing for us was a way to hear/talk via our phones (the web interface only allows you to view the image or move the camera).  Eventually, found an iphone/ipad app called 'LiveCams Pro' which works perfectly with the camera.  With this app, you view the camera, hear/talk through the camera, and change most of the camera settings. Works well for us.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Darken
Reviews.Content: Make sure you read through the other reviews. This camera is great, if you know what you're doing. Would be very difficult to setup for a novice user, though.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: rafournet
Reviews.Content: Pros:Can't beat the price.It only took 20 minutes to get it working.Motion detection alerts to email is a nice feature.RX and TX audio is cool, it does have a built in speaker also.Cons:Don't know what a lot features do because the manual doesn't cover it.Online support is a joke.Can only use all the web features with IE.Poor focus depth, and manual focus ring adjustment is difficult.Image clarity not so great.No zoom.

Reviews.Title: works perfectly
Reviews.Author: lpd181
Reviews.Content: Sure you get what you pay for but this exceeded my expectations. Instructions were simple, software was self explanatory, almost plug and play. Was wireless with mobile connect in about ten minutes. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Very cool camera
Reviews.Author: GC_From_SC
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool little camera.  You can view the images in any browser and on your smart phone.
